loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Con su credikiva anterior Nelly compró mucha mercancia que vendió, recuperó la invesión y ganó dinero. Ella está muy satisfecha y entusiasmada con su credikiva, por lo cual está aplicando a un nuevo credito, con el que comprará nuevamente mercancia, pero ajustada a la temporada a propósito de la celebración del dia del amor y de la amistad, por eso invertirá en detalles femeninos, rosas, boligrafos, accesorios de hogar, ropa calzado y perfume, además de sus fabulosos y frios refrescos y bebidas. Su inversión tendrá éxito en tanto está invirtiendo en una época, en la cual su negocio incrementa sus venta y es una de las buenas temporadas del año para el comercio. Su mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva es el siguiente: "Felicitaciones sigagannos apoyando, porque necesitamos personas como ustedes."
texts.en: Nelly used her previous Kiva loan to buy much merchandise that she sold.  She recovered her investment and earned money.  She’s very satisfied with and excited about the new Kiva loan that she’s applying for that she’ll use to once again buy merchandise adjusted to the season.  Because the Day of Love and Friendship is approaching she will buy women’s accessories, roses, pens, items for the home, clothes, shoes and perfume in addition to her fabulous, cold beverages and soft-drinks.  Her investment will be successful in that she’s investing in a season in which business increases and this is one of the year’s best seasons for commerce.  Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: “Congratulations.  Continue supporting us because we need people like you.”

loans.use: to buy women's accessories, roses, pens, home items, clothes, shoes and perfume.

loans.name: Marelyn

texts.en:
Marelyn is a newly recognized member of PMPC. She is 44 years old and married with three adult children. Marelyn has been selling gasoline for nine years with average monthly earnings of 3,000 Philippine pesos. 

Marilyn decided to be part of PMPC to have financial access to support her business. She took out a loan with PMPC to purchase additional stock of gasoline to sell. She is hoping to increase her monthly income to meet family needs and to save some money for the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional gasoline for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy jugs of refined palm oil.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane runs a little booth, where she sells fruits and vegetables. Gayane started this business in 2009. Now Gayane needs some investments to add more produce. In particular, she plans to purchase walnuts and garlic. This will allow Gayane to be competitive in the market and attract more customers.
 
Gayane lives with her husband, two sons, daughter-in-law and little grandchild. Development of the business is important for her to earn sufficient income and sustain the family.

loans.use: to pay for walnuts and garlic.

loans.name: Abd Al Wahab

texts.en: Abd Al Wahab is a 49-year-old married man from Irbid, Jordan. He has six children. He wants to take a 1,500 JOD loan to pay for his resturant improvements. The resturant's name is "Al Mukhtar". He plans to open a new branch of his restaurant in another place, and to buy a car.

loans.use: to pay for improvements to his restaurant.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha, de oficio comerciante, dueña de una abarrotería, habitante de la ciudad de Granada. Fue beneficiada con un crédito, el cual utilizo para invertir en compras de productos comestibles, esto le ayudo a mejorar sus ingresos, de las ganancias ha ido pagando los estudios de su hijo. Esta agradecida por el apoyo a su negocio. En esta ocasión está requiriendo un crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar y aceite al por mayor. De esta manera podrá conseguirlo más barato y vender a un precio más accesibles a sus clientes que a diario le solicitan estos productos.
texts.en:
Martha, a merchant, is the owner of a grocery story. She lives in the city of Granada. 

She was granted a previous loan, which she used to buy edible products. This helped her to improve her income. With the profits she has been paying for her child’s education. She is grateful for the support of her business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, sugar, and oil mostly. The loan will allow her to purchase the goods at a cheaper price and sell them to her clients at an affordable price. Her clients ask daily for these products.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Cheryl is 27 years old, and married with two children, both of whom are minors. She lives in Bino-ongan, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor.  Cheryl has operated an existing snack making and selling business for a period of three years, earning PHP 2,500 per month. She decided to be a member of PMPC this year to have financial access to support her business.  Aside from selling snacks, she started raising pigs to increase the household income.  She took a loan in PMPC to purchase feed for the raised piglets. She wants to used the profit to feed her children.

loans.use: to purchase feed for pigs.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Sarah is a single woman. She describes herself to be an diligent and ambitious woman.  She operates a restaurant where she sells soft drinks. Her business is located within a busy environment and her primary customers are residents from the environs. She describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition. 

Sarah will use th KES 20,000 loan to to buy soft drinks to resell. Her business goal is to run a bigger restaurant and hotel within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she can buy a van for venturing into a new business of providing transportation services to customers.

loans.use: buy soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 50 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a teacher and brings in additional income to sustain the family. Jane runs a boutique shop in Kapsabet, a business which has been in operation for five years, earning Kenya shillings 30,000 monthly. 

This is her second loan with KADET Ltd, after successfully repaying her previous loan, and she plans to use the loan to purchase new clothes for resale. 

She hopes that her business prospers so as to earn more profits in the future.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes for resale.

loans.name: Avetik

texts.en: Avetik lives in Vernashen village with his parents.  He serves in the local military unit. In addition, he helps his parents to run the family farm where they raise cows, hens and grow fruit trees. Avetik would like to purchase one more calf for the farm, as well as buy grass to feed the cattle during winter. This will help Avetik to keep a stable development of the farm and continue its expansion.

loans.use: buy a calf and cattle feed

location.town: Vernashen village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Cherlita

texts.en: Cherlita is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Cherlita has a food/retail shop (or sari-sari store), where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale. Cherlita has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene is a 39-year-old widowed woman.  She has 3 children with ages ranging from 12 years to 22 years. She describes herself to be a very ambitious woman.  She operates a retail stall where she sells clothes.   Magdalene has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located within a potential business environment.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for selling a wide variety types of clothes. 

Magdalene will use this KES 20,000 loan to to buy two bales of clothes for resale. Her business goal is to run many such similar retail stalls within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business.

loans.use: buy two bales of trousers

loans.name: Aderine

texts.en: Adeline 20 years old. She is married to a businessman. She owns a boutique where she has different items that she sells. Adeline has been running the business for four years. She wants the loan to buy more rice, salt, and cooking oil to resell.  The profits from the business will be used to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: buy rice, salt and cooking oil to resell

loans.name: Mwanakame

texts.en:
Mwanakame is a businesswoman who runs a firewood selling business in the town of Msambweni, Kenya.  She has had her business for around eight years. After successfully repaying her previous loans, she is ready for another one and will invest it all in her business, which she started with her little savings before taking out her first loan.  

Mwanakame  is dedicated to her business since it is her only source of livelihood, apart from the little income from her spouse who is a fisherman.   Mwanakame will use this loan to expand her business inventory by purchasing more firewood for sale. 

Mwanakame lives with her long-term partner and their six children. She said her most difficult challenge is to thrive with her business. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: buy firewood to resell

loans.name: Sivia

texts.en:
Sivia is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children, with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Sivia has been working hard to manage his stationery business, which does printing, binding and book selling.

To help expand his business, Sivia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a computer and other more stationery materials like books and a binding machine, and will help Sivia to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  Sivia hopes that in the future he will be able to own a bigger and well-stocked stationery shop. 

Sivia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sivia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: buy a computer, books and a binding machine

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna lives in Vernashen village with her father and brother. Anna's brother works at a local factory, and helps Anna and their father to run the farm where they raise cattle and grow fruit trees. Anna has applied for this loan to purchase one more calf for the farm. In addition, she wants to purchase forage to feed the cattle during winter. These purchases will allow Anna to keep gathering a stable income from agriculture and invest in its further development.

loans.use: buy a calf and forage

location.town: Vernashen village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Berard

texts.en:
Berard is a 35-year-old married man.  He has 5 children. He describes himself to be self-motivated man.  He operates a food stall  where he sells cereals such as maize, beans, etc. He has been involved in this business for 3 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located within a potential business area.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high transportation cost of cereals. 

Berard will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy ten bags of maize.  His business goal is to be a large supplier of maize within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will be a successful businessman.  Berard also does farming, which increases his business income. This is his first loan.

loans.use: buy ten bags of maize

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married and has 4 children.  Conchita  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. 

Conchita requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Conchita  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Conchita hopes to improve her business for the education of her grandchildren.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Wafa'a

texts.en:
Wafa'a is a 21-year-old single woman from Sahab, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to buy clothes and blankets to resell.  She wants to sell her products to her friends and neighbors.  Also, she would like to expand her project by increase her products. In the future she hopes to increase her family's income.

Since Wafa'a is under 30 years old her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: buy clothes and blankets to resell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 22 years old and from Gaza. He owns a small shop selling all kinds of fresh juices in an area where there is no other shop that does the same. Ahmad asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a display refrigerator and an ice maker refrigerator. He hopes that this youth loan will increase his customers and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a display refrigerator and an ice maker refrigerator

loans.name: Basma

texts.en: Basma is a 37-year-old married woman who has four family members and lives in Marka, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for food items to sell in her market. She would like to expand her business by opening another big market. In the future she hopes to buy a car and to increase her income.

loans.use: to pay for food items to sell.

loans.name: Daysi Auxiliadora

texts.es: Daysi de 29 años de edad, originaria de Granada, tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, ella es comerciante, propietaria de una pulpería. Este negocio lo inicio a la edad de 27 años con el apoyo de su esposo, quien aporto económicamente. Ella comercializa sus productos de pulpería en su casa de habitación. Se siente satisfecha en el lugar donde comercializa por la preferencia de sus clientes y como expectativa tiene seguir creciendo en su negocio, el cual le permita la sostenibilidad económica de los futuros estudios de su pequeño hijo. Solicita este crédito con el fin de comprar materiales de construccion y  construir un pequeño cuarto para ubicar su pulpería en un lugar más cómodo  ya que la tiene en  la sala de su casa. Ella estima que este crédito va a mejorar las condiciones del negocio ya que ubicara sus productos de pulpería como granos básicos, lácteos, verduras, productos para limpieza del hogar, en el lugar más visible. Una de sus metas es seguir invirtiendo en productos varios con los que no cuenta en estos momentos su negocio y asi poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Daysi, 29, is originally from Granada and has a 2-year old son. She is a merchant and is the owner of a small grocery store. She started this business when she was 27 years old with the support of her husband, who contributed financially. She sells her products from her small store from her home in which she lives. She is satisfied with her business location because of her customers’ preferences and as she expected, she will continue to grow her business which will allow her to financially support schooling for her young son in the future. 

She is requesting this loan with the goal of buying construction supplies and building a small room in order to move her grocery store to a more comfortable location because currently, it is located in her living room. She believes this loan will improve her business’ condition because she will position her grocery store products, such as grains, dairy, vegetables, and cleaning products, in a more visible location. 

One of her goals is to continue investing in a variety of products which she does not have right now and in this way, be able to satisfy her customer’s demands.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies in order to relocate her business

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a young entrepreneur who is married and has two children. In order to contribute economically to her household, she runs a food stall, where she sells a variety of food, such as dumplings, beans, rice, etc. Now that she is married, her stall still provides economic support for her family, and also allows her to contribute, along with her husband, to her children's education. In an effort to offer a wider variety of foods to her customers, and taking advantage of this festive season, Mwanamisi is requesting a loan to buy wheat flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil.

Her greatest dream is that through her business she can continue offering her family economic stability, as well as providing good quality services to her customers.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mariana Mercedes

texts.es:
Mariana Mercedes tiene 40 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz.

Mariana Mercedes se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Las compras y las ventas las realiza en Ventanas cada mes.

Solicita el crédito para comprar de semillas, urea, fertilizantes. ranger y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para cubrir gastos de la familia. El sueño es contar siempre con buena salud para poder trabajar.

En el tiempo libre le gusta leer la biblia.
texts.en:
Mariana Mercedes is 40 years old and married. She lives with her husband and children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The Communal Bank “San Francisco de Sibimbe” is located in the neighborhood of Recinto Sibimbe in the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank has 20 members who engage in short-cycle farming. They grow corn and rice.

Mariana Mercedes is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and pigeon peas. Her purchases and sales are conducted in Ventanas each month. She is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, urea, fertilizers, Ranger (a brand of herbicide), and compost. With the help of this loan, she will be able to cover her family’s expenses. Her dream is to always be in good health and able to work.

In her free time, Mariana Mercedes enjoys reading the Bible.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, fertilizers, herbicide, and compost.

loans.name: Buenaventurada

texts.en: Buenaventurada is 57 years old and married with nine children, three of whom are school age.  She's been a member of PMPC since 2010 under the micro-finance program.  She has had a business selling snacks for four years with a monthly income of PHP 1,500.  She took another loan from PMPC to purchase raw materials to make snacks to sell.  She is planning to use the profit to support the family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make snacks to sell

loans.name: Gantugs

texts.en: Mr. Gantugs is 32 years old – one of the hardworking guys. He operates a taxi business around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since 2006, he has been running his business nonstop. He lives with his two daughters and his wife in an old house in the ger district – an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. In the winter, his house becomes very cold inside and his daughters always get sick due to feeling cold at home. His house loses too much heat through its old floor. So, Mr. Gantugs decided to get a new wooden floor for his house. He really hopes that his house will be warmer and more comfortable after this. The loan he is requesting will be used to cover the cost of the new wooden floor for his house.

loans.use: to cover the cost of a new wooden floor for his house.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Sahar prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her stepson.

Sahar is a 32-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Jordan. She has 4 children and requested a loan to pay for some home improvements and painting.

loans.use: To pay for home improvements

loans.name: Khader

texts.en:
Khader is 47 years old and is from Gaza. He is married and has four children.

Khader has owned a grocery store since 2005 where he sells food, canned food, detergents, and other items. He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy more goods for his shop and a new refrigerator.

His ambition is to settle down in his own house since his family lives in the big family's house. He hopes that this loan will help him achieve his ambition by increasing his income.

loans.use: to buy more goods for his shop and a new refrigerator

loans.name: Buena Vista Lll Group

texts.es:
El comité Buena Vista 3 esta compuesto por 10 integrantes que son todas vecinas de la misma comunidad. El comité  no tiene mucha experiencia en el  trabajo grupal, ya que es poco el tiempo que trabajan juntas de igual manera  se reunen cada semana para compartir comunicar e interiorizarse de las novedades que se generan dentro del grupo, a resolver sus indiferencias etc. 
Una de las integrantes,la señora Delia se dedica a la venta de chipa y con los ingresos que ella tiene ayuda a su marido en los gastos de su hogar.
El crédito solicitado sería para comprar los ingredientes necesarios para seguir produciendo la chica casera, necesita almidón, harina de maíz, leche, huevos, etc para que su producto sea de calidad y muy sabroso.
texts.en:
The committee named “Buena Vista III” consists of 10 members who are all neighbors from the same community. This committee does not have much experience working as a communal group. In the short time they have worked together each week, they have been able to share and communicate with one another so that they can internalize their new responsibilities as a group and resolve their differences.

One of the members is Sra. Delia, who sells “chipa” (cheese bread). With the income she earns, she is able to help her husband with the household expenses. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy necessary ingredients that she needs to continue producing cheese bread such as starch, corn flour, milk, eggs, and other items. These ingredients will help her make a flavorful and high-quality product.

loans.use: to buy starch, corn flour, milk, eggs, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Ida

texts.en: Ida is a newly recognized member of PMPC.  She is 55 years old and married with seven adult-age children.  She decided to join PMPC to gain access to financial services for her business.  She has been making and selling snacks for 20 years, and she receives an average monthly income of PHP 2,000.  She out took her first loan from PMPC to purchase additional ingredients to make snacks to sell.  She wants to use the profits to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients to make snacks

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Trabajadoras se encuentra en su noveno ciclo, tiene 12 integrantes, todas ellas muy emprendedoras y agradecidas a la fundación ya que día a día van creciendo tanto personalmente como a nivel laboral.
Laura, una de las integrantes del grupo, se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su despensa, desea seguir creciendo a nivel variedad de productos, agrandar su negocio y tener mayores ingresos ya que esta actividad le ayuda a la manutención de su familia.
Solicita el crédito para comprar productos lácteos, panificados, frutas,hortalizas, etc y de esta manera poder llegar a cubrir la mayor cantidad de necesidades de su clientela y la suya también.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Trabajadoras [Hard-Working Women] communal bank is in its ninth cycles.  It has 12 members, and all of them are very enterprising.  They are grateful to the Fundación because they are growing every day as much personally as on a work level.

Laura is one of the members of the group.  She sells basic needs products in her small grocery store.  She wishes to continue growing by having a variety of products, making her business bigger, and having greater income.  She wants this because this business activity helps to support her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy dairy products, baked goods, fruits, and vegetables, etc.  This way she will be able to cover her customers’, and her own, greater quantity of necessities.

loans.use: to buy baked goods, dairy products, and sausages, etc.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married mother of three boys who are in school. She works every day to be able to fill the role of father and mother for her children.

She opened a food stall, which is located in a very populated neighborhood in the area. She is a very responsible person who wants to get ahead. She has a jovial and entrepreneurial spirit and there is no doubt that she will meet all of the goals she has set for herself.

With the loan, she wants to buy more ingredients such as baking powder, cooking oil, flour, etc. This will enable her to offer a variety of foods to her customers even as she maximizes profits.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as baking powder, cooking oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Maricar has a store that sells used clothes. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy used clothes to resell like blouses, pants and skirts.

Maricar is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Maricar hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more used cloths to resell

loans.name: Marie Christine

texts.fr: Marie est une femme commerçante de 29 ans. Elle a ouvert une alimentation  dans un quartier de la capitale qu'elle gere depuis 3 ans deja. Son petit commerce fonctionne grace à son acceuiel chaleureux, son experience dans ce domaine lui ont permis d’acquérir et fidéliser une  clientèle  avec le temps. Cette dernière devient importante et là, Elle n'arrive plus à la satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter en détail.Il solicite ce credit pour renforcer son petit fond de commerce pour diversifier sa marchandise (riz, sel, l'eau minerale,cartons de sucres, des friandise,...), et pouvoir augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Elle réinvestira une partie de son bénéfice dans l’activité pour couvrir les besoins de son secteur et l'autre partie lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie, age 29, is a merchant. She runs a grocery store that he opened in a district of the capital three years ago. The small business is successful thanks to her warmth, her experience, and her loyal clientele, which is steadily growing. However, she is no longer able to meet customer demand due to her limited capital, which forces her to buy her stock at retail.  

She is seeking this loan to strengthen her working capital by diversifying her merchandise (rice, salt, mineral water, cartons of sugar, candy, etc.). This should help to bolster her profits. She plans to reinvest a portion of these profits in her activity to cover some business expenses, and she will use the remainder to support herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, salt, mineral water, cartons of sugar, candy, etc.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Iman prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband. Iman is a 34-year-old married woman who supports five family members. She lives in Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to pay for some home improvements. She will repaint her home and buy new furniture. She hopes to buy a new home in the future.

loans.use: To pay for some home improvements

loans.name: Sharifah

texts.en: Sharifah is a 32-year-old married female from Al Aqaba, Jordan. She has four children. She wants a loan of 800 JOD to buy used clothes and sell them afterwards. With her first loan, she bought half a container of used clothes. Now she wants to buy a whole container. In the future, she wants to open a shop to sell used clothes.

loans.use: to buy used clothes to sell

loans.name: Mouayad

texts.en: Mouayad is a 27-year-old married male, from Ashrafia, Jordan. He has a child. Mouayad requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for his education at university. In the future he wants to continue his higher education. Since Mouayad is under 30 years old, his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for his education at university

loans.name: Clara Irene

texts.es:
La señora Clara es una pequeña comerciante, ubicada en el municipio de san Rafael del sur, Managua, Nicaragua.
Ella tiene un local de comidas fritas en el costado norte del mercado municipal de san Rafael del sur, ofrece comidas como enchiladas, tacos nicaragüenses, tajados con queso y con carne, y refrescos naturales.

Su plan de inversión es para ampliar el servicio que ofrece, ya que en estos últimos meses gracias al buen servicio que brinda, ha experimentado que su producto tiene una buena aceptación a los clientes que visitan el mercado municipal.

Anteriormente doña clara producía y vendía tortillas, y ahora gracias a su iniciativa tiene su pequeño negocio personal de comideria donde cree que tiene un gran potencial de crecer como comerciante.
Su estado civil es acompañada, tiene cuatro hijos, dos de ellos casados, y dos en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Clara has a small business located in the town of San Rafael del Sur in Managua, Nicaragua.

She owns a fried foods stall on the north side of the local market in San Rafael del Sur. She offers dishes such as enchiladas, nicaraguan tacos, fried plantains with cheese or meat, and natural soft drinks.

Her investment plan is to expand the services she offers because, thanks to the good service she provides, in recent months she has seen how her products are well received by the customers who visit the local market.

In the past, Clara made and sold tortillas and now, by her own initiative, she has her own personal small food business where she believes there is great potential for growth.

She lives with her partner and has four children. Two of them are married and the other two are school-age.

loans.use: to purchase beef, chicken, pork, and vegetables.

loans.name: Jimmy Francisco

texts.es: Jimmy, de oficio comerciante, habitante de la ciudad de Granada, dueño de una pulpería. El solicito su primer crédito para comprar mercadería para surtir su pulpería, esto le permitió el mejorar sus ingresos, suplir parte de las necesidades de sus clientes. Ahora quiere surtir de nuevos productos su pulpería, es por eso que solicita un crédito para comprar cosméticos, shampoo, cremas para la piel ,productos de limpieza, granos básicos. Esto le permitirá seguir ofreciendo variedad, atraer nuevos clientes y mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Jimmy, a shopkeeper, lives in Granada where he owns a small general store.  He is requesting his first loan to purchase merchandise to stock his store, which will permit him to meet some of his customers’ needs.  Now, he wishes to stock his store with new products such as cosmetics, shampoo, skin cream, cleaning products, and basic grains.  This will allow him to continue offering variety, attract new customers, and improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase  cosmetics, shampoo, skin cream, cleaning products, and basic grains.

loans.name: Irene Elizabeth

texts.es:
IRENE TIENE 23 AÑOS DE EDAD VIVE EN UNION LIBRE CON EL COMPAÑERO Y CON CON LOS HIJOS VIVEN EN LA CUIDAD DE VENTANAS PROVINCIA DE LOS RIOS.

LA VENTANILLA EL LAUREL SE ENCUENTRAS UBICADA EN EL RECINTO EL ALUREL DE LA PARROQUIA ZAPOTAL NUEVO PERTENECIENTE AL CANTON VENTANAS SE DEDICA A LABORES AGRICOLAS

IRENE SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRA DE MAIZ, ARROZ Y FREJOL ADEMAS A LA CRIANZA DE GALLINAS Y CERDOS, CON CREDITO LE AYUDADO A INVERTIR EN SEMILLAS, ABONOS, Y FERTILIZANTES PARA LOS CULTIVOS Y EN BALANCEADO PARA LOS ANIMALES.  EL CREDITO ES DE GRAN AYUDA PARA AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION.

EL SUEÑO DE IRENE ES MEJORAR LOS CULTIVOS PARA TENER MAS PRODUCION Y PAGAR UNAS DEUDAS.

LE GUSTA BAILAR Y VER NOVELAS.
texts.en:
Irene is 23 years old and in a common-law relationship with her partner. They and their children live in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The Communal Bank “El Laurel” is located the neighborhood of El Laurel in Zapotal Nuevo Parish, which is in the canton of Ventanas. The members engage in farm work.

Irene is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. In addition, she raises chickens and pigs. This loan will help her to invest in seeds, compost, and fertilizers for her crops and balanced feed for her animals. The loan will also be helpful with increasing production.

Irene dreams of improving her crops so that she can produce more and use the earnings to pay off some debts. In her free time, she enjoys dancing and watching soap operas.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals and seeds, compost, and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is now married and has two children. He is still running his general store and now his income has increased to 24,000 KES. 

This is will be Titus' third loan with KADET LTD, after successfully paying his previous loans well. He is going to use this loan to purchase sugar, rice, some bales of maize flour, and cooking oil for resale. He plans to use the profits to repay his loan and the will use the remaining amount to buy a plot of land. 

His hope and dream is to open a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, some bales of maize flour, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.es: EL SR. LEPOLDO TIENE 56 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES UN HOMBRE VIUDO DESDE HACE YA VARIOS AÑOS Y TIENE 3 HIJOS GRANDES. VIVE SOLO EN SU CASA Y TIENE UN NEGOCIO PROPIO DE ABARROTES UBICADO EN SU MISMO DOMICILIO. EL SR. LEOPOLDO DESEA HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO, YA QUE DESDE HACE MAS DE 12 AÑOS, ES LA UNICA FUENTE DE INGRESOS QUE TIENE PARA CUBRIR SUS NECESIDADES. POR ESTE MOTIVO SOLICITA EL APOYO DE UN PRESTAMO PARA REALIZAR LA COMPRA DE MERCANCIA NUEVA QUE LE DE LA OPORTUNIDAD DE OFRECER MAS VARIEDAD A SUS CLIENTES Y LE AYUDE A IMPULSAR MAS SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Leopoldo is 56 years old. He became a widower several years ago and has three adult children. He lives alone in his house and owns a general store which is located in his home. 

Leopoldo wants to expand his business, because for over twelve years it has been the only source of income he has had to cover his expenses.

That is why he is requesting a loan to help him purchase new merchandise that will allow him to offer his customers more variety and to stimulate his business.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Basmah

texts.en: Basmah is a 44-year-old married female from Al Nasser, Jordan. She has requested a 600 JOD loan to pay for clothing to sell. She wants to increase the family's income by entering the market of clothing sales. In the future, she wants to buy a house and get her children educated in a university.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira lives in Sisian Town with her husabnd, son and daughter. Naira is a lawyer and works at a local company and her husband works at a construcion company. However, the couple also run a farm, which allows them to have independant source of income besides their salaries. 

Naira and her husband raise cattle and cultivate wheat, barley and potatoes. Naira has applied for this loan to purchase two heifers. This will allow Naira to keep increasing their number of cattle and earn additional income.

loans.use: to pay for two heifers.

loans.name: Doaa

texts.en:
Doaa is a 23-year-old single woman from Al Aqaba, Jordan. She is requesting a 500 JOD loan to buy clothes and sell them afterwards. In the future, she plans to buy larger amounts of clothing for resale and open a small shop.

Since Doaa is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Memkadi

texts.en:
Memkadi lives with her husband and their six children. She manages a convenience food stall that sells basic dishes. This business has emerged as an alternative to generate revenue. It has grown slowly through her experience over eight years. Memkadi's hours are from 5:30 am until 8:00 pm.
 
Memkadi is requesting a loan to invest in the business by buying meats, beans, firewood, and cooking oil. This loan will help to improve her availability and the business, and thus increase her profits.

Memkadi's aspiration is to have her own retail shop in the future, and to work with money for her business so that she can improve her profit.

loans.use: to buy meat, beans, firewood, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Yousra

texts.en: Yousra is a 45-year-old single woman from Sahab, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to buy materials for her beauty salon and she would like to improve and expand her salon. She hopes to increase her income in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for her beauty salon

loans.name: Mwanausi

texts.en:
Mwanausi, 40, lives with her life companion and their three children in her own house. She sells basic dishes in a small food stall such as beans, flat breads, and dumplings, among others. She’s had this small business for years, and it has provided her with a good sales experience. She has a large clientele, because people prefer her due to her quality foods, hygienic practices, accessible prices, and above all for her excellent service.

Mwanausi is an enterprising, energetic woman who very much wants to get ahead. She is always looking for alternatives that will open doors to a more prosperous future, and she does not plan to give up until she reaches it.

The demand for more varieties of foods has increased, and so she is requesting a loan to invest in her business so as to meet these demands. She plans to purchase meat, cooking oil, wheat flour, etc. She is sure that she will be able to repay the loan while offering her family a full life at the same time.

loans.use: To purchase meat, cooking oil, wheat flour, etc.

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis is 27 years old and he lives in Vanadzor city.  He graduated from Yerevan State Medical University and now he attends the same University’s clinical study courses (residency). He is a first year student of residency and his specialization is, ear, nose and throat (ENT). 

Sargis is asking for a 400.000 AMD loan to pay for his tuition fee for the first semester.  He is sure that after graduation he will be able to get a job in a hospital.  He has always dreams of being a doctor. 

Now he works as an engineer assistant. His present occupation allows him to support himself and his younger brother as well.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee for the first semester.

loans.name: Shireen

texts.en:
Shireen is a 33 year old married woman who has five family members from Bani Kenanah Irbid, Jordan. 

She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for home improvements; she wants to do maintenance on the rooms.  She hopes to buy new electronics and create a comfortable space for her family.

(Due to cultural reasons Shireen prefers that her photo not appear on the Internet.  The above photo is of her brother.)

loans.use: to buy new electronics.

loans.name: Mwamize

texts.en:
Mwamize is 35 years old and lives in the town of Msambweni in the coastal region of Kenya. She is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past 12 years, Mwamize has been working hard to manage her food stall where she sells various foodstuffs. She also sells petrol to motorcycle taxi operators.

To help expand her business, she has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Yehu. This is her third loan. She will use half of the loan to buy foodstuffs like wheat flour, sugar, etc. and half to buy gallons of petrol. The loan will help Mwamize to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to get more loans from Yehu to expand her businesses.

loans.use: to buy gallons of petrol and foodstuffs like wheat flour, sugar, etc

loans.name: Ameenah

texts.en: Ameenah is a 35 year old divorced female.  She has requested a 400 JOD loan to open a clothes and cosmetics shop.  In the future, she would like to have a retail store and increase her family income.

loans.use: to open a clothes and cosmetics shop.

loans.name: Mnani

texts.en:
Mnani is 35 years old and lives in the town of Msambweni, Kenya.  She is widowed and has three children, all of whom attend school.

 For the past nine years, Mnani has been working hard to operate her firewood selling business, selling from her home.  She says that she is determined despite the challenges has since her husband passed on. She knows that she has to work hard to provide for her children, now that she is the bread winner.

To help expand her business and continue getting income to sustain her family, Mnani has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Yehu to purchase more stock of firewood for sale. Mnani hopes that in the future she will be able to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood.

loans.name: Seda

texts.en: Seda lives in Agarak with her husband and son. She raises cattle and grows a large variety of fruit trees. Seda has applied for this loan to purchase more milk cows. This will help her to gather more milk and get additional income from the sales.

loans.use: to pay for cows

loans.name: Moutaza

texts.en:
Moutaza is a 41 year old married woman who supports five family members.  She lives in Marka Amman, Jordan. 

Moutaza is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to pay for home improvements as she will be repainting her home.  

She also hopes to buy a car and home in the future.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Maysaa

texts.en: Maysaa is a 43 year old married woman from Marka, Jordan.  She has five children and requests a 900 JOD loan to pay for her home improvements.  She wants to buy furniture and paint.  In the future, Maysaa would like to buy a car and get her children educated.

loans.use: to buy furniture and paint.

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en:
Chanthou is from a rural village in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cambodia.  She is a 52-year-old widowed mother of two children.  As a widow, she has struggled to feed her children by selling snacks in her local area.  Having been in this business for twenty-nine years, she is able to earn about 12,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Chanthou’s group consists of four members who live in the same village.  This is the first loan for her group from VisionFund.  She and her three members are requesting a loan of 350,000KHR each.  As the leader, she will use her portion to buy materials for constructing a decent latrine.  She'll need cement, bricks and latrine pan etc. 

She hopes this loan will enable her family to have a clean latrine for daily consumption so as to improve a healthy standard of living.

loans.use: to buy materials for constructing a decent latrine.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
Jose, vive con su esposa y un hijo,  se dedica a la siembra de maíz, maicillo, también a la ganadería, tiene tres años de estar realizando estos cultivos y lo aprendió por sus padres, él alquila el terreno donde realiza la siembra y donde aguarda el ganado.

Solicita un préstamo para comprarse materiales como el abono, herbicida, concentrado para el ganado y el pago de mozos, este préstamo le ayudará a mejorar la producción del maíz y también poder mantener el alimento para la ganadería, espera tener buenos resultados ya que su riesgo en los cultivos es el clima.

Su aspiración es mejorar la vivienda, comprarse otros terneros, construir y seguir trabajando agregando más cultivos a las tierras, ya que esto le permitirá generar mejores ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his wife and child. He grows corn and sorghum, but he also raises cattle. Jose has been in business for three years and learned his trade from his parents. He rents a plot of land where he grows his crops and keeps his cattle.

Jose is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies such as compost, herbicide, as well as concentrated feed for his cattle. He will also pay his workers. This loan will help him to improve his corn production and maintain the diet of his animals. He hopes to achieve good results. The main threat to his crops is bad weather.

Jose’s aspirations include improving his home, buying more steers, pursuing building projects, and continuing to work by growing additional crops on his land. This will help him generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to pay his workers and to buy compost, herbicide, and concentrated animal feed.

loans.name: Solanda Maricela

texts.es:
Solanda Maricela tiene 33 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 2 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 15 y 11 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LAS PALMAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto campo Alegre, Pertenece al Cantón Bab se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Solanda se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz hace 5 años. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y comprar abonos agrícolas. Con la ayuda del crédito se le hará más fácil al adquirir los insumos.

El sueño es poder tener casa propia. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta visitar a la mamá.
texts.en: Solanda Maricela is 33 years old, lives in a common-law marriage, and has two children.  She lives with her husband and children, ages 15 and 11, in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos province.  She is a member of the “Las Palmas” Communal Bank located in the “Campo Alegre” precinct, belonging to the Baba Canton.  The communal bank is dedicated to agricultural labors.  She has been engaged in farming for five years, planting corn and rice.  She makes her purchases and sales in Ventanas.  She is requesting the loan to plant corn and purchase fertilizer.  With the help of this loan, it will be easier to acquire supplies.  Her dream is to be able to have her own home.  She hasn’t had any type of problem.  In her free time, she enjoys visiting her mother.

loans.use: to plant corn and buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Flavio Milton

texts.es:
Flavio Milton tiene 40 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene dos hijos. Vive con la esposa Y con los hijos  vive en el cantón ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LAS PALMAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto campo Alegre, Pertenece al Cantón Bab se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Flavio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz arroz hace 20 años. Las compras y las 
Ventas lo realiza en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para trabajar en la siembra de maíz y comprar los abonos y fertilizantes.

Con la ayuda del crédito le ayudara ha comprar los insumos sin ningún tipo de problema.

No se le ha presentado ningún problema en la agricultura.En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar.
texts.en:
Flavio Milton, 40, lives in a free union and has two children. The family lives together in Ventanas canton in Los Ríos province. He is a member of the communal bank LAS PALMAS, located in Campo Alegre in Bab canton. The members are farmers, and Flavio has been growing corn and rice for 20 years. He makes his purchases and sales in Ventanas.

He is requesting a loan so that he can plant corn and purchase manure and fertilizer. The loan will help him buy his supplies without any problems. He has not had any problems as a farmer, and he likes to relax in his free time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy palm-oil and salt for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Groundnut Group

texts.en:
Members of the Groundnut group are thankful to you for the support rendered to them. 

The Kiva loan they received from you has been very helpful in both their businesses and personal lives. They were able to use it to add more inventory to their stock. This led to an increase in sales and profitability. As such, these entreprenuers were in turn able to care better for their children in terms of education, feeding, and clothing. 

Having done repaying their previous loan successfully, they are requesting a new loan of 4,400,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for the entire group. With the help of this new loan, they are again empowered to further boost their businesses both in size and quality. 

The featured member of the group, Abibatu, sells ready-to-wear-clothes, and she has been doing this business for 18 years now. She is 45 and was born in Mashigbi village. She is married to a soldier, and the couple has two children in primary and secondary schools. 

Abibatu is going to use her share of the loan to buy ready-to-wear-clothes in larger quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear-clothes in larger quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en:
Sophy, aged 50, lives in a rural area of the Kandal province’s Sa Ang district, Cambodia. She has six children. To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice for several years.  The current business earns her family approximately KHR10,000 per day to meet the family’s needs.

Sophy’s group consists of two members who are female.  Now she and her group members are asking VisionFund for a loan of KHR300,000 each.

As the leader, Sophy is going to use her portion to buy material for constructing a decent latrine such as cement, bricks and steel roof, etc.  She hopes this loan will help her family have a good latrine and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy material for constructing a decent latrine.

loans.name: Memrafi

texts.en:
Memrafi is 25 years old. She is married, has no children, and lives in the coastal region of Kenya. 

Memrafi has had her own business selling coconuts from her home.  She has been doing this work since she was married, and she earns a good income from it.

The loan she is applying for is to buy more coconuts, and to fill the orders she has from customers.

Memrafi's goal is to continue increase her business, for her personal well-being and for that of her husband.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts.

loans.name: Ry's Group

texts.en:
Originally from the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cambodia, Ry is a 46-year-old married father of two sons. To support the family, he has been working as a construction worker for fifteen years while his wife is a garment worker. The couple currently earns about 12,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 4,000 KHR each day after expenses. 

Ry’s group consists of four members applying for their first loan with VisionFund. Ry, the group leader, will use his portion to build a latrine for the family. He hopes this loan will enable his family to have a proper latrine to provide them with a healthy standard of living.

loans.use: To build a latrine for the family

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice, 41 years old, is married and has 4 children whose ages range from 3 to 16 years. She describes herself as jovial. For the past 6 years, Eunice has operated a food stall where she sells cereals such as maize, beans, etc. Her business is located within a viable market and her primary customers are local residents.

Eunice describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more cereals for selling. Eunice's business goal is to open at least four cereal retail stores within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will buy a van for delivering food to customers. Eunice also farms.

loans.use: to purchase cereals for resale

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina con su anterior crédito compró materias primas e insumos con los cuales desarrolló nuevos diseños de calzado y compró mercancia variada que vendió y con la cual ganó un poco mas de dinero. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, para invertirlo en suelas, tapas, tinta, pegantes y hebillas, además de productos alimenticios para vender en su chaza. Su mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva es el siguiente: " Estamos muy agradecidos y si pueden seguir ayudandonos que por favor lo hagan"
texts.en: With her last loan Delfina bought supplies and items that she uses for new shoe designs.  She also bought merchandise that she sold and with that earned a little more money. She is currently applying for a new CrediKiva loan to purchase soles, heels, dyes, glue, and buckles.  She also will buy some food products to sell in her hut.  Her message to Kiva supporters is the following, “we are very grateful and if you can continue helping us, please do so”.

loans.use: to buy soles, heels, dyes, glue, and buckles as well as food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase inventory for his new store

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman. She has five children, with ages ranging from 2 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be a religious woman. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes . She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located within a residential area, and her primary customers are residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for buying enough clothes for resale. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy second hand clothes for selling. 

Her business goal is to run several similar retail business . She hopes that in the future, she will ensure restock of clothes at all times so as to meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is 50 years old and has been married to her husband Mbwana for several years. They have four children. Her greatest hope is to see her children fulfill their dreams. 

To this end, and thanks to the support of her husband, who works with Telecom Kenya, she was able to open a small food stall in her home. From this stall she sells dishes and beverages. 

Her main goal is to have a cafe, to increase her income. Apart from this, she sells coconuts which is a common product in the area where it is most used in cooking.

In all these years of intense work and dedication, she has obtained good results in her business endeavors.  Mwanakombo promises to be punctual with the repayment of her loan. "Thanks for the loan."  It will enable her to purchase wheat flour, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en:
Hayat is a 59-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan, who has two family members.

She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to buy clothes and accessories to sell to her friends and neighbors in the same area. 

In the future, she would like to open a shop, and she hopes to buy a home.

loans.use: to buy clothes and accessories to sell

loans.name: Sekngim's Group

texts.en:
Sekngim, 52 years old, lives in a rural area in the Sa Ang district, Kandal province. She is married and has three children. Sekngim and her husband have made a living by selling grocery items for almost thirty years. The current business earns them about KHR 15,000 per day to support the family.

This is the first loan for Sekngim’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She and her group member are each applying for a loan of KHR 500,000. Sekngim, the leader, is going to use her portion to buy materials, such as a latrine bowl, tile and sewage draining, etc. to build a proper latrine. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have a healthy latrine for an improved life.

loans.use: To buy materials to build a proper latrine

loans.name: Mamoun

texts.en:
Mamoun is a 31 year old single man from Marka Amman Jordan. 

He is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to pay for mobile phones and accessories to sell. 

Mamoun would like to expand his business and buy a home in the future.

loans.use: to pay for mobile phone and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Shadia

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Shadia prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband. Shadia is a 27-year-old married woman who has 3 family members from Marka, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for home improvements and new furniture. In the future, Shadia wants to buy a car and a home. Since she is younger than 30 years old, this loan is considered to be a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Mukhtaran

texts.en:
Mukhtaran is a 54-years-old active, married woman.  She has run a stitching and embroidery from her home for the past 4 years. Her collection is very famous in her town. She makes enough money to lead a decent life; however, her husband’s income is very unpredictable and not enough to cover everyday expenses. 

She is a loving mother of six children.  She is in charge of providing her family with good food, health and education. She has slowly but surely improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. 

Now Mukhtaran requested for a loan of Rs 25,000/- to buy a stock of threads in different colors to meet up the increasing demand of her embroidery designs. She hopes to have more profits and hence be able to better support her family.   Mukhtaran will spend part of earning on her two daughter’s education.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Emprendedoras De Chilamate Group

texts.es:
Banco Mujer Emprendedoras de Chilamate
Comercio
1350000
	El grupo tiene trabaja con Fundación Mujer desde el 2009, son de la zona de Poas, integrado  por 8 señoras, de estas 3 solicitan  préstamo en esta oportunidad.

	Son un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras con la idea de recibir el apoyo económico de Fundación Mujer y mejorar los ingresos de sus hogares, además consolidar su grupo y ofrecer apoyo en su comunidad para que otras mujeres puedan crecer social y  económicamente. 

	Demuestran ser un grupo conocido y tienen experiencia en el trabajo en equipo y la solidaridad es parte importante de su trabajo. Manejan conceptos del trabajo en grupo y han desarrollado otras actividades complementarias para la generación de ingresos. Entre las actividades a desarrollar están las ventas de comidas y realización de rifas.

	 Tres integrantes del grupo cancelan su préstamo este mes de Agosto y realizan la solicitud para renovarlo, sus nombres son Ana de 53 años y madre de 3 hijos se dedica a atender una pulpería en la que vende comida, golosinas, y artículos de primera necesidad, atiende a sus vecinos desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche todos los días, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y los préstamos obtenidos en otra oportunidad le han servido para consolidar su actividad.  Deyanira   de 54 años y madre de 1 hijo se dedica a la venta de ropa intima por catálogo y por último Ángela de 58 años madre de 6 hijos todos mayores de edad vende ropa que comercializa en la comunidad de Chilamate de Poas.  Este es su cuarto préstamo y han demostrado una excelente conducta de pago y crecimiento tanto personal como económico. 

El grupo cuenta con activos para desarrollar sus actividades, los cuales se tomaron en conjunto para demostrar la solvencia del Banco Mujer. Ellas han establecido su plan de trabajo atendiendo tanto al hogar como a su negocio.

	Aparte del apoyo económico a sus actividades, tiene experiencia realizando actividades para generar dinero y crecer, se comprometen al trabajo en grupo para sacar adelante esta empresa y cumplir con las obligaciones adquiridas con este crédito.

	 Se va a apoyar estas actividades buscando su consolidación y apoyar a las otras compañeras a mantener su negocio. Se cuenta con equipos y una clientela para los productos que ya se están comercializando. Son un grupo unido y han cumplido con los requisitos solicitados para la formación del Banco Mujer en lo que respecta al proceso de capacitación, demostrando compromiso y puntualidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Banco Mujer Emprendedoras de Chilamate

The group has worked with Fundación Mujer since 2009. It is in the Poas area and made up of 8 women, three of whom are requesting a loan at this opportunity.

They are a group of women entrepreneurs with the idea of receiving economic assistance from Fundación Mujer and of improving their household income, as well as consolidating their group and offering help in their community so that other women can grow socially and economically.

They are a well-known group, with experience working as a team and solidarity is an important part of their work. They maintain group work ethics and have developed other complimentary activities in order to generate income. Among activities they have developed are food sales and raffles.

Three members of the group are paying off their loans in August and are requesting to renew them. Their names are the following:  Ana, 53, who is the mother of three children and runs a store where she sells food, sweets and basic staples and waits on her neighbors from 6 in the morning until 8 at night every day. She relies on her husband’s support and the loans she has obtained on other occasions have served to consolidate her business; Deyanira, 54 years old, who is the mother of one son and sells intimate clothing by catalog and finally Angela, 58 years old, who is the mother of six children, all adults, and who sells clothing, which she markets in the community of Chilamate in Poas. This is their fourth loan and they have demonstrated excellent conduct in their payments and their growth, personal as well as economic.

The group relies on assets to develop their business activities which they contributed jointly to demonstrate the solvency of Banco Mujer. They have established their business plan, and care for their homes as well as their businesses. 

Apart from the economic help for their business, the communal bank has experience doing things to generate money and to grow. They commit themselves to working as a group in order to move this enterprise forward and to comply with the obligations agreed to with this loan. 

The communal bank will support these businesses by seeking their consolidation and support other co-workers in maintaining their businesses. The communal bank has equipment and a customer base for the products that they are already selling. They are a united group, and they have complied with the requested loan terms for the formation of Banco Mujer with respect to the training process and by demonstrating commitment and punctuality in making their payments..

loans.use: to buy clothing and products by catalog and merchandise for a store.

loans.name: Moath

texts.en:
Moath is 24 years old and he is from Gaza. He has owned a food stall selling fruits and vegetables for two years.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a small automobile, which will help him save transportation costs.

He hopes that this loan will help him decrease his expenses and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a small automobile

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is a 38-year-old vigorous lady.  She has had a general store for the past seven years.  

She started her business from a small toffee shop. When Kashf foundation started its operations in her town in 2007, she was approached by a Kashf foundation business development officer, and she decided to seek a small loan in order to fast-track her business growth. 

This played a vital role in her business growth as she had limited access to capital before. Now she has one employee, and her business has grown to a reasonable level in the past five years since her association with Kashf foundation. 

She has three children, all in school.  Her husband also assists her by buying stocks of goods from the market.  He is very supportive of her; that is why she is able to give proper time at the store. He feels proud of his wife.  

She is in her fifth loan cycle with Kashf foundation. She needs a loan of Rs. 40,000 to buy stocks of flour, rice, and oil to meet the demand time after time at her store. This would help her to expand her business further.   Her case has been approved by Kashf foundation. 

She hopes to utilize her profits on her children's education.

loans.use: To buy the stocks of flour, rice, and oil.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives in Ararat village with her husband and three sons. 

The family runs a farm, where they breed hens and turkeys; cultivate potatos and eggplant; grow apricot, plum, apple, and peach trees, and keep a grape orchard. 

Gayane would like to increase the number of chickens in her farm, for which she has applied for this loan. Gayane also wants to purchase forage for chickens and fertilizer for the land cultivation. 

Gayane gathers her main income form the sales of eggs and chickens and harvest, so this loan will help her to increase the sales and get addiitonal income.

loans.use: to pay for chickens, forage for chickens, and fertilizer

loans.name: Jomanah

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Jomanah prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, her husband appears in the photo.

Jomanah, 25 years old, is a married woman from Mraka, Jordan. She has 3 children. Jomanah has requested an 800 JOD loan to buy materials needed to make and sell pickles. In the future, she is planning to buy a house and a car. Since Jomanah is younger than 30 years old, her loan is considered to be a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for making and selling pickles

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is married and he has 3 children whose ages range from 14 to 23 years. He describes himself as humble and self-motivated. For the past 7 years, Kennedy has operated a general store where he sells shoe soles and charcoal. His business is located along a busy tarmac road and his primary customers are pedestrians.

Kennedy describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of shade during daily business activities. He will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy charcoal and shoe soles. Kennedy's business goal is to be a supplier of charcoal and shoes within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will run a shoe manufacturing company in Nairobi. This is Kennedy's first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and shoe soles

loans.name: Mwanaija

texts.en:
Mwanaija, 40 years of age, lives with her six children in the community of Shizazi, located in Msambweni, in the province of Coast, Kenya. Mwanaija owns a food stall which supplies the local community with daily basic foods. She noticed that her business has been slowly growing and demand for more dishes is getting stronger. Now that her customers feel satisfied with her services, they are requesting a wider range of dishes.

Mwanaija is seeking a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase ingredients such as food flavor, flour, sugar, etc. to satisfy customer demand. With this loan, she hopes to better herself economically and personally. She also notes that, thanks to these types of credit organizations, she is able to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as food flavor, flour, sugar, etc,

loans.name: Ta-Marsu Group

texts.en:
Members of the Ta-Marsu group are very happy and grateful for the Kiva loan that they received from you. That loan created a huge impact in their lives and businesses. They were able to repay the loan successfully, feed their children, and send them to school out of the daily profits they made.

Having repaid that loan successfully, Ta-Marsu group has reapplied for a new loan of 1,200,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) per member. This new loan will further help to increase their business inventories, boost sales and increase profit. Osman, the group leader, will use his share of the loan to buy new bales of shoes to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy slippers to increase inventory

loans.name: Felixberta

texts.en: Felixberta is a newly recognized micro-finance member of PMPC.  She is 47 years of age and married with five adult-age children.  For five years, she has operated a snack making and selling business with monthly earnings of PHP 2,000.  She took her first loan from PMPC to purchase additional raw materials to make snacks to sell.  She plans to use the profit to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials to make snacks

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a 32-year-old married woman. She has two children who are attending a local primary school. Today, she works in her food stall where she has dedicated all her efforts. She also sells coconuts from her home.

Mwanamisi is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to buy all the necessary ingredients for her food stall including cooking oil, flour, etc. Mwanamisi is a hardworking woman who believes that the loan she is requesting will greatly improve her business. She dreams of opening a retail shop in future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food stall such as cooking oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Siaba

texts.en:
Siaba is 33 years old, and is married to Mwamadi, a fisherman. They have four children and live together in their own house, which is cemented and has electricity.

She is a woman who likes business. She opened a food stall eight years ago, and despite that she alone runs it, sometimes she counts on the support of her children and her husband. She starts her work very early, at five in the morning, and works up to late in the evening. The problem is when she runs out of ingredients and doesn't have the money necessary to stock up. For this reason, she turns to the loans.

This is her second loan with Yehu, and she feels happy about the opportunity that they gave her and for the trust in her work. For this, she promises to be punctual in her payments just as she was with the first loan, and as such she will be able to access other loans in the future. 

With this loan of KES 40,000, she will stock up with merchandise for her stall. She will buy sacks of sugar, rice, beans, etc.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar, rice, beans, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Julio

texts.es: Carlos Rodríguez de 58 años de edad vive en la hermosa Cartagena de Indias ciudad colonial de gente amable y muy caribe rodeada del inmenso mar. Allí en este ambiente de playa brisa y mar,  Carlos tiene  un taller de herrería en el patio de su casa, oficio en el que ha trabajado toda su vida, primero mediante contrato a través de grandes empresas,  como estructuras de bodegas, terminales de transporte, refinería entre otros y  después de haberse pensionado, trabaja en su propio taller, desarrollando una labor independiente en todo lo que fue su experiencia, pero en trabajos livianos. Su negocio inició debido a que el monto de su pensión representaba un   salario mínimo legal mensual,  con el que no completaba  su tarea de sostener su hogar, por lo eso emprendió. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará un compresor para pintar, Inversión que será exitosa, pues con esta herramienta aumentará la calidad de sus productos, dándoles   un excelente acabado.  Los indicadores financieros de este negocio muestran una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 35 días una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 22% , razones financieras desde las cuales proyectamos su crecimiento y el impacto de su credikiva, apuntándole a que Carlos impacte en el mercado ofreciendo calidad y seguridad en el producto que sus clientes solicitan permanentemente.
texts.en:
Carlos Rodríguez, 58, lives in beautiful Cartagena de Indias, a colonial city of friendly,Caribbean people surrounded by the immense sea. Here, near the beach and water, Carlos has a metal workshop in the patio of his house. He has been working at this profession his entire life, at first under contract for large businesses that built stores, transport terminals, refineries, and so forth. Then, having thought it over, he opened his own shop and started working as an independent contractor, using all his experience but at smaller tasks. He began his business because his pension represented the legal monthly wage, which was not enough to sustain his household. So he became an entrepreneur. 

He is now applying for a Kiva loan, his first with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he will use to buy a compressor for painting. The investment will be successful because with this tool he will improve the quality of his products by giving them an excellent finish. The financial figures for this business show an account turnover of 35 days and profit on sales of no less than 22%, reasons why he is projecting growth and expecting results from the Kiva loan. The numbers show that Carlos has made an impression in the market by offering good quality and safe products that his customers always request.

loans.use: to buy a compressor for painting.

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Fadia prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Fadia is a 31-year-old married woman from Sahab, Jordan, who has two family members. She is requesting a loan of JOD 500 to pay for her home improvements--she wants to do maintenance to the rooms. In the future, she wants to provide a good environment for her family to live in.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Yasmina Del Socorro

texts.es: Yasmina es habitante de Granada, tiene 32 años de edad, casada tiene 4 hijos y un bebe que esta por nacer, ella es propietaria de una pulpería desde hace 12 años.  No tenia casa propia, pero con un poco de capital inicio su negocio,  su esposo abrió un bar que le genero buenas ganancias. Con los ingresos que obtenían se ayudo para invertir en la pulpería y a la fecha ya tiene su propia casa y su negocio ya está más estable. En la  pulpería le ayuda a atender una familiar y su esposo que le sigue apoyando económicamente, se siente satisfecha por la ubicación en la que se encuentra ya que cuenta con buena cantidad de clientes. Esta solicitando este crédito para invertir en prendas de vestir variada como: pantalones, blusas, botas y otros. Atravez de este crédito ella podrá ampliar su negocio invirtiendo en más ropa, cosméticos  y perfumería por ser un producto muy demandado sobre todo por las mujeres  además de ofrecer variedad en productos comestibles y prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Yasmina lives in Granada.  She’s 32-years-old, married and has four children and a baby that’s about to be born.  She’s owned a grocery store for 12 years.  She did not own a house but started her business with a little bit of capital and her husband opened a bar that generated good profits.  With income they earned she invested in the grocery store and as of now has a house of her own and a more stable business.  A family member helps her tend to the store and her husband continues to help her out economically.  She feels satisfied with the location she’s in because she has a good number of customers.

She’s requesting this loan to buy clothing like pants, blouses, boots and others.  Through this loan she will be able to expand the business buying clothes, cosmetics and perfumery which are products in high demand, especially by women in addition to offering a variety of foodstuffs and clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes,boots, cosmetics, perfume and other products.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a cattle keeper and a trader. He is married and has 5 children aged between 9 and 17, all in school. Jackson buys cows at a tender age, grazes them for 3 to 6 months and then sells them at a slightly higher price than he originally paid. He supplements his income by selling bananas and coffee to adequately meet his family demands.

Jackson started the business in 2002 when his children began secondary school and he had no stable source of income to pay school fees. He therefore opted to trade in cattle. Jackson will use this loan to make profits to enable him to pay school fees for his children in the coming school term. His major challenge is the dry spell, usually in the middle of the year, which affects the growth and quality of the cows, thereby lowering their prices. Jackson is very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Rosa Esmeralda

texts.es: Rosa es originaria de Granada, de 37 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de nacatamales desde hace 12 años. Esta actividad la inicio vendiendo  ropa nueva, luego vio la oportunidad de vender comida en un punto clave para la venta ya que hay varias empresas alrededor como talleres de mecánica, laboratorios etc. Pensó  que era un punto muy estratégico para comercializar los nacatamales y la ropa. En este negocio le ayuda una vecina cercana en la elaboración de los nacatamales y su esposo quien la apoya con los gastos del hogar. Rosa  esta solicitando un crédito kiva para comprar ropa de mayor calidad y productos para comprar ingredientes y hacer los nacatamales uno de los platos tipicos muy tradicionales y de popular consumo. Este crédito le ayudara a aumentar sus clientes y por consiguiente sus ganancias. Sus planes futuros son  aumentar el negocio de ropa y mantener estable el negocio de comida.
texts.en:
Rosa is from Granada.  She’s 37-years-old, married and has three children.  She has been selling nacatamales [Nicaraguan style tamales] for 12 years.  She started her activity selling new clothes and then saw the opportunity to sell food in a key spot for sales because there are many firms in the vicinity like auto repair shops, laboratories, etc.  She thought that it was a very strategic spot to sell nacatamales and clothes.  A close neighbor helps her make the nacatamales and her husband helps her meet household expenses.

Rosa is asking for a Kiva loan to buy better quality clothes and products and to buy ingredients to make the nacatamales, a popular, traditional dish that’s widely consumed.  This loan will help her increase the number of her customers and as a result her profits.  Her future plans are to increase the clothing business and to keep her food business stable.

loans.use: to buy clothes and also to buy ingredients to make nacatamales.

loans.name: Soad

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Soad prefers that her photo not be on the Internet. Thus, the above photo is of her husband. Soad is a 24-year-old married woman from Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to do maintenance for the home and she will be repainting her home. In the future, she wants to buy new electronics and furniture. She hopes to provide for her family a good environment to live in. Since Soad is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Fraternidad De Urubamba Group

texts.es:
La socia Engracia tiene 34 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cuatro  hijos, ella es natural de la ciudad de Urubamba pero vive en la ciudad del Cusco.
