La socia Engracia es ama de casa y esta al cuidado de sus menores hijos, ella es una mujer muy alegre y responsable que saca adelante a su familia, ella antes tenía una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en la ciudad de Urubamba pero tuvo que cerrar porque tenía que trasladarse a la ciudad del Cusco y también porque empezaron otras personas abrir otras tiendas cerca a la suya. La socia Engracia vive en el Cusco en una casa alquila y desea implementar la casa con las comodidades básicas como por ejemplo muebles. En esta oportunidad la socia Engracia requiere el préstamo para comprar muebles como por ejemplo juego de sala y sillas para la nueva casa. El esposo de la socia apoya a la canasta familiar con el trabajo que tiene que es brindar servicio de trasportes rural en la rutas de Cusco, Ollantaytambo y viceversa. (La socia Engracia está levantando la mano en la fotografía). 

Este grupo está conformado por vecinos y amigos que formaron el banco comunal “Fraternidad de Urubamba” en la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de verduras y frutas, venta de chicha de jora, venta de bebidas calientes, venta de paja, venta de comida, elaboración y venta de muebles y otros brindan servicio de trasportes y de seguridad. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The member, Engracia, is 34 years old, and married with four children.  She is a native of Urubamba but lives in the city of Cusco.  She is a housewife and cares for her young children.  She is a happy, responsible woman who gets her family ahead.  Previously, she had a small grocery store in Urubamba but had to close it because she had to move to Cusco and also because other people opened stores near hers.  Engracia lives in Cusco in a rented house and wishes to furnish the house with basic amenities such as furniture.  At this time, she is requesting the loan to buy a living room suite and chairs for her new house. Her husband supports the family income with his job providing transportation services on the routes from Cusco to Ollantaytambo and back.  (Engracia is raising her hand in the photograph).

This group is made up of neighbors and friends that formed the “Fraternidad de Urubamba” Communal Bank in the Urubamba province, Cusco department.  This communal bank is a made up of people that are always looking for opportunities to get ahead and strive daily to provide their children with a better future.  The members’ business activities include sales of fruit and vegetables, “chicha de jora” (a beverage made from corn), hot drinks, straw, and meals, as well as the building and sales of furniture, and transportation and security services.  The members are grateful for the opportunity provided and are committed to making their respective payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy a living room suite and chairs.

loans.name: Shasha

texts.en:
For cultural reasons, Shasha prefers that her photo is not on the Internet.  Thus the above photo is of her husband.

Shasha is 47 years old and married, with four children.  She is from Bani Kenanah, Irbid - Jordan. 

Shasha has requested a 400 JOD loan to begin a retail business in computer accessories. She wants to start with CD's for computer games and computer accessories.  Then she would like to expand and begin buying personal computers, to improve her life and family situation.

loans.use: to pay for buying computer accessories and then selling them.

loans.name: Victorino

texts.es:
El señor Victorino trabaja en una empresa de transporte como jefe de trafico desde hace mas de dos años y su esposa la señora Guadalupe trabaja en la limpieza de una casa en la vecina ciudad de Laredo Texas desde hace cinco años, son los ingresos que generan para darles a sus hijos el estudio necesaria para que sean unos triunfadores en la vida.
El señor Victorino solicita un préstamo para cubrir los gastos de inscripción, compra de útiles y los uniformes escolares de sus cuatro hijos que están cursando la primaria y secundaria.
Desean darles el estudio que mas les sea posible ya que están consientes de que mientras mas preparados estén académicamente, tendrán mas oportunidades en los trabajos para que su futura será mucho mejor.
texts.en:
Victorino has worked in a transportation firm as a traffic chief for more than two years and his wife, Guadalupe, has worked cleaning a house in the neighboring city of Laredo, Texas for five years.  Income they earn is to provide their children with the necessary education so that they can be successful in life.

Victorino is asking for a loan to cover tuition, uniforms and school supplies costs for his four children who are attending elementary and secondary school.

They want to provide them with the best possible schooling because they are conscious of the fact that the better their academic training, they’ll have the more opportunities for jobs so that their future will be much better.

loans.use: to pay school costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy one carton of fresh fish, one bag of rice and two bags of groundnuts for her restaurant.

loans.name: Blanca Cecilia

texts.es: BLANCA TIENE 36 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTA CASADA CON ARTEMIO Y TIENEN 2 HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD. BLANCA SIEMPRE HA BUSCADO LA MANERA DE PODER AYUDAR EN LOS GASTOS DE SU FAMILIA. HA LLEVADO A CABO DIFERENTES NEGOCIOS CON EL PROPOSITO DE AYUDAR A SU ESPOSO. POR ESTE MOTIVO ELLA A INICIADO UN PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO POR LAS TARDES DE VENTA DE COMIDA, EL CUAL A UBICADO CERCA DE SU DOMICILIO FRENTE A UNA CARRETERA MUY TRANSITADA. COMENTA QUE AUNQUE EL NEGOCIO ES PEQUEÑO, ELLA VE LA OPORTUNIDAD DE HACERLO CRECER, YA QUE MUCHAS PERSONAS CAMINAN POR ESTA CALLE. POR ESTE MOTIVO BLANCA VE LA NECESIDAD DE SOLICITAR UN CREDITO, CON EL CUAL PLANEA PODER COMPRAR MAS PRODUCTOS PARA SU NEGOCIO ASI COMO OTROS MATERIALES Y EQUIPO QUE LE PERMITA ACONDICIONAR Y OFRECER MEJOR CALIDAD A SUS CLIENTES.
texts.en: Blanca, 36, is married to Artemio and they have two minor children.  Blanca has always sought ways to help with her family’s expenses.  She’s had several different businesses aimed at helping her husband.  Because of this, she’s started a small business selling food in the evening that’s located near her house across from a very busy highway.  She comments that even though the business is small she sees an opportunity to make it grow since many people pass by this street.  Because of this, Blanca needs to request a loan that she plans to use to buy more products for her business as well as other materials and equipment to set up and offer better customer service.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the business.

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani lives in Vorotan village with her parents and brother. Ani and her family run a farm, where they breed hens, cultivate wheat, potatoes, and beans, and grow fruit trees. In order to start and complete the autumn sowing, Ani has applied for this loan. With the requested amount, she plans to purchase wheat seeds and fuel. Ani also plans to hire workers to help the family with the land cultivation. 

This loan will help Ani to gather a good harvest of wheat and get additional income from its sales.

loans.use: to pay for hired workers, wheat seeds, and fuel

loans.name: Wedad

texts.en: Wedad is a 34-year-old married female. She has four children. She has requested a 500 JOD loan to open a retail shop for home supplies. She wants to increase the income of her family. In the future, she would like to buy a house and get her children educated in a university.

loans.use: to pay for opening a home supplies shop

loans.name: Magda Araceli

texts.es: MAGDA TIENE 43 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTA SEPARA Y TIENE UNA HIJA. DESDE HACE 6 AÑOS MAGDA SE DEDICA A CUIDAR DE SU NEGOCIO EL CUAL REALIZA CON MUCHO CARIÑO, YA QUE ELLA ESTABLECIO UNA ESTANCIA INFANTIL DONDE CON AYUDA DE DOS EMPLEADAS TIENE A SU CUIDADO A NIÑOS PEQUEÑOS EN EDADES DE 1 HASTA 3 AÑOS. COMO PARTE DE LOS REQUSITOS QUE LE SOLICITAN PARA TENER SU PERMISO LEGAL, ES LA COMPRA DE UN SEGURO DE GASTOS MEDICOS MAYORES PARA BENEFICIO DE ELLA Y DE LOS NIÑOS QUE ESTEN A SU CUIDADO, CON EL PROPOSITO DE PROTEGER A CADA NIÑO Y MANTENER LA TRANQUILIDAD DE LOS PADRES Y DE LAS AUTORIDADES. POR ESTE MOTIVO ELLA SE VE EN LA NECESIDAD DE SOLICITAR UN PRESTAMO QUE LE PERMITA CUBRIR ESTE GASTO INMEDIATAMENTE, PARA MANTENER A SUS CLIENTES SATISFECHOS CON SU TRABAJO Y TAMBIEN CUMPLIR CON SU RESPONSABILIDAD ANTE LAS AUTORIDADES.
texts.en:
Magda, 43, is separated and has a daughter.  For the last six years Magda has been caring for the business that she runs with much affection.  She has established a child day care center where with the help of two employees she cares for little children between the ages of 1 and 3.  

One of the requirements for her official operating license is that she has major medical insurance for her and for the benefit of the children in her care so that each child will be protected and so that their parents and the authorities can have peace of mind.  Because of this, she needs to request a loan that will cover this expense immediately to keep her customers satisfied with her work and also to meet her responsibility unto the authorities.

loans.use: to pay her insurance premium.

loans.name: Emilyn

texts.en: Emilyn is a member of PMPC.  She is 35 years old and married with two school-age children. She has been engaged in selling gasoline for eight years with a monthly income of PHP 3,000. She took a loan from PMPC to purchase additional stocks of gasoline to sell. She plans to use the profit to support the school needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase addtional gasoline to sell

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi, age 30, is a married mother with four children. She lives in a rural area in the outskirts of the town of Msambweni with her husband who is a teacher.

Mwanamisi has been selling food in a food stall for over six years. She sells boiled goats' intestines, ugali (prepared from maize flour), meat, rice, etc. She also sells coconuts, which provides income for her minor expenses.

She is now requesting a loan of 30,000 KES, which will be her third loan. She will use this loan to buy meat, flavors, charcoal, etc. She will do this to give her customers better service. She will use part of the loan to buy coconuts to sell. She hopes to continue growing her business because her goal is to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy meat, flavors, charcoal, coconuts,etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Populares Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Populares esta compuesta por 12 integrantes todas mujeres que la mayoría se dedica a la venta de ropas, bebidas, comestibles, dulces, etc.Las integrantes del comités son muy unidas, se ayudan entre ellas y al mismo tiempo le ayudan a sus familiares.
Una de las integrantes, la señora Karen se dedica a la venta de ropas para mujeres, vende remeras, camisas, pantalones, vestidos, etc. con esta actividad ella aporta a su canasta familiar.
El crédito solicitado sería para comprar nuevas mercaderías de mejor calidad para ofrecer a sus clientes, de esa forma aumentaría sus ingresos y el número de clientes.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Populares” (Popular Women) committee has 12 members, all women, who for the most part sell clothes, beverages, food, candy, etc.  The committee members are very united; they help each other out and at the same time help their families.

One of the members is Karen who sells women’s clothing.  She sells t-shirts, shirts, pants, dresses, etc. and is able to contribute to her family’s basic staple needs this way.  She’s asking for a loan to buy new, better quality, goods to offer her customers so that her income and the number of her customers will increase.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Magangawa

texts.en:
Magangawa is a 35-year-old woman.  She is happily married and lives in the town of Msambweni with her husband and their two children. She is a very kind person, hardworking and enthusiastic.

She and her husband dedicate all their effort to get ahead. Unfortunately, because of the need to work and pay expenses, she couldn't pursue a career, but she would have liked to pursue a career in business management.

With the support of her husband, with much effort and dedication, Magangawa started her small business two years ago. She sells clothes for women, men, and children. 

Every day from the early morning, she goes to the central market to sell. She feels comfortable doing her job and believes that she is doing well because she has good customer care.

Magangawa is very grateful to Kiva lenders.  Thanks to their help, she will buy merchandise, such as sweaters, shirts, jackets, pants, blouses, and other items. 

Doing so, she will have her business better stocked, and she expects to increase her sales and her income.

loans.use: buy merchandise, such as sweaters, shirts, jackets, pants, blouses, and other items.

loans.name: Ahed

texts.en:
Ahed is 29 years old from Gaza. He is married and has four children. He owns a home appliances and household shop selling home accessories and utensils.

Ahed asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy goods, shelves and display glass for his shop. He hopes that this will increase his customers and improve his income; thus, help him achieve his ambition of providing for all his children's needs including the best education.

loans.use: to buy goods, shelves, and display glass for his shop.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
El Sr.Rodolfo es un cliente recurrente, es casado y vive en casa propia.Gracias a la actitud emprendedora del señor la calidad de vida de el y de su familia ha mejorado.
El señor cuenta con una ferretería en el mercado de Luque hace mas de 10 años, es con esta actividad que el aporta al ingreso económico familiar, igualmente procura de esta manera abarcar todas las necesidades de su clientela para así también abarcar dentro de su hogar económicamente en más sectores. 
El crédito utilizado sería para comprar mayor cantidad de mercaderías como cerraduras, herramientas, clavos, tornillos entre otros materiales.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is a recurring client.  He’s married and lives in a house of his own.  Thanks to his enterprising spirit his and his family’s quality of life has been improving.

He has had a hardware store in the market in Luque for more than 10 years.  He contributes to his family’s economy by means of this activity.  He also tries to meet all his customers’ needs this way so that he can economically cover more sectors within his home.

He will use the loan to buy larger amounts of merchandise like locks, tools, nails and screws, among others.

loans.use: to buy hardware supplies.

loans.name: Otgonchuluun

texts.en: Mr. Otgonchuluun, age 24, is a driver operating a freight transportation business in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Since last year, he has been running this business with his mini truck. He confirms it is the main income source for his family. He lives with his son, age 5, and his wife in a ger (a Mongolian traditional nomadic yurt) in the ger district. His wife works as a vendor in the market. Lately Mr. Otgonchuluun's truck has been bad and damaged a lot. With this loan, he will buy some spare parts to repair his mini truck.

loans.use: to buy some spare parts to repair his mini truck.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité Maria Auxiliadora consta de 10 integrantes, todas mujeres en su mayoría se dedican a la venta de quesos en las ferias semanales que se organizan. El comité se caracteriza por ser muy unido, responsable y sobre todo emprendedor ya que las señoras salen a vender lo que más saben hacer a un precio accesible.
Una de las integrantes, la señora María vende distintas variedades de quesos en las ferias semanales; es así que ella genera sus ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia.
El crédito sería utilizado para comprar mayor variedad como queso paraguay, queso magro, queso para hacer sandwich, etc.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” committee has 10 members, all women, who for the most part work selling cheese in weekly street markets they organize.  The committee is noted for being very united, responsible and above all, enterprising since the women go out to sell what they know best how to make at affordable prices.

One of the members is María who sells various kinds of cheese in the weekly street markets.  She generates income this way to support her family.

She will use the loan to buy larger amounts of Paraguay cheese, Magro cheese, cheese for sandwiches, etc.

loans.use: to buy cheese.

loans.name: Porvenir Group

texts.es:
El comité Porvenir esta conformado por 19 mujeres que viven en la misma comunidad. Todas ellas se dedican a actividades varias que le son de suma importancia por que contribuyen al bienestar familiar.Las integrantes se encuentran muy unidas y con muchas ganas de seguir en el programa ya que ven los resultados positivos.
Una de las integrantes, la señora  Teofila se dedica a la venta ambulante de todo tipo de productos desde ropas, hasta alimentos.
El crédito que desea obtener se re invertirá en la compra de mercaderías que tienen buena venta para asi poder aumentar la cantidad de clientes y también de productos a ofrecer.
texts.en:
The Porvenir Committee is made up of 19 women that live in the same community. They all have different economic activities that are of great importance because they contribute to their families' well being. The members are very united and have strong desires to continue with the program because they have seen positive results. 

One of these members, Teofila, makes a living selling all types of products by traveling. These include clothing and even food stuffs. The loan that she hopes to obtain will be invested in the purchase of merchandise that have good sales in order to continue increasing her number of customers and also the products that she offers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like clothing, food stuffs, bed sheets, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Unidas es grupo reciente se encuentra recién en su 1er ciclo, las integrantes del comité son todas mujeres que viven en la misma comunidad y que tienen el mismo objetivo que sería generar mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida. Las integrantes del comité se encuentran muy confiadas en sus emprendimientos y desean llegar hasta el final del programa.
Una de las integrantes, la señora Nasaria es ama de casa y al mismo tiempo cría pollos para después venderlos a grandes empresas. 
El crédito la señora va utilizar para re invertir en su negocio , para comprar mejor calidad de alimentos y también para mejorar la infraestructura del local.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) committee is a new group; they are barely in their first cycle.  The members of the group are all women from the same community who have the same objective: to generate higher income to improve their quality of life.  The group members are very confident about their enterprises and want to reach the final stage of the program.

One of the members is Nasaria who is a housewife and at the same time raises chickens to then sell to large firms.  She will use the loan to invest in her business buying better quality feed and also will improve the infrastructure of her locale.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
El señor Ignacio tiene 41 años de edad, es casado y  tienen hijos pequeños que dependen económicamente de el y su esposa.
El señor es dueño de una gomería y se dedica también a la venta de cubiertas, el local se encuentra en su casa donde también habilitó un lavadero de autos. Gracias a los nuevos servicios que propone cada vez tiene mayor cantidad de clientes fieles que confían en los conocimientos del señor Ignacio.
El crédito solicitado sería para comprar mayor cantidad de productos necesarios para que su local funcione y también para arreglar el local.
texts.en:
Ignacio, 41, is married and still has minor children that depend on him and his wife.    He owns a tire repair shop and also sells car covers.  The shop is located at home and he also set up a car wash.  Thanks to the new services he provides he has more regular customers all the time that trust in Ignacio’s skills.

The loan he’s requested would be to buy larger amounts of products needed for his business to function and also to fix up the shop.

loans.use: to buy auto parts.

loans.name: Jerovia Group

texts.es:
El comité Jerovia es uno muy joven recién se encuentra en su 1er ciclo cuenta con 10 miembros mujeres dedicadas a actividades varias.El comité se encuentra muy entusiasmado por este nueva oportunidad de seguir creciendo y también de generar ingresos extras.
Una de las integrantes, la señora Estela se dedica a la venta de productos de cosméticos como cremas para el cuerpo, maquillajes, productos de tratamiento para el cabello y uñas entre otros, es así que ella se esmera por abarcar más sectores de la venta o bien aumentar su clientela y poder generar mayores ingresos personales que le ayuden a un futuro mejor.
El crédito sería utilizado para comprar mayor cantidad de cosméticos ya que tiene una clientela exigente con la calidad y el precio.
texts.en:
The “Jerovia” group is a very young one that’s in its first cycle with ten members, all women who do a variety of things.  The committee is very excited about this new opportunity to continue growing and also to generate extra income.

One of the members is Estela who sells cosmetics like body cream, make-up, hair treatment products and nail products, among others.  She strives to include more sectors in her sales and to increase her customer base to generate higher personal income that will help her towards a better future.

She will use the loan to buy larger amounts of cosmetics since she has a demanding clientele with respect to quality and price.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es:
El señor Aristides tiene 40 años de edad, vive en su casa propia.
El señor es propietario de un auto que lo utiliza como taxi cubriendo un itinerario diario pasando por varias ciudades del país, así se gana la vida y mantiene a su familia, su deseo es poder algún día contar con mayores unidades de vehículos, generar empleo para gente de su comunidad y obtener para sí y su familia también mayores ingresos.
El crédito solicitado sería para mantener el vehículo y la compra de cubiertas nuevas que le facilitarían mucho mantener su trabajo.
texts.en:
Aristides is 40 years old and lives in his own house. He is the owner of an automobile that he uses as a taxi, covering a daily itinerary through several cities in the country. In this way he makes a living and supports his family. His wish is to be able to have more vehicles one day and create employment opportunities for the people in his community, as well as to have greater earnings for himself and his family. 

The requested loan will be to have maintenance done on his vehicle and to buy new tires that would help his a lot in keeping up his work.

loans.use: to do maintenance on a vehicle and buy new tires.

loans.name: La Victoria Group

texts.es:
El comité La Victoria se encuentra en su 3er ciclo, esta conformado por 15 mujeres que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a actividades varias dentro del comité.El comité se encuentra muy unido y entusiasmado por los buenos resultados que están viendo en sus emprendimientos.
Una de las señoras del grupo, la señora Elva se dedica a la venta de ropas para mujeres, tiene una clientela formada pero deses abarcar a más cantidades.
El crédito sería utilizado para comprar mayor cantidad de mercaderías como remeras, camisas, pantalones, etc para luego vendarlas a un precio justo.
texts.en:
The “La Victoria” (Victory) committee is in its third cycle; it has 15 members, all women from the same community who carry out a variety of activities within the committee.  The committee is very united and excited about the good results they are seeing in their endeavors.

One of the group members is Elva who sells women’s clothing.  She has a good number of regular customers but wants to acquire still more.  The loan will be used to buy larger amounts of merchandise like t-shirts, shirts, pants, etc. to then resell at a fair price.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.es:
La señora Clemencia vive en su casa propia con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos, 3 de ellos se vieron obligados a buscar trabajo en el extranjero.
La señora cuenta con una despensa y una carnicería donde vende todo tipo de productos ya sea de higiene personal, limpieza, alimentos no perecederos y carnes de su carnicería. La señora comenta que gracias a los créditos otorgados ella a podido resistir con su despensa y de seguir teniendo un trabajo que le genera ingresos.
El crédito solicitado sería para comprar mayor cantidad de mercaderías que luego las vendería en su despensa.
texts.en: Clemencia lives in her own house with her spouse; she has four children three of whom were forced to seek employment abroad.  She has a grocery store and butcher shop where she sells all types of products for personal hygiene, cleaning supplies, non-perishable food items and meat in the butcher shop.  She comments that thanks to the granted loans she’s been able to stay in business with her store and continue to have income-generating work.  The requested loan will be used to buy larger amounts of merchandise to then sell in her store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Kelis

texts.es: Kelis se nota muy feliz en su motocarro como lo muestra en la fotografía, porque cada vez crece su negocio y esto es gracias al apoyo de los financiadores de Kiva; ella con su anterior crédito,  invirtió en mecatos (papitas, chitos, choquis, detodito, trocillos  etc.) que distribuyó entre sus clientes en su antiguo furgón y con las utilidades de su credikiva, completado con su ahorro compró su motocarro, el que conduce ella misma pues en él trabaja persistentemente. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará papitas, chitos, choquis, detodito, trocillos, por volumen, pues agregó con su nuevo vehículo una ruta y las compras en mayor volumen le traerán muy buenos descuentos y más utilidades al ampliar su volumen de ventas y  esto es justamente lo que hace que su inversión sea exitosa. Su mensaje de agradecimiento  a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “ Su aporte es muy importante, ya que con esto contribuyen al desarrollo de comunidades y logros de metas a nivel genera y por familias. “
texts.en:
Kelis is very happy in her vehicle as is shown in the photo because she is growing her business and this is thanks to the support of the Kiva lenders. With her previous loan, she invested in snacks (potato chips, cookies, cheese snacks, "detodito", "trocillos", etc) that she distributed to her customers in her old truck and with the capital from her Kiva loan and her savings, she bought a vehicle. She drives the vehicle herself because she works very hard. 

She is now applying for a new Kiva loan with which she will buy potato chips, cookies and other snacks wholesale. She adds that her new vehicle, new route and the wholesale purchase will allow for good discounts and more capital to expand upon her sales. This is exactly what makes her investment successful. She sends a message of gratefulness to the Kiva lenders and says, "Your support is very important, because it contributes to community development and the achievement of goals for families."

loans.use: to buy chips, cookies, cheese snacks and other packaged snacks wholesale.

loans.name: Las Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Las Trabajadoras se encuentra en el 3er ciclo del programa, esta formado por 14 mujeres que se dedican a actividades varias.Las integrantes del comité son muy responsables, solidarias y emprendedoras ya que muchas deben ayudar a sus familiares en los gastos.
La señora Mirian se dedica a vender medicamentos en una pequeña farmacia en la comunidad; de este modo aporta su grano de arena a la canasta familiar de su familia.
El crédito utilizado sería para comprar mayor cantidad de insumos para luego venderlos en su local a un precio razonable, la señora cuenta con los medicamentos de urgencia y de venta libre.
texts.en:
The “Las Trabajadoras” (The Workers) committee is in its third cycle in the program.  It has 14 members, all women who carry out a variety of activities.  The group members are very responsible, supportive and enterprising wince many of them must help their family cover expenses.

Mirian sells medicine in a small pharmacy in her community which is how she’s able to contribute her small grain of sand toward her family’s basic needs.  The loan will be used to buy larger amounts of merchandise to then sell at her shop at reasonable prices.  She stocks first-aid medicines and non-prescription items.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El señor Jorge es soltero de 25 años de edad vive con sus padres y cuenta con su propio negocio.
El señor se dedica a ser comerciante, es propietario de una agro veterinaria con mas de 12 años de experiencia en el ámbito; es una persona emprendedoras y con ganas de salir adelante.
El crédito solicitado sería destino a la comprar de productos veterinarios, desde remedios para los animales, hasta alimentos como purinas, también serviría para comprar las vacunas necesarias que se le deben poder  a los animales.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 25-year-old bachelor, who lives with his parents and has his own business. 

He makes a living as a shopkeeper; he is the owner of a agricultural veterinary shop with more than 12 years of experience in the field. He is entrepreneurial and has the willingness to progress forward. 

The loan he is requesting will be used for the purchase of veterinary goods, from medicine for the animals to food, like Purina brand; it will also be used to purchase the necessary vaccines for the animals.

loans.use: to buy medicine, food, vaccines, and other things.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia Celia sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “SANTO DOMINGO” y las reuniones del banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento del Cusco.

La socia Celia tiene 29 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene un hijo, ella es natural de la ciudad de Mollepata del departamento de Apurímac. Desde hace 20 años que ella vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con las económicas, ella se sigue dedicando a la movilidad escolar pero también se dedica a la venta de ropa de segundo uso, ella vende en una feria sabatina de la ciudad del Cusco desde las 4 am hasta las 6pm de forma ambulatoria. Ya son 5 a 6 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien.  

En esta oportunidad la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo pantalones, casacas, polos, camisas y otras cosas más. La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Celia continues belonging to the communal bank "Santo Domingo" and the communal bank meetings are located in the district of Cusco in the province and department of Cusco. 

Celia is 29 years old and is a single mother of one son. She is a native of the city of Mollepata in the department of Apurimac. She has been living in the beautiful city of Cusco for twenty years. She alternates her work with household responsibilities and work. She continues making a living transporting children to and from school but also sells clothing second hand. She sells as a vendor throughout the Saturday market in Cusco from 4am until 6pm.She has now been doing this work for five or six years and its going very well for her. 

For this opportunity the member needs the loan to buy merchandise including pants, jackets, polos, shirts and other items. She is happy for the loan and is committed to fulfilling her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise including pants, jackets, polos, shirts and more.

loans.name: Ibraheem

texts.en:
Ibraheem is a 31-year-old, married man from Sahab, Jordan.  He has one child.

Ibraheem is requesting a 500 JOD loan to pay for home improvements and painting.  In the future, he would love to improve his family's situation.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 36 years old and married with four children.  She operates a food stall to earn a living, and has been in this business since 2004.

Mariam operates her business in a busy environment with reliable customers.  In addition, she sells coconuts to supplement her income and pay for small expenses.

She dreams of operating a hotel business in the future.  She has requested a loan of 25,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy sugar, cooking oil, and flour.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, and flour for her food stall.

loans.name: Charlse

texts.en:
Charlse is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 3 years, Charlse has been working hard to manage his bar and lodge, which sells drinks like soda, beer and offers lodgings. 

To help expand his business, Charlse has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks like beer and sodas and also renovate the lodge, and will help Charlse to generate greater profits and improve his family's standard of living. Charlse hopes that in the future he will be able to own a well-stocked bar with self-contained rooms for the lodge. 

Charlse is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Charlse who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drinks like beer and sodas and also renovate the lodge

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
Lena lives in Sisian town with her husband, Areg, and 2 little daughters: 2-year-old Mari and 1-year-old Meri. Lena works at Sisian fire service as a telephonist, and her husband is a fireman. However their salaries are not enough to cover their household costs. So, the couple also cultivates wheat, from the sales of which they get additional income. 

To start the autumn sowing, Lena has applied for this loan to purchase wheat seeds and fuel. In addition, she will hire workers, who will do the plowing. This loan is important for Lena and her husband to gather a rich harvest next year and have enough income to make ends meet.

loans.use: to pay for hired workers, wheat seeds and fuel

loans.name: Proave Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal PROAVE; este banco está situado en el distrito de  San Jerónimo en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.

La socia Nely , la socia tiene 30 años de edad, soltera y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando en una empresa privada ,la socia trabaja durante el día de lunes a viernes  ya es buen tiempo que la socia lleva trabajando en esta empresa el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, a la vez la socia vende productos naturales de forma independiente repartiendo a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades y familiares, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a sus hijos.  

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de un electrodoméstico para su hogar.

Los otros socios trabajan en la misma empresa privada que la socia Nely y algunos tienen otros pequeños 
negocios como agroveterinaria, joyería, librería, crianza de animales.

La socia se  siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member, Nely, belongs to the Communal Bank PROAVE.  This bank is located in the district of San Jeronimo in the province of Cusco, department of  Cusco.

Nely is 30 years old, single, and has 2 children, She alternates her daily activities working in a private company. She works during the day Monday through Friday and it has been a good time while she has been working in this company.  The company is doing well thanks to the efforts that she puts in each day at work.  

At the same time, Nely sells natural products independently, distributing to customers such as friends and family.  Nely is a responsible and earnest person, thus being able to raise her children.  

Nely is requesting a loan to buy an appliance for her home.  The other partners work in the same private company as Nely and some have other small businesses, such as agriculture/veterinary supply, jewelry stores, book stores, and animal husbandry.

Nely is grateful for the loan granted and promises to pay her dues on time.

loans.use: to buy an appliance for her home.

loans.name: Ezakiel

texts.fr: Ezakiel est un jeune homme de 28 ans, célibataire.Il gére un centre d'appels téléphoniques dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 08 ans déjà où il vend des crédits de communication et des friandises.Grâce à son expérience et à la bonne maitrise de cette activité,il a acquéri une clientèle considérable au fil des années.Cependant, cette clientèle étant de plus en plus grandissante,le maximum de crédit qu'il est en mesure de se procurer auprès des opérateurs téléphoniques avec son capital ne lui permet guère de satisfaire la demande de celle-ci.il sollicite donc ce crédit afin de pouvoir s'approvisionner convenablement ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire aux mieux sa clientèle et augmentera ses bénéfices. Bénéfices qui lui permettront d'une part de réinvestir dans son activité afin d'étendre ses points de vente et d'autre part de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ezakiel is a young man, 28 years old, who is unmarried. He has been managing a telephone call center in a district in the capital for eight years already. There, he sells communication credits and snacks. Thanks to his experience and his mastery of this business, he has acquired a considerable customer base over the years. 

However, his customer base is growing larger and larger. The credit maximum he is able to procure from telephone providers does not allow him with his capital to satisfy the demand. He is therefore requesting this loan to be able to stock up appropriately, and this will enable him to do the best in satisfying his customers and to increase his profit. 

The profits will enable him not only to reinvest in his business for expanding his sales outlets but also to meet family needs.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of communication credits

loans.name: Mathews

texts.en: Mathews is a 47-year-old, married man.  He has five children with ages ranging from 12 to 25 years.  He describes himself to be a humble and friendly man.  He operates a driving school where he provides driving training and coaching services.  He has been involved in this business for eight years and employs two staff members.  His business is located within an urban area and his primary customers are local residents from the environs and motor vehicle owners.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient training equipment for the students.  He will use the loan of Kes 20,000  to buy spare car parts.  His five year business goal is to buy more cars for training his students.  He hopes that, in the future, he will run another driving school.

loans.use: to buy spare car parts for his driving school car.

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en: Mediatrice is 42 years old. She is married and has four children aged between five and fifteen. She sells beans and tomatoes. She has spent 12 years in the business. With the loan, she wants to add more beans and tomatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to put aside savings which she intends to use in the future, when the money has accumulated.

loans.use: To buy more beans and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman. She has 6 children with ages ranging from 9 months to 14 years. She describes herself to be a quiet and polite woman. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located within housing estates and her primary customers are residents from the estates. She describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. 

Beatrice will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more charcoal to sell. Her business goal is to start a new business of running a restaurant  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will run a big hotel. Beatrice runs a food stall which increases her business income.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
At age 27, Fatuma lives with her husband and is still childless. For four years, she has been selling coconuts from her home, selling to the neighborhood. Desirous to increase her sales and to strengthen her business, she requested and obtained a micro-loan from Yehu, with the objective of meeting consumer demand and increasing her supplemental revenue.

The additional profit will allow her to participate in catering for household expenses and to help her save money to advance her education. The loan will enable her to purchase more coconuts for sale.

loans.use: purchase more coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Qasem

texts.en: Qasem is a 53-year-old married man from Sahab, Jordan, He has 6 children and requested a 2000 JOD loan to buy goods for his grocery store. In the future he would like to open a new grocery store, improve his financial situation, and buy a house.

loans.use: to pay for goods for his grocery store

loans.name: Clemantine

texts.en: Clemantine is 40 years old. She is married and has four children. She sells beans and sorghum. She has been in the business for four years. The loan requested will be used to buy more beans and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to put aside savings for the better future of the business.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Nathalie

texts.fr: Nathalie est une femme de 30 ans, célibataire, mère de 3 enfants qui vont à l'école.Elle est commerçante dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 02 ans où elle vend du poisson à la braise.Son activité est florissante à cause de son savoir faire dans la matière et de son expérience qui lui ont permis au fil du temps d'agrandir et de fidéliser sa clientèle.Mais la petitesse de son capital ne lui permet pas de s'approvisionner en gros ce qui crée de constantes ruptures de stock et une baisse de plus en plus considérable de sa clientèle.Pour éviter une perte définitive de sa clientèle, elle sollicite ce crédit afin de s'approvisionner en gros en poissons ce qui lui permettra d'éviter les ruptures , mais également de retenir ses clients et de gagner d'autres. Les bénéfices que génèreront cet investissement lui permettront d'agrandir son activité, mais également de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Nathalie is an unmarried woman, 30 years old, and the mother of three children, who go to school. She has been a merchant in a district in the capital for two years were she sells roasted fish. Her business is booming because of her savoir-faire in this business and due to her experience. Over the course of time, this has enabled her to expand a loyal customer base. But her low capital fund does not allow her to stock up in bulk, and this leads to regular shortages and an increasingly significant drop in customers. 

To avoid a definitive lost of customers, she is requesting this loan to stock up on fish wholesale enabling her to avoid shortages but also to retain her customers and to earn more of them. The profits this investment will generate will enable her to expand her business and also to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of fish and condiments in bulk for her food stand

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is 23 years old and lives in Gardnersville, Liberia.  She is married.  Her husband is a builder, and they have three children, one of whom lives at home and attends school.

Patience has operated a cook shop (restaurant) for five years.  She was taught how to run the business by her mother.  Her main challenges are price increases for the things she buys.  She is happy when she sells her food and when her food is finished on time.

She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, charcoal by the bag, peppers and oil to continue her cook shop business.  She would like to have money to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase food and supplies for her restaurant.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en: Consolata is 45 years old.  She is married to a businessman.  She owns a boutique where she sells different merchandise.  She has requested a loan to buy more salt, soaps and cooking oil for sale.  The profits from her business will go towards increasing her savings.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush lives in Kapan town with her husband, son, and daughter. Anush and her husband are involved in cattle breeding: they raise cows and chickens. 

Anush would like to increase the number of cattle, for which she needs sufficient funds. With the requested amount she plans to purchase a cow and a calf. Anush hopes to gather more milk, from the sales of which she will get enough income to cover her family's costs and ensure a better future for them.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and a calf.

loans.name: Jartu

texts.en:
Jartu is 40 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She’s married and has three children between the ages of 12 and 21 that are in school and live at home.

Jartu has been selling rice, okra, peppers and palm oil for the past ten years in the local market on a table.  She learned this trade from her mother. Her main challenge is the high cost of the goods. 
 
She’s requesting a loan to purchase more rice, okra, peppers, and palm oil for her business. She would like to own her own shop one day.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, okra, peppers, and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 26 years old. She is married and has three children. She has a boutique and she has been running the boutique for four years. with the loan, she wants to add new merchandise in the boutique such as soaps, cooking oil, biscuits and rice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To add new merchandise in a boutique.

loans.name: Syuzanna

texts.en:
Syuzanna lives in Kapan town with her husband, son, daughter and pensioner father-in-law. Syuzanna's husband is a police officer and helps Syuzanna to run the farm, where they breed cows and keep 25 beehives. 

Syuzanna has applied for this loan to expand her farm. With the requested amount she plans to purchase 2 cows and 8 colonies of bees. This will allow Syuzanna to receive and sell more milk and honey and increase agricultural profit. This is important for Syuzanna to sustain her family and ensure a prosperous life for them.

loans.use: to pay for 2 cows and 8 colonies of bees

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 5 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be outgoing and warm. She operates a grocery stall where she sells tomatoes . Her business is located in a residential business area  and her primary customers are local residents  and shop retailers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be few customers to sell the tomatoes to. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy boxes (crates)  for packaging tomatoes for selling to customers. Her business goal is to be a supplier of tomatoes to other small scale groceries  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve the living standard of her family .

loans.use: to buy boxes ( crates) for packaging tomatoes for selling to customers

loans.name: Jussy

texts.en:
Jussy is 34 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children; 2 of them are currently in school. For the past 7 years, Jussy has been working hard to manage her small business selling clothes. 

To help expand her business, Jussy has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes  for resale and will help Jussy to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Jussy hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a wholesale shop. 

Jussy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jussy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 35 years old and lives in Gardnersville.  She attended school and is a high school graduate. She is married and her husband is a driver.  They have five children who are in school and live at home.  

Comfort has been buying and selling soap, drinks, water.  The biggest problem is when business is slow.  She is proud that her business means that they never go hungry.  She started the business with money from her husband. She’s requesting a loan to purchase more soap, drinks, water for her business. She would like to enlarge her business.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, drinks, water for her business

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 32 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is single and has one child. For the past 6 years, Amos has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells rice, maize flour and dry beans. 

To help expand his business, Amos has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale, and will help Amos to generate greater profits and improve his family standards of living. Amos hopes that in the future he will be able to have the best stocked shop in the center and own a mini supermarket. 

Amos is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Amos who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale,

loans.name: Sadeyeh

texts.en:
Sadeyeh is a 40-year-old married female from Al Nasser, Jordan. She has two children. 

She requested a 400 JOD loan to buy women’s and children’s clothing and sell them afterwards. 

She would like to improve her situation, and in the future she would like to have her own shop and get her children educated.

loans.use: to buy women's and children's clothes and then sell them.

loans.name: Jesus Reel De Bras De Lance Group

texts.fr:
Edilienne est la coordinatrice de son groupe JESUS REEL DE BRAS DE LANCE. Elle est une veuve  et elle a 3 enfants. Edilienne  habite dans la région nord d’Haiti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Edilienne a dirigé son commerce vente de la nourriture cuite pendant les dernières 6 années. Avant de commencer ce commerce, elle cultivait la terre. Elle  voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir  dans un restaurant dont il vend des produits divers tels que boissons gazeuses. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à obtenir un plus grand commerce.

Edilienne dit que ses défi principal sont les manques d'achats et trop de personnes lui ont demande le credit.
Edilienne dit que son but principal  est  d'avoir un  pret plus d'argent pour obtenir un plus grand commerce avec l'aide de DIEU. Des autres membres de sont groupe  ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme le charbon, le produits divers et cosmetiques.
texts.en:
Edilienne is the coordinator of her group JESUS REEL DE BRAS DE LANCE. She is a widow and has three children. She lives in northern Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. 

Edilienne has been running her business selling cooked foods for the last six years. Before starting this business, she used to be a farmer. She would like to use this loan to invest in a restaurant in which to sell various items, such as soft drinks. She hopes that this loan will help her to have a larger business.

She says that her main challenges include a lack of customers and too many people asking her for credit. She says her main goal is to have a larger loan in order to have a larger business, with God's help. 

The other members of her group have need of a loan for such businesses as a variety store or selling cosmetic products.

loans.use: to purchase various goods, such as fizzy drinks to sell

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine lives in Tolors village, Syunik region, with her husband and daughter. 

Marine and her husband are involved in agriculture: they raise cows, lambs, and chickens and cultivate potatoes. 

Marine has applied for this loan to purchase grass. This will allow her to feed the cattle during the winter and continue developing the farm.

loans.use: to pay for grass to feed the cattle this winter.

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina is from Cabawan District, Tagbilaran City. She is married, with eight children. Her eldest is 23 years old, and her youngest is 3. 

It is quite a challenge for her to provide for her children while she relies on hog raising and a food-vending business for an income. 

She is asking for a loan to buy feed for her hogs and ingredients like vegetables, cooking oil, soy sauce, and other seasonings. Her loan will serve as an additional income to better sustain her business. 

Her profit will be for her family's daily consumption and school fees. In the future, she would like to make a bigger barn and to cook more diishes to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs and ingredients like vegetables, cooking oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
Zhanna lives in Goris town with her husband. The couple keeps chickens, cultivates potatoes and beans, and grows fruit trees.

Zhanna would like to purchase special incubators in which she can keep eggs for a few weeks before they become chickens. Zhanna will then sell the chickens. She also wants to purchase wheat and barley to feed the chickens. In addition, she plans to increase the number of chickens by purchasing 150 more. 

The implementation of all these goals will help Zhanna to earn more income from agriculture and invest in its further development.

loans.use: to pay for chickens, wheat, barley, and two incubators for chickens.

loans.name: Jescar

texts.en:
Jescar is a 40-year-old landlady in Mariakani and a married mother of four. She has been a landlady for the past seven years, and she is doing great. 

This is her eighth loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to renovate her rental houses. She will use the anticipated profits to build more houses for rent. She hopes to own several rental houses in Mombasa.

loans.use: To renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 41 years old and is from Kaiboi. She is married with three kids. She has been in the second-hand clothing business for the last 10 years earning a monthly income of 12,000 KES. 

This is her first loan with KADET, LTD. and she plans to use the amount of 20,000 KES to buy a bale of second-hand clothes for resale. She will use the profits from the business for loan repayment and the remaining amount on sustaining her family. 

She hopes to open a clothing shop in town.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, a 32-year-old married mother of four, has enjoyed great success as a retail shop proprietor in Mombasa for the past five years. This will be Jane’s third business loan from KADET LTD with which she plans to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil and tea leaves. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan.

Jane hopes to have a well-known business and maintain her happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil and tea leaves.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie est une femme de 36 ans fiancée, mère d'enfants, qui vont encore à l'école. Elle a ouvert un restaurant à l'air libre qu'elle gère depuis 5 ans déjà. c'est grâce à lui qu'elle s'occupe de sa famille. Le fait d'acheter les produit de restauration en détail ne rapporte vraiment grand chose pour elle. D'où l'importance de ce crédit pour son activité parce que ça lui permettra d'acheter 2 sacs de d'arachide, 1 sac de riz et un carton de poisson frais pour cuisiner ses plats. Cela lui évitera les déplacements quotidiens et diminuera ses frais de taxi, ça augmentera aussi ses bénéfices. Elle réinvestira une partie de ce profit pour refaire les locaux de son restaurant, l'autre l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie is a 36-year-old woman who is engaged to be married. She is the mother of one child, who still goes to school. Marie opened an open-air restaurant that she has been running for five years now. Thanks to this business, she is taking care of her family. 

Given that she makes her purchases at the retail level, her restaurant does not really bring in much profit for her, thus the importance of this loan for her business, since it will enable her to buy 2 sacks of peanuts, a sack of rice, and a box of fresh fish for makgin her dishes. This will prevent her from having to make daily trips and will reduce her taxi costs. It will also increase her profits. She will reinvest part of her profits in fixing up her location and in meeting the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a box of fresh fish, rice, and peanuts to cook and sell at her open-air restaurant

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 55 years old. She is married and has five children between the ages of 23 and 35. Only one is a student attending high school; the others have completed their studies. She wants a loan to buy more nets for use in fishing. She has been a fisher for nine years. She plans to use the profits to buy cows that can provide milk for the health of the family.

loans.use: to buy nets for catching fish to sell.

loans.name: Munay Tika Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MUNAY TIKA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marcosa ella es casada y tiene 49 años y tiene 6 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de maíz,la socia tiene un negocio de agricultura,ella cultiva maíz,papa y trigo,la socia tambien se dedica al negocio de venta de chicha y tambien la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de maíz,la socia ya se dedica 10 años al negocio de venta de maíz y venta de chicha,la socia vende maíz en el mercado desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta salir con sus hijos a pasear,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender el maíz y tambien la chicha. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz al por mayor y tambien insumos para que prepare chicha.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de venta de fruta y negocio de tienda de abarrotes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Munay Tika communal bank.  This bank is in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Marcosa, a member, is 49 years old, married, and has six children.  She works in her business of selling corn.  She has a farming business.  She grows corn, potatoes, and wheat.  She also has a business selling “chicha” [a corn based drink].  She sells corn at the market from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.

In her free time she likes to go out and take walks with her children.  Marcosa’s dream is to have a place where she is able to sell corn and also chicha.

She is requesting the loan to buy corn wholesale and to buy ingredients to make chicha.

The other members have farming businesses. There is a business selling vegetables, a business selling fruit, and a grocery store.

Marcosa is grateful to those that make up part of this dream through the loan.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale and to buy ingredients to make chicha.

loans.name: Claris

texts.en:
Claris is now 37 years old and is still operating her tailoring business in Mombasa. Her business has been doing well and she is grateful for that. 

This is Claris' second business loan from KADET, LTD.,which she is using to finance her business. She plans to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing threads, and clothing materials. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase clothing materials and repay her loan. 

She hopes to have a bigger, successful business.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing threads, and clothing materials

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard, a married father of four children ranging from 1 to 12 years of age, describes himself as a polite, jovial and self-motivated man. For the past three years Benard has operated a business providing motorcycle transportation services. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are local residents. His biggest business challenge is insecurity within the area.

Benard will use this Kes 20,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. His business goal is to buy a taxi to provide transportation services to tourists from Kisumu airport to various areas within the next five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 54 years old and married, with two kids. She has been in the cereals business for the past 20 years, earning about KES 7,400 monthly. 

This is her second loan with KADET LTD, after successfully repaying her previous loan. She has borrowed KES 20,000 and plans to use it on purchasing dry maize for resale.  With the anticipated profits, she plans to use it in repaying her loan and in running her business. 

She hopes to open another cereals shop in future.

loans.use: To purchase dry maize for resale.

loans.name: Linny

texts.en:
Linny is 25 years old and is from Kaiboi. She is married with four kids. She has been in the second-hand clothing business for the last 4 years earning a monthly income of 8,000 KES. 

This is her first loan with KADET, LTD. and she plans to purchase a bale of second-hand clothes for resale. She will use the profits from the business on loan repayment and the remaining amount on sustaining her family. 

She hopes to open a clothing shop in town.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Jilani

texts.en:
Jilani is a 38-year-old timber seller in Kilifi. He is a married father of five, and he has been selling timber for the past two years with success.

This marks his third business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase more timber. He will use the anticipated profits to plough back into the business and use the rest to educate his children. 

He hopes to excel in this business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To purchase more timber.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 31 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have two children, 12 and 16 years old, who live at home and attend school. 

For the past ten years Patricia has been selling coal and pepper.  She was taught how to run the business by her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more coal, okra, bitter ball (an eggplant-like vegetable), and pepper for her business. Her plan is to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more coal, okra, bitter ball, and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 33-year-old timber seller in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. He is married, and he has been selling timber for the past five years with success.

This marks his third business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase more timber. He will use the anticipated profits to plough back into the business. 

He hopes to excel in this business and in life.

loans.use: To purchase more timber.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 32 года. Он женат. Его жена домохозяйка. Фарход имеет среднее образование. Он более пяти лет занимается скотоводством. Фарход разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Он берет кредит для закупа теленка и овец.
texts.en:
Farhod is a thirty-two-year-old married man who lives with his wife in Kulob, Tajikistan. His wife takes care of their household while Farhod makes a living by breeding cattle. For the past five years he's run this business of breeding and fattening cattle for sale. 

He's asking for a loan in order to purchase a calf and some sheep.

loans.use: to buy a calf and sheep.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is 42 years old and lives in Gardnersville, She is single and has three children between 9 and 19 years old. For the past 3 years, she has been selling bonnie fish, meat, etc., in the market.  She started the business with money from her mother. She’s requesting a loan to purchase bonnie fish, meat, etc., for her business. She would like to  enlarge her business and run her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase bonnie fish, meat, etc., for her business

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en: Alvard runs a shop, where she sells flowers and gifts. She started this business about 5 months ago, and during this short period, due to friendly service and original design of bouquets, Alvard has gained a large number of loyal customers. Now Alvard needs to increase the variety of flowers in the shop, for which she has applied for this loan.  It is important for Alvard to stay competitive in the market and keep stable development of her business, ensuring prosperity for her family. Alvard lives with her husband, two daughters and parents-in-law.

loans.use: to pay for flowers

loans.name: Regie

texts.en:
Regie is a 32-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. He has five young children. 

Regie is a fisherman, and he has been in this business for more than 15 years now. This is the source of his income.

Regie is in need of additional capital for his business. He is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy new fishing nets and fuel and to repair his fishing boat. With this, he will be able to enhance his daily catch, thus allowing him to sell more fish to the market.

In the future, Regie dreamed of expanding his business. Moreover, he wants to earn more for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel and to repair his fishing boat

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 22-year-old salon owner in Mariakani. She is single and has been running her business for the past two years successfully.

This marks her first loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase new blow driers, hair tongs, hair foods, hair chemicals, and hair rollers. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and open another salon. 

She hopes to have a more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase new blow driers, hair tongs, hair foods, hair chemicals, and hair rollers.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 25 year-old clothes dealer in Kongowea, Mombasa. He is single and has been selling clothes for the past four years with success.

This marks his second business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase more shirts, skirts, dresses and trousers. He will use the anticipated profits to open another clothes shop. He hopes to excel in this business and in life.

loans.use: To purchase more shirts, skirts, dresses and trousers.

loans.name: Soltei

texts.en:
Soltei is now 31 years old.  He is married and blessed with four children. He has been in this business for the last four years and it earns him a monthly income of 12,150 shillings.


This will be his first loan with KADET LTD. He will use the loan to buy more livestock like goats, sheep, and cows for resale.  He hopes to be a prominent livestock farmer.

loans.use: To buy more livestock

loans.name: Dodo

texts.en:
Dodo is 61 years old and lives in a small village of Zestaponi district. She has a husband, two grown sons, a granddaughter and a daughter-in-law. Dodo and her husband are provided with a retirement pension. Dodo’s daughter-in-law works in Greece to help her family. Her sons are builders and get monthly income. Dodo is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, she has a plot of land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. In addition, the family owns a vineyard.  They pick grapes and produce wine and vodka.  Besides these activities, Dodo has a small dairy farm. She owns 3 milking cows and produces cheese. She has 2 pigs as well. Dodo sells her agricultural and dairy production locally: grapes, wine, vodka, cheese and piglets.

She requested a loan for purchasing a milking cow. Dodo will be able to produce and sell more cheese. Thus, she wants to expand her business in order to earn a good profit. With increased profits, she will be able to reinvest in her agricultural business, as well as spend more on the family’s daily needs and the living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Khamis

texts.en:
Khamis is still running his retail shop in Mariakani and is happy that his business is able to meet his family's needs. 

This is his second business loan from KADET LTD.  He plans to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil and tea leaves. He will use the anticipated profits to plow back into the business and repay his loan.  He hopes to have a well-known business.

loans.use: To purchase more salt, sugar, washing detergents and maize flour.

loans.name: Olma

texts.ru:
Олме 47 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Она очень трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. С самых ранних лет она занималась шитьем. После занятий в школе она шила платье девушкам и женщинам своего кишлака, чтобы зарабатывать деньги для содержания семьи. После замужество она продолжала  свое дело и на добавок занималась скотоводством. Чтобы прокормить детей муж Олмы начал продавать мясо скота, которого откармливала Олма. Уже более 20 лет она занимается этим бизнесом. 
Олма хочет, чтобы ее дети получили высшее образование. Ее младшая дочь поступила в университет в этом году, но у Олмы нет денег для оплаты учебы ее дочери. Она запрашивает кредит для оплаты учебы в университет. Она и ее дочь ждут вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Olma is forty-seven years old. She's married and a mother to three children. Olma is very hard working and driven. She began sewing in her childhood. She would sew dresses for women and girls in her village after school in order to support her family. She continued to sew after marriage while helping her husband raise cattle. She would fatten the cattle and her husband would sell the meat so that they could feed their children. This has been their livelihood for the past twenty years. 

Olma wants her children to receive a good education. Her youngest daughter was accepted to a university this year, but they don't have enough money to pay the tuition fees. She's asking for a loan in order to pay them. They hope for your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her daughters' college tuition.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 34 years old. She lives in the village of Shilda, Kakheti Region, with her family -- her husband and parents-in-law. Salome’s parents-in-law are provided with a retirement pension. 

The family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, they have a plot of land, where maize is grown. In addition, Salome owns a vineyard. 

The family picks grapes and produces wine, which is sold locally. Salome owns two milk cows and a calf. She milks the cows every day and produces cheese and sells it at the local market. 

Besides her business, she works as a nurse and gets a monthly income. Salome is very hard-working woman, with a great desire to get ahead.

She requested a loan to build a kitchen. Salome had planned to sell a cow to purchase building materials.  With this credit, she will be able to keep the cow and buy necessary things for the kitchen. She will continue her dairy business and sell cheese again. This will increase the income of the family. 

With the increased income, Salome plans to purchase calves and expand her business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Tawah

texts.en: Tawah lives in Gardernesville.  She is 35 years old, married, and has three children, ages 5 to 13.  Her children live at home and attend school.  For the past ten years, she has been selling used clothes.  She learned this way of selling from her mother and started her business with money given to her by her mother.  She enjoys the flow of customers and the profit she receives each day.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business.  In the future, she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en: Ma. Luisa is 38 years old and comes from Panglao, Bohol. She is married and has two dependent children. Ma. Luisa and her husband have been engaged in their fishing business for 10 years now. This is her main livelihood to support her family. She is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, fishing weights, nylon for fishing net repair and materials for making a fence. These will be helpful so their fishing activity will be more productive and successful. The income that they will generate from fishing will be used to buy healthy meals for her family and pay for school fees.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, fishing weights, nylon for fishing net repair and materials for making fence

loans.name: Chacha

texts.en:
Chacha is now fifty years old.  He is married to Jackline, who assists him in farming. They are blessed with two children.  He has been in this business for seven years now and earns a monthly income of thirteen thousand one hundred shillings. 

This will be his first loan with KADET LTD. He will use the loan to support his farming business by buying seedlings, sprays, insecticides, and tomatoes.
He plans to use the anticipated profit to buy more acres of land for farming.

loans.use: To buy more seedlings

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 52 years old and lives in a small village with her family. She has a husband, a grown son and a daughter-in-law. Her husband has chronic health problems and gets a relevant pension from the local government. Marine’s son works at a warehouse and gets a monthly salary. Marine is involved in the dairy business. In particular, she has a milk cow and a calf. Marine milks the cow every day and produces cheese, which is sold locally. She is a very hard-working woman, with a rich experience in her work.
Marine requested a loan for purchasing food for cattle.  She will purchase hay, which will be used for feeding the cow during the fall and winter seasons. Hay is cheap now and the price increases by 30-40% in the fall months. Marine significantly saves on the costs of feeding the cows. Since the cows will be fed properly in winter, they will give a planned amount of milk to the family.  This will increase the family income and Marine will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase food for cattle

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 47 years old and lives in Gardnersville.  She’s married and her husband is a businessman.  They have five children between 10 and 25 years old, who live at home.   Three attend school.  For the past twenty years, Alice has been selling use clothes.  She was taught how to run the business by her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more use clothes for her business.  She plans is to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more use clothes for her business

loans.name: Tomor

texts.en:
Tomor is 54 and married. He is an Egyptian from the vulnerable ethnic minority community of Albanian-Egyptians living in the southeastern part of the country, in the suburbs of a major city. He has two children, 23 and 16 years old who both attend school. He is the only financial supporter for his family.

For the past eight years, Tomor has been selling and transporting goods with his truck. The services he has been offering to locals are in demand in the region where he serves. Through these services, he has been able to build a little house for his family. Recently, his truck broke down and now needs repairing. This is the reason why he is requesting a loan from Kiva and hopes that lenders will be supporting him. In return, his promise is that he will pay back the loan just like he has in the past the other three loans.

loans.use: To repair the truck

loans.name: Samiha

texts.en:
Samiha is a 48-year-old married woman from Sahab, Jordan. She has four children and has requested a 600 Jordanian dinar loan to pay for home improvements and painting. In the future, she would like to buy a house. 

For cultural reasons, Samiha prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the photo is of her son.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Esma

texts.en:
Esma is 37 years old. She lives in the Kaspi district with her parents, who are provided with a retirement pension. 

Esma runs her animal husbandry business. She owns a milk cow, a calf and four pigs. She milks the cow every day and produces dairy products which are sold locally. She sells piglets as well. Esma is a very hardworking woman, but she still doesn't have enough income to make some savings and expand her animal husbandry business.

She requested a loan to purchase food for the pigs. Esma plans to raise them and sell them during the winter season. This will increase her income. With the increased income, she will be able to expand her business and make it more profitable. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase food for the pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Magdalena

texts.en: Ma. Magdalena is 47 years old from the community of Cortes, Bohol. She is married and has one child who is 15 years old. Ma. Magdalena is a Sari-sari store owner and is also in a hog raising business. She is doing her best so she can be of help in raising her family.
