In her store, she sells basic household items like toiletries, seasoning, snack foods and soft drinks. She is asking for a loan to buy in bulk more soft drinks, seasoning and toiletries. The income that she will generate will help her in buying a healthy diet. In the future, she would like to venture into other business opportunities and make a bigger barn for her hogs for a better income.

loans.use: to buy in bulk more soft drinks, seasoning and toiletries

loans.name: Rabina

texts.en:
Rabina is a merchant who has run a sari-sari (or convenience) store for more than 12 years. This is the source of her income. Rabina works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. 

Rabina needs additional funds for the expansion of her business. She is requesting a loan worth 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, noodles and other dry goods, snack foods, etc. With this loan, she will be able to augment her stock and attract more customers in her store.

In the future, Rabina dreams of improving her family's standard of living. Moreover, she wants to continually send her children to school to attain higher levels of learning and education.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, noodles and other dry goods, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Silvia Eugenia

texts.es:
SILVIA TIENE 29 AÑOS DE EDAD VIVE EN UNION LIBRE CON EL COMPAÑERO Y CON CON LOS HIJOS VIVEN EN LA CUIDAD DE VENTANAS PROVINCIA DE LOS RIOS.

LA VENTANILLA EL LAUREL SE ENCUENTRAS UBICADA EN EL RECINTO EL ALUREL DE LA PARROQUIA ZAPOTAL NUEVO PERTENECIENTE AL CANTON VENTANAS SE DEDICA A LABORES AGRICOLAS

SILVA SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRA DE MAIZ, ARROZ Y FREJOL ADEMAS A LA CRIANZA DE GALLINAS Y CERDOS, CON CREDITO LE AYUDADO A INVERTIR EN SEMILLAS, ABONOS, Y FERTILIZANTES PARA LOS CULTIVOS Y EN BALANCEADO PARA LOS ANIMALES.  EL CREDITO ES DE GRAN AYUDA PARA AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION.

EL SUEÑO DE SILVIA ES MEJORAR LOS CULTIVOS PARA TENER MAS PRODUCION

 LE GUSTA SALIR DE PASEO CON LA FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Silvia is 29 years old and in a common-law relationship with her partner. They live with their children in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The Communal Bank “El Laurel” is located the neighborhood of El Laurel in Zapotal Nuevo Parish, which is in the canton of Ventanas. The members engage in farm work.

Silvia is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. In addition, she raises chickens and pigs. This loan will help her to invest in seeds, compost, and fertilizers for her crops and balanced feed for her animals. The loan will also be helpful with increasing production.

Silvia dreams of improving her crops so that she can produce more. She enjoys going for walks with her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals and seeds, compost, and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabita is 33 years old.  She is married and has one child, aged 2.  

In 2005, Sabita established  her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW.  She used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her store.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  

Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  

While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

In the future, Sabita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods in bulk for her store.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Sarita is 30 years old.  She is married and has one child, aged 9.  

In 2005, she established her tailoring business.  Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW.  She used her most recent to buy raw materials for her tailoring business.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability. 

In the future, Sarita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buys raw materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Juana Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia Juana Elizabeth sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “SANTO DOMINGO” y las reuniones del banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento del Cusco.

La socia Juana Elizabeth tiene 41 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos, ella es natural de la ciudad Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella se dedica al negocio de venta de accesorios para carros, ella vende aceites, tornillos, parabrisas, llantas y entre otros repuestos.  Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar accesorios de carros como, fundas, tornillo, llantas, pistones y parabrisas al por mayor. La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Juana Elizabeth continues to belong to the communal bank Santo Domingo, and the bank's meetings are located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Juana Elizabeth is 41 years old, single, and has two children.  She is a native of the city of Cusco and lives in the same city where she was born.  She makes a living through the business of selling spare parts for cars.  She sells motor oil, screws, windshields, tires, and other parts.  She has already spent many years in this business and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts in her work.  This time she needs the loan in order to buy spare car parts like covers, screws, tires, pistons and windshields at wholesale cost.  The member is happy for the loan and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy spare car parts like covers, screws, tires, pistons and windshields at wholesale cost.

loans.name: Ratna Shova

texts.en:
Ratna Shova is 45 years old.   She is married and has two children, ages 28 and 24.  

In 1998, she established  her tailoring business.  Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW.  She used her most recent to buy raw materials for her tailoring business. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability. 

 In the future, Ratna Shova plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Corazon Group

texts.en:
Mariela is a single woman, 23 years of age.  She lives with her parents and several siblings in a rural area of Pachaj, Totonicapán, Guatemala. 

Mariela is a weaver.  She uses the ancient back-strap loom method, learned from her mother from a young age, to hand-weave a variety of products.  She sells her pieces on the side of a road in a market that is about 20 minutes from her home. 

Despite her young age, Mariela believes that she has overcome many challenges in her life.  Although she was an outstanding student, family circumstances forced her to drop out of school in the sixth grade.  She remains very positive and is focusing her energy and passion on building her business.

Mariela is so excited to have found Friendship Bridge.  This will be her first loan cycle with the organization and her first experience with a microloan.  With her new loan, she plans to buy a sewing machine to start a new garment business. Mariela says, "I am so happy to receive this loan, since it will ignite my dream."

Along with Mariela, eight additional women make up the Trust Bank Corazon (heart).  These ladies meet once a month with Friendship Bridge staff to receive a participatory non-formal education, which will help to reinforce their knowledge in important aspects in daily life, such as women's health, self-esteem, hygiene, loan and business management and administration, among others. 

Mariela indicates that she is very happy to be able to meet with her friends for these meetings over next 12 months (the length of the loan).  Her loan will not only provide essential capital to start her dream business, but the participatory lessons will also allow her to continue her education.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Ayni Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal AYNI; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Wanchaq en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.

La socia Noemí, la socia tiene 61 años de edad, casada y tiene 05 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de lavandería, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio, la socia trabaja con distintos hoteles que solicitan sus servicios, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera poder salir adelante y seguir apoyando a su familia

La socia solicita el préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento de las maquinas.

Los otros socios se dedican a la hotelería, venta de artesania, turismo, docencia, enfermería.

La socia se  siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the AYNI communal bank which is located in the district of Wanchaq, province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

The member Noemí is 61 years old is married and has 5 children. She goes between her daily activities with her laundry business and has done so for a long time. Noemí does well in her business thanks to the hard work that she puts in as she works for different hotels that require her services. The member is a very responsible and diligent person since it is the way she is able to help her family get ahead in life. The member wishes to keep working so that she can get ahead and continue to support her family.

The member needs the loan to make maintenance repairs to her laundry machines.

The other members of the communal bank are in the hotel business, selling artisanal goods, tourism, education and nursing.

Noemí is grateful for the loan and is committed to meeting all of her payment quotas.

loans.use: make maintenance repairs to her laundry machines.

loans.name: Luz Y Vida Group

texts.en:
In one of the rural areas of San Francisco El Alto, located in the western part of the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala, Mrs. Ceferina and her family strive every day looking for a better life.

Ceferina, 40 years old, has seven children (two girls and five boys). She and her husband are dedicated to garments, including formal outfits, pants, sweat suits, and school uniforms, among others.

Nine women including Ceferina formed the trust bank called Luz y Vida (Light and Life) in August last year. Each one of these ladies have paid back their loans successfully, and now they all are moving to a new loan cycle.

The first loan was a huge boost for Ceferina’s business because it gave her three potential new clients, who are demanding considerable amounts of products. Ceferina and her husband have recently employed five people. They supply them with materials so they can finish making the products. That way Cerefina can cover all the demands of her customers.  

Ceferina did not hesitate to start a new loan cycle with Friendship Bridge Organization because she has more demand than usual for this time of the year. She will use this new loan to buy fabric and thread to distribute to her employees so they can start working on the existing orders. Ceferena is satisfied that she is able to support other people’s economy by giving jobs to these five people, who also have large families.

Ceferina in turn appreciates the effort and dedication of people throughout the world who are supporting the progress of rural communities in Guatemala, where access to loans is limited, but there are people who trust and believe in them.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La socia Erika sigue perteneciendo  al banco comunal “Santo Domingo”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia Erika tiene 45 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, ella es natural de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella se sigue teniendo su restaurant, ella sigue preparando  desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, ella sigue preparando platos como pollo al horno, estofado de pollo, sopas y entre otros platos. 

La socia Erika solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para compra por ejemplo pollo, carnes, verduras y fideos al por mayor, ella está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Erika continues to be a part of the Santo Domingo communal bank which is located in the district of Cusco, part of the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

The member Erika is 45 years old and has a common law marriage of which she has three children. Erika is a native of the city of Cusco, a place where she was born and continues to live and established her restaurant. She still continues to make breakfasts, lunches and diners and preparing dishes like baked chicken, braised chicken, soups, etc.

Erika needs the loan to buy foodstuffs wholesale like chicken, meats, vegetables, and spaghetti. She is happy to have the loan and is committed to making all her payments.

loans.use: buy foodstuffs wholesale like chicken, meats, vegetables, and spaghetti.

loans.name: Mphithizeli

texts.en:
My name is Mphithizeli. I'm 22 years old and I'm from Rustenburg in North West Province. I am studying for a Bachelor of Business Administration at the Maharishi Institute.  

I am from a disadvantaged small village in terms of education, and a family which is not financially stable. I am the first to attend university because our family was unable put us all in school at once. I was raised by my grandparents, who also paid my school fees. They have also been providing me with anything I needed until l completed my high school certificate. In my spare time, I enjoy playing soccer, volleyball and reading spiritual and motivational books.

My hopes after graduation are to get a good job, to eventually start my own business in my village, and to help transform South Africa through various community projects. My dream is to see a beautiful South Africa with no crime.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Living Jesus Group

texts.en:
Eva is 32 years old. She is married with three children. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc. to increase her inventory. She deems it a big opportunity to expand her business. She hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more for the children’s education and also to help her spouse to build their house. 

She belongs to the community group called Living Jesus Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to the loan and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 47 years old and married. She is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She has two children who have helped her in taking care of their corn. They have been in planting corn for 20 years and earn PHP 6,890 a month. 

This year, Avelina joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizer and for weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and for weeding costs.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Evangelina, se dedica a prestar servicio con un molino de nixtamal, también administrar una pequeña tienda de productos domésticos, es madre soltera de tres hijos, sus negocios le han ayudado para poder salir adelante con sus necesidades, éstos han surgido por iniciativa propia y tiene más de dos años de estar atendiendo.

Solicita este prestamo para comprarse materiales para la tienda, como lo son jabones, detergentes, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, y también invertirá una parte en la compra de discos para los molinos, fajas; el crédito le ayudará a mejorar su servicio en el negocio y a continuar trabajando por el bienestar familiar.

Su objetivo es ampliar el negocio a futuro y tener un local para el molino donde pueda brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Evangelina provides grinding services for making cornmeal. She also manages a small store where she sells household products. Evangelina is a single mother with three children. Her businesses have helped her get ahead with providing for their needs. She started her businesses through her own initiative and they have been in operation for more than two years.

Evangelina is requesting a loan so that she can buy goods for her store such as soap, detergents, beans, rice, and sugar. She will also invest part of the loan in the purchase of discs and belts for her grain mill. The loan will help to improve the service in her business and to continue working so that she can provide for her family’s welfare.

Her goals are to expand her business in the future and to have a shop for her grain mill where her customers will be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store and discs and belts for her grain mill.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic lives in Molicay, Ozamis City. She has earned income through providing transportation services for five years to support the needs of her four children. She gets an income of 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for this business. 

For a 39-year-old mother, there’s nothing more that can make her happy except to see her children successful in their studies. Without hesitation, Marivic borrows the amount of 6,500 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to repair her transport vehicle used in her business and provide her children a better education. She joined GDMPC in 2009. Her plan in the future is to hopefully improve her business.

loans.use: to repair her transport vehicle used in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 63 years old, married with one child, and resides at Santa Cruz, Tangub City, in the Philippines. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting bananas to earn a living, which she has been doing for 25 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). 

Teresita has requested a loan of 14,500 PHP to purchase additional seeds and seedlings to raise. She has been a member of Mindanao cooperative GDMPC since 2009. In the future, Teresita wants to make improvements to her house and support her child's studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional banana seeds and seedlings to raise.

loans.name: Llapallanchis Purisunchis Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal LLAPALLANCHIS PURISUNCHIS; este banco está situado en el departamento de Cusco.

La socia Juana, la socia tiene 75 años de edad, viuda y tiene 09 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes ,la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche,golosinas,gaseosas entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone  a su negocio ,la socia a la vez vende fruta  en la puerta de su tienda ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia sale adelante y puede seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería como gaseosas.

Los otros socios se dedican a la artesania, venta de flores, venta de artefactos, carpintería, transporte, servicio de taxi.

La socia se  siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The borrower is a member of the communal bank "LLAPALLANCHIS PURISUNCHIS", which is located in the department of Cusco. 

The group member, Juana, is 75 years old. She is a widow and has 9 children. Along with her daily activities she also runs a grocery store. She sells different types of products like rice, sugar, milk, snacks, sodas and other things. She has had this business for many years. Her business does well thanks to the determination she applies to her work. She also sells fruit from outside the door of her store. She is a responsible and earnest person, which allows her to get ahead and continue helping her family. 

The communal bank member requested the loan to buy merchandise, like sodas, for her store.  

The other communal bank members make a living working as artisans, selling flowers, selling artifacts, doing carpentry, providing transportation, and providing taxi service.   

The communal group member is thankful for the loan that is being provided and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to restock her store with things like sodas.

loans.name: Ceriss

texts.en:
Ceriss is a married mother of two. She is 31 years old and lives in Malaubang, Osamiz City, in the Philippines. Ceriss owns and operates a motorcycle transport business, which she established as a way of generating extra income of 9,600 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month. She has been engaged in this business for four years. 

Ceriss has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories. She has been a good member of GDMPC since 2010 and, in the future, wants to purchase more motorcycles to use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Xiomara Deyanira

texts.es: Xiomara  Deyanira de  32 años de edad, acompañada con un hijo de tres años su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, la cual consiste en la venta de pantalones, blusas, camisetas, entre otros, ella distribuye su mercadería de forma ambulante y a domicilio, tiene 9 años de experiencia con una pulpería y poco a poco fue cambiando el negocio en la actualidad vende solamente mercadería en general. El  uso del préstamo para invertir en el inventario de su mercadería y  compra ropa nueva variada.
texts.en:
Xiomara Deyanira is 32 years old and lives with her three-year-old son. Her business involves selling general merchandise such as trousers, blouses, T-shirts, and other items. She sells her merchandise as a street vendor and from home. Xiomara has nine years of experience managing a grocery store and gradually transitioned into her current business of selling only general merchandise.

This loan will be invested in merchandise for her inventory, such as a variety of new clothing.

loans.use: to buy a variety of new clothing.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La Sra Rosa tiene 26 años, es casada y no tiene hijos, vive en su casa propia en un barrio muy tranquilo.
La Sra Rosa y su marido fabrican chipitas y palitos salados. Ambos se encuentran en el negocio por que les va muy bien y cuentan con una clientela formada  y venden a un precio accesible.
Ella solicita el crédito para comprar mayor cantidad de productos para hacer las chipas y los palitos salados, como aceites para fritar, almidón, leche, harina de maíz, etc.
texts.en:
Rosa is 26 years old, she is married and does not have any children. She lives in her own home, in a very calm neighborhood. 

Rosa and her husband make "chipitas" (a traditional cheese bread) and "palitos salados" (salty bread sticks). They both work in the business because it is doing very well. They have a good customer base and have reasonable prices.

She has requested a loan to buy products in bulk to make the "chipitas" and "palitos salados", like cooking oil for frying, starch, milk, corn flour, etc.

loans.use: to buy products like cooking oil, corn flour, starch, etc.

loans.name: Zablon

texts.en:
Zablon is applying for a loan to support his studies for a year at the Maharishi Institute. This is his story:

My name is Zablon, I am 22 years old and I am studying for my Bachelor of Business Administration at the Maharishi Institute. My hobbies are singing in the church choir, reading newspapers and magazines and playing soccer. I am the first in my family to attend university. My family lives in Thokoza where my mother is a domestic worker, and my father is a taxi driver. 

I plan to graduate in 2014 and after graduation, I hope to find a stable occupation in the corporate world. Someday I would like to start my own business and my dream is to assist other people, to help them to enjoy the opportunities I have been given. I'd like to get my Masters degree, become financially stable, and buy my first house.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Zablon from South Africa

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Dimakatso

texts.en:
Dimakatso is applying for a loan to support her studies for a year at the Maharishi Institute. This is her story:

Hello, I'm Dimakatso, from Daveyton in Johannesburg. I am 20 years old and I am pursuing a Bachelor of Business Administration at the Maharishi Institute. 

I am the firstborn from the family of six. My father is the breadwinner in my family, and we are all in school. We also live with a cousin whose parents have passed away. My hobbies include reading and writing. 

After graduation I hope to work in the Finance Department in a company, as finance is the field I am most interested in. Afterwards, I would like to own my own company, so that I can support my family. I think in these days we are living in, opportunity comes to those who are educated and there are no shortcuts to success. Education is the only doorway to ensuring a worthwhile living.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Nkululeko

texts.en:
Nkululeko is applying for a loan to support his studies for a year at the Maharishi Institute. This is his story:

My name is Nkululeko, I'm 22 and I am from Diepkloof, in Soweto. I am studying for  a Bachelor of Business Administration at the Maharishi Institute.

Both my parents are deceased and I am living with my grandmother, my brother, my cousin and my nephew. The household is run on the monthly pension grant that my grandmother receives from the government.  I fully depend on my grandmother for my school expenses. In my spare time I read newspapers, listen to music, play soccer, do graffiti and gardening.

I plan to graduate by 2014. I'd like to buy a house and bring financial liberation to my family. I hope to be employable after graduation, and I hope to have the knowledge and confidence to start my own business. My long-term goal after graduation is to enrol in an MBA program and start an NGO (Non Governmental Organisation).

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Beryl

texts.en:
Beryl is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Beryl has a printing shop that prints tarpaulins and banners. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy materials needed in printing.

Beryl is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Beryl hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed in printing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making ice candy.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a widow and the mother of six children. She is 52 years old and lives in the village of Kinuman Sur in Ozamis City. Susan owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. She established the motorcycle transport business as a way of generating extra income of 3,600 PHP per month. She has been engaged in this type of service for 8 years. Susan requested a loan of 6,500 PHP from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories. Susan has been a good member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Susan wants to purchase more motorcycles to use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is applying for a loan to support his studies for a year at the Maharishi Institute. This is his story:

My name is Stanley, I'm 34 years old and I am studying towards my Bachelor of Business Administration the Maharishi Institute. I was born in Queenstown, in the Cape. My hobbies are reading novels and newspapers, watching television, especially cricket, and listening to music.

My father died 10 years ago. My mother is now remarried and we are not in contact. My grandmother has been taking care of me since I was a child, and my dream is to get a good job to provide for her. I am from a very poor family, so any help would be highly appreciated. I just want to change my family's condition for the better.

I plan to graduate in 2014, and afterwards I would like to get an MBA and have a family. Education is important to me as it is self-liberating, and the only thing that can bring hope to the hopeless. It is why I haven't given up on my dreams of obtaining a degree and making good.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena  is  47  years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Rowena  has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She had this business for eight years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Rowena has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. 

In the future, Rowena hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Kristiel

texts.en:
Kristiel  is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with three children. 

Kristiel  has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.  Kristiel is a new member of HSPFI.

In the future, Kristiel hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa  is  44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with three children.

Elisa  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for nine  years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks,and beverages.  Elisa is a new member of HSPFI. 

In the future, Elisa hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Lwazi

texts.en:
Lwazi is applying for a loan to support his studies for a year at the Maharishi Institute. This is his story:

Hello, I'm Lwazi, from Benoni in Johannesburg. I am studying for a Bachelor of Business Administration at the Maharishi Institute. 

I stay with my Granny and my siblings, as my mother passed away in 2005. I grew up helping my Granny to sell beers at a small tavern where I live, and this has been our main income at home. In my spare time, I enjoy reading, playing and watching soccer, and watching movies with my friends. 

I hope to be a businessman after I graduate in 2015, and help other children to get the opportunity that I had. My long-term goals are to own my own business, fund poor people, and open an organisation which will help students to pursue their dreams and careers. Education is the key to destroying poverty and it will help me in my life.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Nokuthula

texts.en:
Nokuthula  is applying for a loan to support her studies for a year at the Maharishi Institute. This is her story:

My name is Nokuthula, I am 27 years old and I'm pursuing a Bachelor of Business Administration in Johannesburg. I  live with my grandparents in a small township called Leandra, in the province of Mpumalanga. My mother is unemployed and does not live with us, so my grandparents have raised me on their pension fund. In my spare time, I like listening to music and volunteering at community halls, helping to organise youth activities. 

My hope is to find a job that is going to help me utilise the skills that I have acquired in school; a job that is going to challenge me so that I can grow as a person. In the long run, I would like to contribute as much as possible to the growth of the Maharishi Institute. I want to open a Transcendental Meditation Centre in my community, and also run career orientation sessions. I believe getting a loan from Kiva will help me a lot with my tuition fees, as no one in my family can afford to help me with that.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Ailene

texts.en:
Ailene is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has one child.
Ailene has a small store from which she sells dried fish and spices. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of dried fish and spices to sell.
Ailene is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Ailene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of dried fish and spices to sell.

loans.name: Pillao Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PILLAO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Delfina ella es casada y tiene 53 años y tiene 6 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,anteriormente la socia se dedicaba al negocio de venta de chicha en el mercado, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio de tienda de abarrotes, el sueño de la socia es tener un local más amplio para su tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite y galletas al por  mayor para que implemente su tienda de abarrotes.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de carpintería, negocio de venta de crianza de animales, negocio de venta de tejas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Pillao communal bank which is located in the district of Cusco, province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Delfina, she is married and is 53 years old and has 6 children. She has a small grocery store where she sells basic household goods like rice, sugar, milk and cookies. Mrs. Delfina works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m., before she used to work selling chicha (a type of fermented corn drink) in the market. She has had her store for over 5 years and her dream is to have a bigger place to sell her groceries. The member needs the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, oil and cookies wholesale.

The other members of the communal bank work in carpentry, breeding animals, selling roofing tile, have a small grocery store and sell food.

The member is grateful to those who will help her with her dream come through with this loan and she is committed to meeting all of her payment quotas on time.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, milk, oil and cookies wholesale.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
La Sra Agustina tiene 60 años es casada con dos hijos y viven la casa de su madre.
La sra se dedica a alquilar sillas, mesas, manteles, globo loco para los mas chicos y demás servicios. Como la señora es una de las pocas personas que se dedican a este rubro, no tiene mucha competencia pero de igual forma debe estar al tanto sus mercaderías.
El crédito sera invertido en la compra de manteles y cubiertos ya que la buena presentacion de sus alquileres es esencial para la buena recepcion de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Agustina is 60 years old, is married and has two children; they live in their mothers’ home.

Mrs. Agustina rents tables, chairs, tablecloths, jumping houses for the children and other services. Since she is one of a few people who work in this field, she has little competition but still she has to be up to date with her merchandize.

The loan will help her buy tablecloths and eating utensils since a good presentation of her rentals is essential for her customers.

loans.use: buy chairs, tables, tablecloths, etc.

loans.name: Joanne Kristine

texts.en: Joanne Kristine of Jimenez helps her family through her transportation services business. She’s 24 years old and single, and she tries her best to earn on her own. For 3 years, she has managed this business and earns about 7,000 PHP per month. Right now, she needs to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. She joined  GDMPC in 2009  and thanks the micro finance institution for the loan of 20,000  PHP they provided to her. Joanne Kristine desires to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras San Roque Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras San Roque cuenta con 10 miembros mujeres que se encuentran en el 5to ciclo del programa. La mayoría de ellas son macateras y el grupo de minoría son artesanas que se dedican a tejer.El comité se caracteriza por la buena predisposición para emprender todo tipo de negocios demostrando sus talentos.
Una de las integrantes, la señora Idalia es macatera se dedica a la venta de productos como sábanas, cubre-camas, toallas, ollas, entre otros productos, de forma ambulante.
El crédito solicitado sería destinado para la compra de nuevas mercaderías y de esa forma poder crecer como vendedora y generar mayor ingreso.
texts.en:
The communal bank of Enterprising Women of San Roque has 10 members who are in their fifth loan cycle. The majority of them are rural saleswomen and the minority group are artisans who weave. The committee is known for being able to do many types of businesses which show off their talents.

One of the members is Mrs. Idalia, she sells products like sheets, bedspreads, towels, pots and other items as a street vendor.

The loan will be used to buy new merchandize; this will help her grow as a salesperson and to have greater income.

loans.use: buy products like sheets, bedspreads, towels, pots and other items

loans.name: Ruby Ann

texts.en:
Ruby Ann is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Ruby Ann has a food/retail shop (or sari-sari store) and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for six years. 

She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Ruby Ann has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Ruby Ann hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Ernestina has a food/retail shop (or sari-sari store) and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for eight years. 

She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Ernestina has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Ernestina hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es: Joaquín de 73 años tiene una tienda, cuya experiencia se remonta dese al año 1948, cuando desde pequeña trabajaba en varios barrios de la ciudad  y fue adquiriendo experiencia y guardando dinero, que le cancelaban de su tarea diaria. Una vez reunió el dinero suficiente decidió emprender su propia aventura de negocio en un barrio del sur de la ciudad,  donde estuvo durante 6 años, hasta cuando cambió de sector  y con   grandes esfuerzos atesoró un poco mas de dinero y  logró comprar un bus urbano,  que le enfocó  su dedicación al  transporte, para después de 35 años ubicar  nuevamente su tienda en un barrio al norte de la ciudad de Barranquilla y   cuando reunió dinero, para comprar su propia casa, abrió un local e instaló su negocio y se estabilizó. Hoy vende artículos de la canasta familiar, un 30% lo hace a crédito y un 70% de contado. Sus compras las realiza en graneros de la ciudad diariamente, de contado y  en empresas que llevan las mercancías hasta su tienda mediante su pedido. Su meta es ampliar su tienda y dejarle un legado a sus hijos de trabajo y emprendimiento. En la actualidad está aplicando a un crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres, abarrotes, y en general productos de consumo masivo, para surtir sus vitrinas y estantería en mayor volumen, porque muchas son las veces que se queda sin capital y necesita tener un stock de artículos, siempre dispuestos a complacer a su clientela para continuar sosteniéndose en el mercado y lograr su propósito de crecimiento.
texts.en: Joaquín is 73 years old and has store, his experience begins since 1948 when as a young man he worked in different neighborhoods of the city and gained experience and saved money as he was paid his daily wages. Once he had enough money he decided to start his own business venture in a neighborhood in the southern part of the city where he was for 6 years until he moved and with great effort saved more money and was able to buy a bus. He then dedicated himself to transportation and 35 years later decided to start a small neighborhood grocery store in the northern Barranquilla, when he had enough money he was able to buy his own home and opened a small space and started his business. Today he sells basic household items, 30% of his sales are on credit and 70% are cash. He buys his merchandize daily cash down in the city and from companies that bring their items to his store as he makes his order. His goal is to expand his store and to leave his children a legacy of hard work and entrepreneurship. At present, Joaquín needs a loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, he will buy merchandize, groceries and basic household goods to stock his displays and shelves with more items since many times he does not have enough capital and is in need of having some stock. He is always willing to please his customers to continue his business and to fulfill his dream of success.

loans.use: buy merchandize, groceries and basic household goods to stock his displays and shelves with more items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy t-shirts, shirts, pants, lingerie, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Exequiel

texts.es:
Carlos, se dedica al cultivo de maíz, realiza actividades de albañilería y también en la reparación de celulares, el vive con su esposa y una hija de cuatro meses de edad, los cultivos lo realiza hace cinco años y es aprendido por su familia, la albañilería tiene nueve años de haberla aprendido y la reparación de celulares tiene ocho años, están distintas actividades son las que le ayudan para poder generar los ingresos para su familia.

El solicita un préstamo porque está realizando la siembra de maíz, para esto necesita comprarse abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, son los necesarios para prevenir la maleza y las plagas del cultivo, también logrará invertir una parte del préstamo en la compra de repuestos para celulares, el crédito le ayudará teniendo una nueva siembra de maíz y también comprándose repuestos para el negocio de los celulares.
A futuro espera poder construir su propia casa, ampliar sus cultivos y el negocio.
texts.en:
Carlos grows corn and also works as a bricklayer. In addition, he repairs mobile phones. He lives with his wife and four-month-old daughter. Carlos has been growing crops for five years and learned this trade from his family. He has worked as a bricklayer for nine years after acquiring this skill. Carlos has been repairing mobile phones for eight years. These different business activities are what help him to generate income for his family.

He is requesting a loan because he wants to continue growing corn. Carlos needs to buy compost, herbicides, and insecticides. These supplies are necessary to prevent pests and crop diseases. He will also invest part of the loan in mobile phone parts. The loan will help him produce a new crop of corn and also buy parts for his mobile phone business.

In the future he hopes to build a house of his own, increase his crops, and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, insecticides, and mobile phone parts.

loans.name: Maria Eve

texts.en:
Maria Eve is a new member of PMPC. She is 48 years of age and married with four adult-age children. She decided to be part of PMPC to have financial access.  

She has sold gasoline for a period of four years with a monthly income of 1,000 Philippines pesos (Php). She took a loan from PMPC in the amount of Php 5,000 to purchase additional stock of gasoline for sale, hoping to increase her volume of sales. She plans to use the profit to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of gasoline for sale.

loans.name: Ana Gladys

texts.es:
La señora Ana Gladys, es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora, madre de 4 hijos estos asisten ala escuela, primaria y secundaria  labora diario desde las seis de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde, de lunes a sábado, el día domingo hasta las tres de la tarde, en su negocio venta de ropa y zapatos ubicado en uno de los mercados de la capital.

 Este  crédito  lo esta solicitando para comprar mas mercadería (ropa de damas, caballeros, zapatos y sandalias) así  poder incrementar su negocio. Con el crédito anterior    le  permitió mejorar su vivienda y  llevar el sustento a su hogar. Pues, este es su principal fuente de ingreso que ella tiene. En la foto aparece la señora Ana Gladys mostrando algunos de sus productos.

 Se siente agradecida con CEPRODEL y KIVA, por la confianza depositada en ella. Espera que le puedan apoyar a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Gladys is an enterprising and hardworking person; she is a mother to 4 children who are in primary and high school. She works everyday from six in the morning until five in the afternoon, Monday to Saturday, on Sunday she works until three. She has a business selling clothing and shoes; it is located in one of the markets of the capital.

The loan will be used to buy more merchandize (women’s and men’s clothing, shoes and sandals) to increase her business. With the previous loan, Mrs. Ana Gladys was able to make improvements in her home and to provide for her home. This is her main source of income. In the picture Mrs. Ana Gladys appears with some of her products.

She is grateful to CEPRODEL and KIVA for the confidence bestowed upon her and hopes that you will support her in meeting her goals.

loans.use: buy skirts, blouses and shirts.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
For five years now, Cecilia has been weaving baskets for income. She is 41 years old, married, and lives in the municipality of Antequera in Bohol Province with her family. Cecilia has two children, ages 6 and 17, that she supports with her income. She is asking for a loan to buy raw materials for baskets, such as buri, rattan, and nylon. The loan will give her additional capital to make her business more successful and productive. The availability of materials will boost her productivity.
In the future, she hopes to acquire a bigger market for her finished products in order to increase her business profits.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for baskets, such as buri, rattan, and nylon.

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en: Emelie is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Emelie has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home products and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Emelie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with nine children. Victoria has a food/retail shop (or sari-sari store) and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Victoria has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Victoria hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Carolve

texts.en: Carolve is married, and she has two children. She is 25 years old. She resides in the village of Masabud in the municipality of Clarin. Carolve owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice to sell in order to earn a living. She’s been in this business for 8 years. Each month, she earns 7,000 PHP doing this type of work. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. In 2011, Carolve joined GDMPC. In the future, Carolve wants to improve her house and the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Lenin Yoeseer

texts.es: El joven Lenin es casado, tiene un hijo, empezó a trabajar a los 17 años, labora como docente en una escuela, es licenciado en informática, actualmente trabaja impartiendo clases en una universidad y en un colegio. Solicita el crédito para la compra de una computadora, de no ser posible esta oportunidad de crédito hubiese buscado otra alternativa o lamentablemente se quedaría sin su computadora, el cual le interesa mucho porque con esa herramienta vital podrá superarse profesionalmente. Camparte que el préstamo  es una gran oportunidad y apoyo social para cumplir tus sueños y metas.
texts.en: Young Lenin is married and has a son. He started working since he was 17 years old and now works as a teacher in a school; he is licensed in computer science and works giving university classes and in a high school. He needs a loan to buy a computer; if it wasn’t for this lending opportunity he would have to have looked for another alternative or sadly do without one. He is need of a computer since it is an essential tool which will to help him develop professionally. Lenin says that the loan is a great opportunity as well as the social support which will help him greatly to have his dreams and goals come true.

loans.use: buy a computer

loans.name: Johna

texts.en: Johna is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Johna has a small store that sells hot dogs and snacks. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of hot dogs and snacks to resell. Johna is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Johna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of hot dogs and snacks to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria con  su anterior credikiva compró telas hilos, encajes, botones, elaboró prendas de vestir que vendió y ganó dinero. Ahora e propone comprar una máquina recubridora para aumentar  la calidad en el acabado de sus prenda,  comprar materias primas e insumos, para dar respuestas a pedidos  de sus clientes, también desea invertir en oro golfi, mercancías que trajeron sus catálogos con muy buenos descuentos y va a aprovechar para iniciar su relación con una empresa multinacional, a la que se vinculó últimamente  y ofrecerá sus productos mediante guías especializadas. . Ella Dice a sus financiadores de Kiva; “estoy muy agradecida con el préstamo que me han concedido y espero un buen futuro para mi microempresa. “
texts.en: Maria with her previous credikiva bought fabrics, threads, lace, and buttons, she made various items of clothing that she sold and made some money. At present, she would like to buy a cover stitch machine to improve the quality of her finished products, buy raw materials and merchandize. This is to meet the demands of her customers and would like to invest in golfi gold (a jewelry catalogue) merchandize that is bought through catalogues with good discounts and wants to start a business relationship with a multinational corporation of which she is a part of and will offer the products with specialized guides. Maria says this to her Kiva lenders, “I’m very grateful with the loan and hope for the best future for my small business.”

loans.use: buy raw materials and merchandize as well as golfi gold merchandize (a jewelry catalogue).

loans.name: Maria Corazon

texts.en: Maria Corazon is an active individual member of PMPC. She is 26 years of age, married, and a resident of Lomangcapan, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor.  She has been engaged in buying and selling surplus clothes for less than a year, experiencing a monthly income of PHP 4,000. She took another loan from PMPC to purchase additional surplus clothes for sale hoping to increase her income. She plans to use the profit to invest in a new food processing and selling business to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase addtional surplus clothes for sale.

loans.name: Jose Gabriel

texts.es:
Jose, se dedica a la venta de zapatos y  ropa, vive con su esposa y es padre de dos hijos, él trabaja realizando las ventas en diferentes pueblos, algunos quedan cerca y otros quedan retirado de su vivienda, la venta las realiza todos los días de la semana.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de una variedad de zapatos con diferente medida y estilos, que le permita ofrecer a los clientes y satisfacer sus gustos y necesidades, este préstamo será un gran aporte para que pueda crecer en el comercio y continuar generando ganancias.

Su objetivo es comprarse una vivienda propia donde poder residir con su familia, también crecer en el negocio y tener una mejor capacidad.
texts.en:
Jose sells shoes and clothing. He lives with his wife and is the father of two children. Jose conducts his sales in different towns. Some are nearby and others are far from his home. He sells every day of the week.

Jose is currently requesting a loan in order to buy a variety of shoes in different sizes and styles that he can offer to his customers. This will satisfy their likes and needs. The loan will be a great help in growing his business so that he can continue generating income.

His goal is to buy a home of his own where he can reside with his family. He also wants to grow his business and increase his capacity.

loans.use: to buy a variety of shoes.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia Marcelina sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “SANTO DOMINGO” y las reuniones del banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento del Cusco.

La socia Marcelina tiene 52 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene 6 hijos, ella es natural de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella sigue con el negocio de cafetín, ella es propietaria de un cafetín que atiende desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, ella sigue preparando todo tipo de postres como por ejemplo sándwich, gelatinas, tortas y también  vende bebidas como por ejemplo  gaseosas y cervezas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

La socia Marcelina solicita el préstamo para comprar gaseosas y cervezas ella está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a member of the Communal Bank “Santo Domingo” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 52 years old, married, and has six children. She is was born in Cusco City and lives there. She continues in the business. She is the owner of a cafeteria. As the owner, she manages her business between the hours of 7am and 10pm. She serves sandwiches, sodas, beer, and dinner items. 

She has been in this business for several years and is doing well. Marcelina is requesting a loan to buy sodas and beer. Marcelina is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beer.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is from Calabayan Ozamis City. She is 59 years old. Carmen is married and has 8 children. To make a living, Carmen makes & sells a variety of snack foods. Carmen has been operating her business for 5 years and earns 4,900 PHP a month for these activities. 

Carmen is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Recently, Carmen joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.en:
Teodosia is a resident of Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She runs a sari-sari, or mini-grocery, store and a farm at their place. She grows a variety of food crops in the field.

Teodosia needs more funds for the business. She is asking for a loan worth 5000PHP to to buy more inventory to sell in her store and to purchase fertilizer for the plants. With these funds, she will be able to enhance her income and her profits.

In the future, Teodosia hopes to expand her business and make it more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to sell in her store and to purchase fertilizer for the plants.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah is from Sta. Cruz, Tangub City. She is 30 years old, married, and has 2 children. Leah owns and operates a coconut production business. She's been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Leah joined GDMPC. Leah is requesting a loan of 12,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Nicky

texts.en:
Nicky is a 33 year old woman from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She is married and has two children, ages 12 and 14. While her husband works as a driver, she helps provide an income by attending to her store and making profits out of selling basic household commodities like canned goods, chips, toiletries, seasoning and soft drinks. She has been operating the business for two years now. 

Nicky is asking for a loan so she can buy items in bulk, such as rice, beer and soft drinks. Her loan will motivate her to look for ways she can continue to improve her sales for her family's needs. 

In the future, Nicky is hopeful that she can renovate and make her store bigger. Her income will be for school fees and the family's daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy in bulk items like rice, beer and soft drinks.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. Lilia  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store from which she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 8 years. 

Lilia has requested a loan for 7,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Lilia  has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Lilia hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is from San Antonio, Ozamiz City. She is 54 years old. Aida is married and has 3 children. She owns & operates a business, providing sewing services. Aida been in her business for 3 years and earns 6,000PHP a month. 

In 2010, Aida joined GDMPC. Aida is requesting a loan of 9,000PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. Nimfa  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store from which she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 7 years. 

Nimfa has requested a loan for 5,000PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Nimfa  has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Nimfa hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Lagrimas De Amor

texts.en:
Lagrimas De Amor is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. Lagrimas De Amor has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 9 years. 

Lagrimas De Amor has requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. She  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business in order to provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Oldalia

texts.en: Oldalia is from Segatic Daku, Clarin. She is 38 years old. Oldalia is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Oldalia owns and operates a charcoal sales business venture. Oldalia has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns 10,000 PHP  a month from these activities. In 2010, Oldalia joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase coconut shells for making charcoal. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase coconut shells for charcoal making.

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es: Jairo, tiene la edad  de 23 años, está soltero, actualmente tiene una hija. El con el crédito quiere comprar unas repuestos para mejorar su vehículo con el da el servicio de trasporte. El se dedica al serbio de taxi en su comunidad y quiere mejorar su vehículo pues está teniendo problemas con este, el pretende realizarle estas mejoras y así dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes con comodidad y eficacia. El tiene ya varios meses de estar dando servicio de taxi y le ah ido muy bien, el quiere aumentar su clientela y tenerla siempre a justo con sus servicios y comodidad. El piensa mejorar su calidad de vida con este nuevo proyecto  y así poder darle un futuro mas cómodo a su hija y un bienestar propio de satisfacción personal con las metas que quiere alcanzar y cumplir con las ganancias generadas con su taxi. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jairo is 23 years old, single, and has a daughter. With this loan, he wants to buy a few spare parts to improve the vehicle that he uses for providing transportation services. He drives a taxi in his community and wants to repair his vehicle since it is experiencing problems. Jairo intends to make repairs so that he can provide better taxi service that is comfortable and efficient for his customers. He has already been in business for several months and has done very well. Jairo wants to increase his clientele and constantly provide comfortable service. He plans to improve his quality of life with this new project so that he can provide a more comfortable future for his daughter, achieve personal satisfaction by accomplishing his goals, and utilize the profits generated from his taxi.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. Jairo has not received any previous loans from the state banks. FUDECOSUR is offering this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for repairing his taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en: Melba, 37-years old, is a married entrepreneur from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City. She has 1 child and is earning from her transport service business. Her business has been running for almost 3 years now and she earn 4,000 PHP a month. To improve the business, she is borrowing an amount of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit. She just joined GDMPC in 2011 to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, she’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is an active member of PMPC. She is 62 years of age, married, and has 4 adult children. She has been engaged in a sari-sari store business for over 15 years with an average monthly income of PHP 6,000.  She took another loan from PMPC to purchase additional grocery inventory to sell. Ruth plans to use the profits to expand the business and to save in preparation for her old-age.

loans.use: to purchase addtional grocery inventory to sell.

loans.name: Baasanjav

texts.en:
Mrs.Baasanjav is a college student and lives with her retired parents and her two younger brothers in a house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She is not married. 

She started working in the family's grocery business in 2007. The ger district is not connected with the public heating systems in Ulaanbaatar city, where peak cold weather reaches minus 40 degrees. To fight the cold weather, Mrs.Baasanjav is planning to purchase a gas-stove to heat the grocery store, for better living conditions. Consequently, she is requesting a 6,000,000 MNT loan for that purpose. Her parents say about their daughter: "My daughter is an honest and responsible person. We always support her with our hearts."

loans.use: to purchase a gas-stove to heat the grocery store, for better living conditions.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is a merchant from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has run a beverage retailing business for more than 20 years now. 

Saturnina works hard to earn a living. As of this time, she is in need of additional capital for the expansion of her business. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more stock, like beverages/soda, to sell to her clients. Through this, she will be able to cater to more customers. Saturnina dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock, like beverages/soda, to sell to her clients

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vicky is 39 years old and all of her children are in school.

Vicky has a business buying and selling fruits in the Philippines. Vicky requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Vicky has been in this business for seven years.  In the future, Vicky would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruit to sell

loans.name: Allan

texts.en: Allan is married with two children. He is 44 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamis City. Allan operates a general store, selling a variety of products to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for three years, and every month he earns 3,500 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand his product offerings. Allan joined GDMPC in 2008. He hopes to improve the general living condition of his family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand his product offerings

loans.name: Louie

texts.en:
Louie is from Gango, Ozamiz City. He is 32 years old, married and has two children. Louie owns and operates a transportation business. He has been engaged in his business for four years and earns 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. 

In 2010, Louie joined GDMPC. He is requesting a loan of 24,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Marzolyn

texts.en:
Marzolyn is married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marzolyn is 41 years old and both of her children are in school.

Marzolyn has a business selling vegetables and spices in the Philippines. Marzolyn requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Marzolyn has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Marzolyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Merlie works hard to support her family.

She has an ice cream vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from corn retail.  Merlie is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her ice cream vending business.

Merlie has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her ice cream.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 49 years old and from Panglao, Bohol. She is married with six children. Her eldest is 28 and the youngest is 10. Carmelita's husband works as a carpenter. She is helping him by raising hogs at home to augment her income. 

She is asking for a loan to buy feed and supplements for her hogs. She is assured that once these are available, they will help boost the growth of her hogs. She will use her profit to buy a healthy diet for her family and pay the school fees of her children. In the future, she would like to have a big barn that can house hogs and possibly sows for a bigger piggery business.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplements for her hogs.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 40 years old, married and has 6 children. 

Antonia is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Antonia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise and sell.

Antonia has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Antonia would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Bernardito

texts.en:
Bernardito is a 59-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. He has run a tricycle transport business for more than 10 years.
 
Bernardito is in need of additional funds for his business. He is asking for a loan worth 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy fuel and pay for the repair and maintenance of his tricycle. With this loan, he will be able to revive the good working condition of the vehicle.

In the future, Bernardito hopes to improve his business so that it will continue to generate the income necessary for the family's needs and for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy fuel and pay for the repair and maintenance of his tricycle.

loans.name: Bahridin

texts.ru:
Бахридин проживает в Гиссарском районе. Ему 56 лет. Бахридин живет с женой. Его дочь замужем, она живет с мужем и его семьей. Сын Бахридина находится на заработках за рубежом, а жена занимается домашним хозяйством. 
Бахридин предоставляет услугу на своей грузовой автомашине. Этим видом деятельности он занимается десять лет. Бахридин просит кредит для закупа стройматериалов (щебень и песок), чтобы заняться оптовой купле – продажи стройматериалов и развозить на своей машине.
texts.en:
Bahridin lives in the Gissar area. He is 56 years old and lives with his wife. His daughter is married and lives with her husband and his family.
Bahridin provides services with his truck. He's been doing it for ten years. Bahridin has requested a loan to buy construction materials (crushed stone and sand) so he can start buying and selling bulk quantities of construction supplies and transporting them in his truck.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (crushed stone and sand)

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester, 32, is married and has two children. She lives in the Philippines. Ester sells barbecue sticks to earn a living. She has been doing this for eight years, and she earns 5,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from this work. 

She has requested a loan of 22,000 PHP to buy more materials to make barbecue sticks. In 2010, Ester joined GDMPC. In the future, Ester hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make barbecue sticks.

loans.name: Narzvi

texts.ru: Нарзви жительница города Душанбе. Ей 50 лет. Она вдова. У нее двое детей. Нарзви вместе с дочерьми занимается торговлей. Она арендует торговую точку на рынке «Корвон», где занимается оптовой реализацией женской и детской одежды. Этим видом деятельности Нарзви занимается пять лет. Она просит кредит для увеличения ассортимента товара и товарооборота.
texts.en:
Narzvi lives in Dushanbe. She is 50 and widowed with two children.
Narzvi and her daughters work in sales. She rents a stall at the Korvon market, where she sells women's and children's clothes wholesale. Narzvi has been in this business for five years. She has requested a loan to increase the variety of her merchandise and her turnover.

loans.use: to buy white school shirts and tights

loans.name: Robel

texts.en:
Robel has been an active individual member of PMPC since 2011. He is 40 years of age, married with three school-age children, and a resident of Sandugan, Larena, Siquijor.  

He has operated a sari-sari store (convenience store) for a year, with a monthly income of Php 2,500.  He took a loan with PMPC to purchase grocery stock to sell, to help increase sales volume and income.  He plans to use the profit to support the education of his children.

loans.use: to purchase grocery stock to sell in his convenience store.

loans.name: Byambahuu

texts.en:
Byambahuu is 49 years old and lives with her husband and son, in a small house, in the Arhangia province of Mongolia. Her husband's name is Shiilegbat; he is 54 years old, and is unemployed. Her son goes to secondary school. 

She started her own organic vegetable trade business a long time ago, and has many years of experience. The local residents identify her as an honest and hardworking woman. 

Byambahuu's monthly income is around 390,000 - 450,000MNT. She is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan to purchase tools and other items for her organic vegetable trade business. Byambahuu said, "My efficiency and profit will increase with this investment in the business, and this will improve my life."

loans.use: to purchase tools and other items for her organic vegetable trade business.

loans.name: Ma. Dulce

texts.en:
Ma. Dulce is 50 years old and is from the community of Baclayon, Bohol. She is married with two adult children. Her husband works as a habal-habal driver. A habal-habal is a motorcycle used to transport passengers. 

Ma. Dulce is earns an income through making candles. This has been her business for a year now. She is asking for a loan to buy paraffin wax and wick necessary for candle production. Her income will take care of her family's needs, like food, savings and electric bill. In the future, she would like to have a bigger place to produce more candles and earn a bigger profit.

loans.use: to buy paraffin wax and wicks for her candle making business.

loans.name: Eulalio

texts.en:
Eulalio is 57 years old, and is a resident of Antequera, Bohol. He is married with four children. His eldest child is 34 and the youngest is 14. 

Eulalio has been engaged in driving habal-habal (motorcyles used to transport passengers) for an income for three years now. He is asking for a loan to buy spare tires and pay for vulcanizing and maintenance of his motorcycle. 

He is determined to save enough money from this so he can have another business. In the future, he plans to start a sari-sari (convenience) store to increase his income for his family.

loans.use: to buy spare tires and pay for vulcanizing and maintenance of his motorcyle.

loans.name: Batbuyan

texts.en:
Mr. Batbuyan is 49 years old and lives with his wife and four kids in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic yurt, in Uvs province. His two older children are college students and the other two children are secondary school students.
