Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt précédents a été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est  le sorgho avec   Mariam  debout à l’extrême droite.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et payer les frais de labours pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Sabougnouma 4 group are married women, on average 39 years old with 3 children, and they all live in polygamous families in Nagnassoni, one of the villages of Sikasso. They work with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to continue their agricultural activities during the rainy season. The women are on their second loan with the organization, and have repaid their previous loan. 

Mariam, standing on the far right, works growing sorghum. With her loan proceeds, she plans on purchasing fertilizer and paying the labor costs to maintain 1 hectare of crops. After the harvest, the sorghum yield is sold to the village and at the market in Sikasso to both male and female customers. She plans to make an average profit of 95,000 francs CFA per season. This profit will allow her to pay back her loan as well as to help her husband with the everyday expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay labor costs

loans.name: Kotognogontala 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Loutana, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé a été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement le sorgho  avec  Awa debout en première position à partir de la gauche. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer  les frais ce labours labour et les intrants  pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 165.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of the Kotognogontala 2 group are married women averaging 35 years of age, with six children. They all live in polygamous families in Loutana, a village in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural activities during the rainy season.
They are on their second loan with the institution. The prior loan has been duly repaid.

Their mainly cultivate sorghum, which is what Awa does, for example. Awa is standing first from the left in the photo. She plans to use her loan to cover the cost of labor and agricultural inputs [fertilizers etc]  needed to work 1.5 ha [3.7 acres] of land. After harvesting, the produce is sold in the village and at the Sikasso market, to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to achieve a monthly income of 165,000 West African franks for this agricultural cycle. This income will allow her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and pay for labor.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 4 enfants, les sept femmes du groupe Benkadi habitent toutes dans la ville de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de leurs activités professionnelles.  
Elles  font de la vente de savon, de riz, de la fabrication  et vente de Sounbala. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe intègrent Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 9ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Lala, debout en première position à gauche, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs de riz. Elle s’approvisionne sur place  et effectue ses ventes au marché et à domicile, en détail, au comptant et quelques fois à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Madame Lala compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de  55.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer
texts.en:
Predominantly married in traditional families with an average age of 40 years and four children, the seven women in the Benkadi group all live in the city of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali). They know one another through family ties, their neighborhood, and their businesses. They sell soap and rice, and also manufacture and sell sounbala [ground, cooked, and fermented seeds or beans]. In order to increase their working capital, the group members partnered with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their ninth loan cycle.

Lala, pictured standing first on the left, plans to use her loan to buy two bags of rice. She buys locally and makes her retail sales in the market and at home, on a cash and sometimes credit basis, to male and female customers.  With this loan, Lala hopes to make an average monthly profit of 55,000 francs CFA that she will reinvest in the business and use to take care of some household needs.

loans.use: to buy rice

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et 4 enfants, les sept femmes du groupe Danaya habitent toutes dans la ville de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de leurs activités professionnelles.  Elles  font de la vente de savon, de riz,  de l’achat vente des articles divers, des habits et de la fabrication  et vente de Sounbala. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe intègrent Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 9ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mawa, debout au milieu, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2  rouleaux de tissus.  Elle s’approvisionne sur place  auprès des grossistes et effectue ses ventes à la maison et au marché, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit payable hebdomadairement. 
Madame Mawa compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de  40.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer. 
Diaratou était absente pour des raisons sociales c’est pourquoi, elle ne figure pas sur la photo
texts.en:
Married for the most part in traditional families and averaging 39 years of age and four children each, the seven women of the group Danaya all live in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali) and know one another through ties of kinship, community, and their professional work. They sell soap and rice, and they trade in various goods and clothing, and they make and sell 'sounbala' (made from fermented seeds).

With the goal of increasing their business funds, the group members jointed the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their ninth solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Mawa, who is standing in the middle in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy 2 rolls of cloth. She gets her supplies locally from wholesalers and make their sales retail, cash or credit, at the house and at the market. The customer base is composed of men and women, who repay weekly.

With this loan, Ms. Mawa plans to make an average monthly profit 40,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested into the business and used to meet certain household needs. 

Diaratou was absent due to social reasons. This is why she does not appear in the photo.

loans.use: to buy cloth

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et 5 enfants, les six femmes du groupe Kotognogontala habitent toutes dans la quartier Bougoula hameau de la ville de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de leurs activités professionnelles.  
Elles  font de la vente du charbon de bois, de tissus, de condiments alimentaires, du bois de chauffe, de chaussures et de la fabrication  et vente de Sounbala. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe intègrent Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 9ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariam, debout en deuxième position à partir de la gauche, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 55 kg de grain de néré. Elle s’approvisionne sur place  à Bougoula et ensuite fait la transformation des grains de néré en  Sounbala, qu’elle revend en ambulant et à domicile, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Madame Mariam compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de  65.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer
texts.en:
The majority of the six women of the Kotognogontala group are married in traditional families; they average 39 years of age and five children each. They all live in the neighborhood of the Bougoula hamlet in the town of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali) and they know each other through family, neighborhood and professional ties.

They sell charcoal, fabrics, condiments for cooking, firewood, shoes, and they also prepare and sell soumbala (a condiment prepared from néré seeds).

In order to expand their businesses, the members of the group have joined Soro Yiriwaso, and this is their ninth solidarity loan.

Mariam, standing, second from the left, is planning to use her loan to buy 55 kg of néré seeds.  She buys her supplies locally in Bougoula, and then processes néré seeds to make soumbala , which she resells as an itinerant seller and from home, to a customer base comprising men and women.

With this loan, Mariam is expecting average monthly profits to reach 65,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her business and also used to take care of some of her household needs.

loans.use: to buy néré seeds.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 40 ans et 5 enfants, les dix membres du groupe Benkadi 1 vivent toutes dans le village de Zankourabougou, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. Dans le but d’utiliser la main d’œuvre masculine pour réaliser le labour et les travaux d’entretien, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt de campagne. Les membres du groupe vont cultiver l’arachide, le mil, le gombo et le niébé.
Madame Maïmouna (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour, acheter des engrais et herbicides, faire le labour et le désherbage de ses champs. Elle se ravitaille en en main d’œuvre avec l’association des jeunes  et en intrants agricoles au grand marché de Ségou. Avec une superficie de 3 hectares, elle espère produire, 15 sacs d’arachide, 3 sacs de mil, 2 sacs de niébé et des fanes. En plus des fanes de niébé, une partie de la production sera vendue pour gérer les petites dépenses du foyer au quotidien tandis que le reste serait auto consommée en famille. Tout comme les autres femmes du groupe Benkadi 1 de Zankourabougou Madame Maïmouna a pour objectif d’assurer l’auto suffisance alimentaire dans leur village.
texts.en:
The ten women of the "Benkadi 1" group are married, belong mainly to traditional households, are on average 40 years old with 5 children, and all live in the town of Zankourabougou, in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of Mali). They know each other through familial, neighbourhood, and business connections.
With the goal of using male manual labour to maintain their farms, the group members joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second farm loan cycle. The group members are going to grow peanuts, millet, okra, and cowpeas.
Ms. Maïmouna (sitting all the way on the right in the photo), intends to use her loan to pay for fertilizer, herbicides, and manual labour to maintain and weed her fields. She hires workers from the local youth association and buys her agricultural inputs at the grand market in Ségou.
With 3 hectares' worth of farmland, she hopes to produce 15 sacks of peanuts, 3 sacks of millet, 2 sacks of cowpea and leaf stalks. In addition to the cowpea leaf stalks, a portion of the produce will be sold to manage her household's small daily expenses, while the rest will be consumed by the family.
Similar to the other women of the Benkadi 1 group in Zankourabougou, Ms. Maïmouna's goal is to ensure her town's self-sufficiency in foodstuffs.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers (complex cereals and urea), herbicides, and male manual labour.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Djiguiya est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Moussabougou de la ville de Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans, sont mariées et mère d’au moins 2 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les condiments les légumes, du sucre, de la bouillie e, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de groupe. Mamine est un membre du groupe Djiguiya, première personne à droite, qui vend des condiments alimentaires.      
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, toutes sortes de condiments en gros.   Elle se procure de ses condiments au grand marché de Koutiala. Elle vend ses condiments en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché à une clientèle diverse, elle est très sollicitée. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djiguiya comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 123 750CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Mamine  compte réaliser 135 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fond de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcée ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Djiguiya is a group of women from the Moussabougou neighborhood  in the town of Koutiala. They live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They average 32 years old, are married, and are mothers to at least two children. This group of women sells a variety of items, including vegetables to make sauces, other vegetables, sugar, bouillie [a type of porridge], etc. To increase the size of their businesses, the members of the Djiguiya group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. This is their fourth group loan.

Mamine (the first woman on the right in the photo) is a member of the Djiguiya group, and she sells vegetables that are used to make sauces. She intends to use her part of the loan to buy these vegetables in bulk from the large market in Koutiala. She will sell all these vegetables for cash at home and at the market to different customers. She is highly in demand. While the other members of the Djiguiya group each expect to earn an average monthly profit of 123,750 francs CFA (XOF) during the span of the loan, Mamine expects to make 135,000 francs CFA (XOF). 

In addition to paying back the loans, this group will use a part of their income to pay for personal expenses and to increase their businesses. They hope to see this strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that their stocks are not depleted.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for making sauces

loans.name: Sanata's Group

texts.fr:
Les six   membres du groupe Benkadi 2 sont mariés majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 37 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Zankourabougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage et de voisinage. Dans le but d’avoir l’urée disponible et le pouvoir de s’entre aider par l’utilisation de la main d’œuvre masculine et féminine, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt de campagne. Les membres du groupe vont cultiver l’arachide, le mil, le gombo et le niébé.
Madame Oumou (au milieu des femmes debouts sur la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter l’urée et recruter la main d’œuvre payante pour faire le labour et le désherbage de ses champs. Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à la foire de Ségou et en main d’œuvre avec l’association des jeunes  et des femmes du village. Avec une superficie de 2 hectares, elle espère produire, 5 sacs de mil, 20 sacs de gombo, 5 sacs de niébé et des fanes. En plus des fanes de niébé, une partie de la production sera vendue pour gérer les petites dépenses du foyer et le reste serait auto consommée en famille. Madame Oumou a pour objectif d’acheter des petits ruminants pour des fins d’élevage.
texts.en:
The six women of the "Benkadi 2" group are married, belong mainly to traditional households, and are on average 37 years old with three children. They all live in the town of Zankourabougou, in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of Mali) and know each other through familial and neighbourhood connections.
With the goal of obtaining fertilizer (urea) and being able to help each other using male and female manual labour to maintain their farms, the group members turned to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second farm loan cycle. The group members are going to grow peanuts, millet, okra, and cowpeas.
Ms. Oumou (in the middle of the women standing in the photo), intends to use her loan to pay for urea and to recruit paid manual labour to maintain and weed her fields. She gets her agricultural inputs at the market fair in Ségou and hires workers from the local youth association and women in the town. 
With 2 hectares' worth of farmland, she hopes to produce 5 sacks of millet, 20 sacks of okra, and 5 sacks of cowpea and leaf stalks. In addition to the cowpea leaf stalks, a portion of the produce will be sold to manage her household's small daily expenses, while the rest will be consumed by the family.
Ms. Oumou's future goal is to buy and raise small ruminants.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer (urea) and male manual labour to maintain and weed farmland.

loans.name: Sinignesigui Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 5 enfants, les sept femmes du groupe Sinignesigui habitent toutes dans la quartier Bougoula hameau de la ville de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de leurs activités professionnelles.  
Elles  font de la vente des tissus, de condiments, du bois de chauffe, de chaussures, de la fabrication  et vente de Sounbala. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe intègrent Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 9ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Djénébou Madou, assise en première position à partir de la gauche, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 60 kg de grain de néré. Elle s’approvisionne sur place  à Bougoula et ensuite fait la transformation des grains de néré de Sounbala dans sa fabrique traditionnelle, qu’elle vendra en ambulant et à domicile, à une clientèle composée de consommateurs et de revendeurs. 
Madame Djénébou Madou compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de  65.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer
texts.en:
The seven women of the "Sinignesigui" group are married, belong mainly to traditional households, are on average 40 years old with 5 children, and all live in the Bougoula town area of the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali). They know each other through familial, neighbourhood, and business connections.
They sell fabric, condiments, firewood, and shoes, and make and sell sumbala (a widely-used condiment).
With the goal of increasing their capital, the group members joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their ninth group loan cycle.
Ms. Djénébou Madou, sitting all the way on the left, intends to use her loan to buy 60 kg of nere seeds (used to make sumbala). She gets her supplies local at Bougoula and then converts the nere seeds to sumbala in the traditional manner. She sells sumbala door-to-door and at home to a clientele composed of consumers and retailers.
With this loan, Ms. Djénébou Madou intends to realize an average monthly profit 65,000 FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and provide for certain household needs.

loans.use: To buy nere (an important food and condiment-producing plant) seeds

loans.name: Benkadi  3 Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 41 ans et 5 enfants, les dix  membres du groupe Benkadi 3 vivent toutes dans le village de Zankourabougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant en intrants agricoles et d’utiliser la main d’œuvre masculine pour réaliser le labour et les travaux d’entretien, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt de campagne. Les membres du groupe vont cultiver l’arachide, le mil, le gombo et le niébé.
Madame Kadia (femme assise au milieu des clientes sur la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, l’urée et une variété sélectionnée de mil; recruter temporairement la main d’œuvre payante pour l’aider à réaliser le labour et le désherbage de ses champs. Elle se ravitaille, en main d’œuvre avec l’association des jeunes  et des femmes du village, en engrais au grand marché de Ségou. Avec une superficie de 2 hectares, elle espère produire 10 sacs de mil, 5 sacs de niébé et des fanes. En plus des fanes de niébé, une partie de la production serait vendue pour assurer l’entretien et la scolarisation des enfants tandis que le reste serait auto consommée en famille. Tout comme les autres femmes du groupe 3 de l’association Benkadi de Zankourabougou. Madame Kadia a pour objectif d’assurer l’auto suffisance alimentaire dans leur village.
texts.en:
The ten women of the "Benkadi 3" group are married, belong mainly to traditional households, are on average 41 years old with five children, and all live in the town of Zankourabougou in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of Mali). They know each other through familial, neighbourhood, and marital connections.
With the goal of paying for agricultural inputs in cash and using male manual labour to maintain their farms, the group members turned to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second farm loan cycle. The group members are going to grow peanuts, millet, okra, and cowpeas.
Ms. Kadia (sitting in the middle in the photo), intends to use her loan to pay for urea and a diverse selection of millet seeds, and to recruit paid temporary manual labour to maintain and weed her fields. She hires workers from the local youth association and women in town and buys fertilizer at the grand market in Ségou.
With 2 hectares' worth of farmland, she hopes to produce 10 sacks of millet and 5 sacks of cowpea and leaf stalks. In addition to the cowpea leaf stalks, a portion of the produce will be sold to provide for her children's needs and education, while the rest will be consumed by the family.
Similar to the other women of the Benkadi 3 group in Zankourabougou, Ms. Kadia's goal is to ensure her town's self-sufficiency in foodstuffs.

loans.use: To buy urea and millet seeds and to pay for male manual labour to maintain and hoe farmland.

loans.name: Benkadi  4 Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 43 ans et 4 enfants, les dix membres du groupe Benkadi 4 vivent toutes dans le village de Zankourabougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. Dans l’objectif d’avoir des intrants agricoles à temps en début d’hivernage et d’utiliser la main d’œuvre masculine pour réaliser le labour et les travaux d’entretien, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt de campagne. Les membres du groupe vont cultiver l’arachide, le mil, le gombo et le niébé.
Madame Diabane (femme debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter l’urée et utiliser la main d’œuvre payante pour l’aider à réaliser le labour et le désherbage de ses champs. Elle se ravitaille, en main d’œuvre avec l’association des jeunes  et des femmes du village, en engrais au grand marché de Ségou. Avec une superficie de 2 hectares, elle compte produire 10 sacs d’arachide,  5 sacs de mil, 2 sacs de niébé et des fanes. En plus des fanes de niébé, une partie de la production serait vendue pour assurer les charges courantes du foyer et le reste serait auto consommée en famille. Madame Diabane a pour objectif de faire l’élevage des petits ruminants et de la volaille dans leur village.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 4 group are married women, mainly living in large traditional families with an average age of 43 and an average of four children. They all live in the village of Zankourabougou in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali) and know each other through links of kinship, marriage and vicinity. The group aims to have their agricultural inputs ready prior to the rainy season and hopes to use the male workforce to perform plowing and maintenance. With these goals in mind, they have made use of Soro Yiriwaso and are on the second cycle of their farm loan. Group members plan to grow peanuts, millet, okra and cowpeas.

Diabane (the woman standing on the far right) plans to use her loan to purchase urea and to pay for the labor needed to plow and weed her fields. She restocks her fertilizer from the grand market in Ségou by working with the youths and other women of her village. With her ​​two hectares of land, Diabane plans to produce 10 sacks of peanuts, five sacks of millet, and two sacks of cowpeas and their greens. In addition to the cowpea greens, a portion of the crop yield will be sold to pay current household expenses, while the rest will be consumed by her family. Diabane's eventual goal is to breed sheep, goats and poultry within their village.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to pay for the labor costs of plowing and weeding

loans.name: Kadia's Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe 5 de l’association Benkadi  de Zankourabougou sont mariés majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Zankourabougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. Dans le but d’utiliser la main d’œuvre masculine pour réaliser le labour et les travaux d’entretien, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt de campagne. Les membres du groupe vont cultiver l’arachide, le mil, le gombo et le niébé.
Madame Oumou (femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour, acheter deux sacs d’engrais et utiliser la main d’œuvre masculine pour faire le labour et le désherbage de ses champs; Elle se ravitaille en en main d’œuvre avec l’association des jeunes  et en intrants agricoles au grand marché de Ségou. Avec une superficie de 2 hectares, elle espère produire, 10 sacs d’arachide, 2 sacs de mil, 2 sacs de niébé et des fanes. En plus des fanes de niébé, une partie de la production sera vendue pour gérer les petites dépenses du foyer au quotidien tandis que le reste serait auto consommée en famille. Tout comme les autres femmes du groupe Benkadi 5 de Zankourabougou Madame Oumou a pour objectif d’assurer l’auto suffisance alimentaire dans leur village.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group Benkadi 5 of the association Benkadi of Zankourabougou are married for the most part in large traditional families, and they average 32 years of age and three children each. The women all live in the village of Zankourabougou, in the region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, marriage, and community. 

With the goal of using male workers to carry out the plowing and maintenance work, the women turned toward the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second farm loan cycle. The group members are going to grow peanuts, millet, okra, and black-eyed peas.

Ms. Oumou (the woman standing at the far left in the photo) intends to use her loan to purchase two sacks of fertilizer and to employ male workers for the plowing and weeding of the fields. Her supply of labor comes from the association of young people, and the farm inputs come from the big market of Ségou. With 2 hectares of land area, she hopes to produce 10 sacks of peanuts, 2 sacks of millet, 2 sacks of black-eyed peas, and some stems and stalks. In addition to the stalks of black-eyed peas, part of the produce will be sold to manage sundry day-to-day household expenses, while the rest would be consumed in the family.

Just like the other women of the group Benkadi 5 of Zankourabougou, Ms. Oumou has the goal of ensuring food self-sufficiency in their village.

loans.use: to pay for urea and for male workers in order to carry out plowing and weeding

loans.name: Sabougnouma 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Nagnassoni, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé a été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est  le sorgho avec   Oumou  debout en 2ème position à partir de la droite.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et payer les frais de labours pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group SABOUGNOUMA 5 are married women averaging 39 years of age and three children each all living in polygamous families in Nagnassoni, a village in SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution. The past loan was indeed repaid.

The crop grown is sorghum, as is the case with Oumou, who is standing second from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs and to cover the cost of plowing to maintain one hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold at the village and at the SIKASSO market to a customer base composed of men and women. Oumou plans on making an average profit of 100,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and to cover the costs of plowing

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Sabaly est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Koko extension de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 46 ans, sont mariées et mère d’au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les pagnes, du bois de chauffe, des condiments, des chaussures et de friperie. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe. 
Batoma, première personne assise ayant en face deux seaux en plastiques fait vente de la pâte d’arachide.   
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 150 kilogrammes en graines d’arachide au marché de Koutiala auprès des producteurs, qui sera transformé en pâte. Elle vend sa pâte d’arachide en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché à une clientèle essentiellement féminine. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Sabaly comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 120 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Batoma  compte réaliser 138 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
The "Sabaly" group comprises women from the Koko extension area of the city of Koutiala who know each other well and live in large traditional households with their husbands, children, and other family members. They are on average 46 years old, married, and have at least three children.
This group of women sells various items such as pagnes (West African cloth), firewood, condiments, shoes, and secondhand clothing.
To increase the size of their businesses, the members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They are on their second group loan.
Batoma, sitting in front of the two plastic buckets in the photo, sells peanut paste.
She intends to use her loan to buy 150 kg of peanuts at the Koutiala market from the producers, and then transform it into paste. She sells her peanut paste at retail and in cash at home and at the market to a clientele composed mainly of women.
Whereas the other members of the Sabaly group intend to realize an average monthly profit of 120,000 FCFA each over the course of the loan, Ms. Batoma intends to realize 130,000 FCFA a month.
In addition to repaying their loans, the group members will use a portion of their income to pay for their personal expenses and increase their capital.

loans.use: To buy peanuts to make and sell peanut paste.

loans.name: Sabougnouma 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA 6 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Nagnassoni, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé a été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est  le sorgho avec   Maimouna debout au milieu.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et payer les frais de labours pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group SABOUGNOUMA 6 are married women averaging 39 years of age and three children each all living in polygamous families in Nagnassoni, a village in SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution. The past loan was indeed repaid.

The crop grown is sorghum, as is the case with Maimouna, who is standing in the middle of the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs and to cover the cost of plowing to maintain one hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold at the village and at the SIKASSO market to a customer base composed of men and women. Maimouna plans on making an average profit of 95,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and to cover the costs of plowing

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Danaya est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Darsalam I de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans, sont mariées et mère d’au moins 2 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les produits cosmétiques, les pagnes, des condiments, du lait en poudre, du couscous, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de groupe.  Tiguida  est un membre du groupe Danaya, première assise devant  son seau de pâte d’arachide.        
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des sacs d’arachide qu’elle fera transformer en pâte avant de les revendre.  Elle se procure de ses sacs d’arachide au grand marché de Koutiala. Elle vend sa pâte d’arachide en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché à une clientèle diverse et variée, Elle est très sollicitée et appréciée à Koutiala et environs. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 142 500CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Tiguida  compte réaliser 150 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Danaya is a group of women from the Darsalam I district in the city of Koutiala. They know each other well, and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They average 34 years of age, are married and are mothers to least two children. This group of women sells sundry items such as cosmetics, pagnes [traditional cloth wraps], vegetables for making sauces, powdered milk, couscous, etc. To increase the size of their ventures, the members decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their fourth group loan.

Tiguida is a member of Danaya, pictured sitting behind her bucket of peanut paste.  She plans to use her loan to buy bags of peanuts that she will make into a paste for resale. She purchases bags of peanuts at the large market in Koutiala, and sells her paste for cash by retailing to a diverse and varied clientele, both at her home and at the market.  She is highly sought after and valued in Koutiala and the surrounding areas. While the other group members expect to make an average monthly income of 142,500 francs CFA each during this cycle, Tiguida hopes to earn 150,000 francs CFA.  In addition to the repayment of loans, they use a portion of their income to meet personal expenses and to increase their business capital.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et 4 enfants, les cinq femmes du groupe Sabougnouma habitent toutes dans le quartier Bougoula hameau de la ville de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de leurs activités professionnelles.  
Elles  font de la vente de savons, de  céréales et de la fabrication  et vente de Sounbala. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe intègrent Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 9ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Korotoumou, debout au milieu, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 20 cartons de savon.  Elle s’approvisionne sur place  et ensuite fait ses ventes en ambulant et à domicile, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Madame Korotoumou compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de  50.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer
texts.en:
The five members of the Sabougnouma group are all married women, living mainly in traditional families and averaging 39 years of age with four children. They all live in the Bogoula settlement of the town of Skiasso (the third administrative district of Mali) and know each other as relatives and neighbors or through their business.

They sell soap and cerealsand also make sounbala [traditional spicy seasoning] for sale.
With the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members have joined Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their ninth solidarity loan.
Mrs. Korotoumou, standing in the middle, plans to use her loan to buy 20 boxes of soap. She stocks up locally and then sells out of her home and as a street vendor, to a customer base composed of both men and women. Thanks to this loan, Mrs. Korotoumou plans to achieve a monthly revenue of 50,000 West African francs, which will be used to reinvest in her business and cover some household expenses.

loans.use: to buy soap.

loans.name: Kankele Group

texts.fr:
Kankele est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Darsalam I de la ville de Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans, sont mariées et mère d’au moins 2 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les produits cosmétiques, les pagnes, les condiments alimentaires, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt de groupe, après avoir correctement remboursés les huit précédents.  
Awa, debout à l’extrême bout avec une écharpe bleue est un membre du groupe Kankele qui fait le commerce d’habits et de cosmétiques.        
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des colis d’habillements pour les revendre en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à la maison et au marché à une clientèle diverse et variée. Elle est très sollicitée appréciée à Koutiala et environs. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Koutiala auprès des ghanéens.
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 158.750 FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Awa  compte réaliser 210.000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement du prêt, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter leurs fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Kankele is a group of women from the Darsalam I district in Koutiala City. They live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. The women average 38 years of age, and they are married mothers of at least two children each. This group of women does commerce in a variety of goods, such as cosmetics, 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), condiments, etc.

To increase the size of their businesses, the group members decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their ninth group loan after having correctly repaid the eight previous ones. 

Awa, who is standing at the far right and wearing a blue scarf, is a member of the group Kankele and does commerce in clothing and cosmetics. She intends to use her loan to purchase packs of clothing to sell retail, for cash or on credit, at the house and at the market. Her customer base is diverse and varied. She is much in demand and highly appreciated among Ghanaians at the big market of Koutiala. 

While the other group members each plan to make an average monthly profit 158,750 francs CFA over the course of the cycle, Awa plans on making 210,000 francs. In addition to repaying the loan, the women use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase their business capital.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 2 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
Trabalha como auxiliar administrativa. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar um fogão a gás, para a sua casa. 
No futuro deseja melhorar as condições da sua casa e mobilar e progredir profissionalmente, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar com mais empenho para que seja promovida.
texts.en:
She's married and has two children who attend school. She lives with her family in a house she owns and doesn't support anyone else.
She works as an administrative assistant. With the current loan she intends to purchase a gas cooker for her home.
In the future she wishes to improve the conditions of her house and to advance professionally. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is working harder in order to get promoted.

loans.use: to purchase a gas cooker for her home.

loans.name: Americo

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
Trabalha como técnico de manutenção numa empresa privada. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, chapas de zinco, portas, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja crescer profissionalmente na empresa e melhorar as condições de vida da sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é concluir a sua casa e adquirir uma viatura para o transporte pessoal.
texts.en:
He's married and has three children who attend school. He lives with his family in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else.
He works as a service technician for a private company. With the current loan he intends to purchase construction supplies (cement, zinc sheets, doors, etc.) in order to continue building his house.
In the future he wishes to grow professionally within the company and to improve his family's living conditions. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge he faces is finishing his house and purchasing a vehicle for personal transportation.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, zinc sheets, doors, etc.) in order to continue building his house.

loans.name: Cardoso

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 2 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta a sua mãe que vive com ele. 	
Trabalha como estofador num negócio próprio de fabrico e venda de móveis. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (napa, madeira, elásticos, linhas, e outros) para o fabrico de sofás. 
No futuro deseja desenvolver mais a sua actividade e abrir uma loja de venda de mobiliário, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de clientes para adquirir o produto devido a grande concorrência.
texts.en:
He's married and has two children who attend school. He lives with his family in a house he owns and also supports his mother who lives with him.
He works as upholsterer in his own business of making and selling furniture. Withe the current loan he intends to purchase supplies (napa leather, wood, elastic bands, thread, etc.) for manufacturing sofas.
In the future he wishes to further develop his business and to open a furniture store. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge he faces is the lack of customers to buy his products, due to high competition.

loans.use: to purchase supplies (napa leather, wood, elastic bands, thread, etc.) for manufacturing sofas.

loans.name: Inacio

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos dos quais 2 frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
É serralheiro e trabalha por conta própria. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, portas, aros, janelas, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja terminar a sua casa e ampliar a sua oficina aumentando a quantidade de máquinas de trabalho e oficializar o seu matrimónio, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a dificuldades financeiras e melhorar as condições de vida da sua família.
texts.en:
He's married and has three children, two of whom attend school. He lives with his family in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else.
He's a self-employed locksmith. With the current loan he intends to purchase construction supplies (zinc sheets, doors, window frames, etc.) in order to continue building his house.
In the future he intends to finish building his home and to expand his shop by increasing the number of machines he uses in his work. He also wishes to make his marriage official. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge he faces is financial hardships and improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (zinc sheets, doors, window frames, etc.) in order to continue building his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a toilet, water pipes, cinderblocks, cement, rebar and sand to build sanitary services and a bathroom.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 2 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais 3 primos que vivem com ele.
É pintor conhecido a bastante tempo. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, janelas, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a melhoria da sua casa.
No futuro espera oficializar o matrimónio com a sua esposa, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a dificuldade financeira e se tornar num grande artista plástico a nível nacional e Internacional.
texts.en:
He's married and has two children who attend school. He lives with his family in a house he owns and also supports three cousins who live with him.
He has been a well-known painter for a long time. With the current loan he intends to purchase construction supplies (cement, iron, windows, sand, etc.) in order to continue improving his home.
In the future he hopes to make his marriage to his wife official. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge he faces is financial hardships and becoming a great artist on both a national and an international level.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, iron, windows, sand, etc.) in order to continue improving his home.

loans.name: Guillermo Enrique

texts.es:
Don Guillermo tiene la edad de 58 años, casado, de oficio carpintero, padre de seis hijos, cinco casados y una soltera y trabaja en zona franca, Guillermo cuenta con su propia camioneta el cual compro con ahorros de su trabajo, y comienza a trabajarla en acarreo eso le permite poder tener otro ingreso que ayude a solventar los gastos básicos del hogar, alimentos, medicinas y el apoyo a sus hijos.
Guillermo ha venido mejorando su vivienda con estos financiamientos que ha logrado en Afodenic, por este medio, ya que los materiales están ah altos costos, hoy con este nuevo préstamo comprara: veinte laminas de zinc, diez perlines, cemento, arena, para terminar el techo, y cerrar los lados , logrando una mejor vivienda, seguridad e higiene para su familia.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 58 years old and is a carpenter by trade. He is married and the father of six children, five of whom are married, and one who is single and works in the tax free zone. 

Guillermo has his own truck, bought with savings from his work. He uses it for hauling, which allows him to have another source of income to help pay for basic household expenses, food, medicine and support for his children.

Guillermo has been improving his home with financing from Afodenic. Since materials are costly, with this new loan he will buy: 20 zinc sheets, 10 metal bars, cement and sand to finish the roof and close off the walls. By this means, he will achieve a better home, security and hygiene for his family.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets, metal bars, cement and sand to finish the roof and part of the side walls.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 39-year-old married man with three children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He is a teacher by profession and has been teaching for seventeen years. He would like to educate his children up to the university level and complete building his residential house. Moses wants a loan to buy cement, iron sheets, sand and bricks for building.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron sheets, sand and bricks for building his home.

loans.name: Jose Vicente

texts.es:
Don Jose Vicente de 50 años de edad, trabaja en conjunto con su esposa y sus hijos mayores los cuales colaboran en todos los quehaceres de la unidad de produccion, Don Jose Vicente es reconocido como un hombre responsable y trabajador, su principal actividad economica es el manejo de su inventario ganadero en conjunto con la realizacion de actividades agricolas que son su principal fuente de ingreso para el bien comun y del nucleo familiar, lo poco que ha hecho en su parcela le cuesta sacrificio y prentende continuar en la lucha para que a su familia no falte el pan de cada dia.

solicita este financiamiento para compra de vaquillas lo que le permitira incrementar su inventario ganadero, teniendo como objetivo incrementar la produccion lactea y mejorar sus ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Don Jose Vicente is 50 years.  He works with his wife and older children on his farm and together they accomplish all the things they need to do.  Jose Vicente is known as a responsible and hard working man.  

His principle form of income is cattle ranching as well as working his farm, all of which goes to the well-being of his family.  He works hard to farm his small amount of land and he will continue to work so that his family continues to have bread everyday.  

He is asking for this loan in order to buy young bulls in order to increase the number of cattle, with the intention of increasing the output of milk and therefore make more profits.

loans.use: to buy bulls to increase his cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to continue building a concrete wall in front of her house

loans.name: Aurora De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Doña Aurora tiene la edad de 44 años, comerciante de venta de ropa y sandalias, es madre de una hija, el cual estudia en la universidad, ha salido adelante sola, ya que separo de su compañero.
Su negocio lo inicio con fondos propios de ahorro de su trabajo como domestica, en Costa Rica, pues le toco viajar por varios años, ya que todo está difícil aquí en la capital, fueron días bastante cansado y nostálgicos, pero se siente contenta ya que pudo recoger una parte para la mejora de su casa y la otra para su pequeño negocio. Hoy atravez del financiamiento en Afodenic, podrá hacer divisiones de concretos internas, para una mejor seguridad, privacidad de su familia. materiales a comprar: bloque, arena, cemento, hierro y comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Aurora is 44 years old and works selling clothing and sandals.  She is the mother of one daughter who studies at the university.  She has gotten ahead on her own now that she has separated from her partner.  She began her business with her own savings from her work as a maid in Costa Rica, where she traveled for a few years to work because everything is difficult here in the capital.  Those days were quite tiring and she felt nostalgic, but she feels content that she could save a bit for improving her house and put the rest towards her small business.  

Today, thanks to financing from Afodenic, Aurora will be able to build concrete walls inside her house. This will provide better security and privacy for her family.  The materials she needs to buy to begin the work are blocks, sand, cement, and iron.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building internal walls

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Elieth De Los Angeles

texts.es: Elieth tiene la edad de 25 años, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres, trabaja como asistente administrativo en una empresa constructora, ha tenido el apoyo moral y económico de sus padres, es por tal razón, ahora que se ha estabilizado con su trabajo comenzara hacer las mejoras a su casa, ya que es de condición muy sencilla. El cual hará esta obra con financiamientos otorgado en Afodenic, al ser a plazos accesibles, comenzara por su cuarto al poder hacerlo de concreto, ya que es de láminas de zinc, teniendo seguridad y una mejor higiene. Materiales a comprar. Bloques, cemento, arena, hierro, para comenzar la construcción.
texts.en:
Elieth is 25 years old. She is single and lives with her parents. She works as an administrative assistant in a construction company. She has had the moral and financial support of her parents, which why she is now stable in her career and will begin to make improvements to their home, which is a very basic construction.
 
She plans to finance the construction through loans from Afodenic and will repay using an affordable payment plan. She will begin by constructing her room in concrete since it is currently made of sheets of zinc, resulting in better security and hygiene. To start construction she needs to purchase cinder blocks, cement, sand, and iron.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials like cinder blocks, cement, and sand to begin building concrete room.

loans.name: Silvia Filomena

texts.es:
Silvia, sigue ofreciendo su servicio en belleza, oficio que aprendió desde su juventud, y que con los años ha crecido en inventario, ha puesto venta de ropa nueva, cosméticos, mejorado su vivienda, toda esta mejora la ah logrado con dinero que sus hijos mandan en remesa, sus ganancias y financiamiento en Afodenic, lo que ha podido hacer en corto plazo.En su  salón tiene dos personas trabajando, hoy en día vive solo con un hijo casado.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo, cambiara puerta de madera, instalara cielo raso, y la electricidad, en la parte que tiene el salón, para dar un mejor ambiente, mejor servicio de higiene. Silvia esta satisfecha al poder hacer esta mejora, que le dará, mejores beneficios a la captación de clientes nuevos al ser remodelado.
texts.en:
Silvia continues to offer beauty services, a trade she learned in her youth. Over the years she has expanded its inventory and has added the sale of new clothing and cosmetics. She also improved her housing. All this improvement has been achieved with money her children have sent as remittance, her earnings, and financing from Afodenic, which has been done in a short period. She has two people working in her beauty salon. Now she lives with just one married son. 

Today with this new loan, she will change a wooden door and install a ceiling and electricity in the part where her beauty salon is in for a better atmosphere and improved hygiene. Silvia is pleased to be able to make this improvement which will give her better benefits to attract new customers upon being remodelled.

loans.use: to buy a ceiling to install over part of the beauty salon, a wooden door, and a cable for electricity

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
This is Regina, She previously accessed an 13,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan of 30,000 PHP for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Regina hopes that her business will continue to be successful. It is also her desire to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
 
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her variety store, and to buy more rice cakes and frozen meat.

loans.name: La Hermandad Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú! Les presento al grupo La Hermandad

Arturo es el presidente del grupo  lo conforma cerca de 05 años. El es casado con  02 hijos, su oficio es la carpintería y se dedica a esto aproximadamente 20 años, este oficio lo aprendió en el colegio y poco a poco fue perfeccionándose, hasta lograr ser uno de los mejores en el rubro; fue así que monto un pequeño taller en su casa donde realiza diversos trabajos como la fabricación de vitrinas, roperos, sillas, puertas etc. gracias a este trabajo puede mantener a su familia y darle a sus hijos una buena educación. Sus préstamo han sido un gran apoyo para  incrementar su taller con la compra de  herramientas, en esta oportunidad lo utilizara  para la compra de materiales como madera y melanina para así poder cumplir con los trabajos pendientes, algo que está deseoso por cumplir es la ampliación de su taller para poder mejorar su trabajo y mantener a sus clientes contentos.
¡Arturo agradece el apoyo a quienes hacen posible el préstamo  a su grupo comunal!

*El Sr.Arturo esta sentado,viste polo crema con rayas y utiliza lentes.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru!  We would like to introduce you to the "La Hermandad" ("The Brotherhood") group.

Arturo is the president of this group, which he established almost 5 years ago.  He is married with two sons, and his profession is carpentry, in which he has worked for approximately 20 years.  He learned this trade in school, and little by little he has perfected it, becoming one of the best carpenters in the area.  This is how he came to set up a small workshop at his house where he does various jobs, such as manufacturing display cabinets, wardrobes, chairs, doors, etc.  Thanks to this job, he can support his family and give his children a good education.  

This loan will be a great help so that Arturo can expand his workshop with the purchase of new tools.  He will also use this opportunity to buy materials like wood and melamine, so that he can complete his pending jobs.  He also wants to expand his business in order to improve his work and keep his customers happy.  Arturo is grateful for this help and for those who make this loan possible for his communal group.

*Arturo is seated, wearing the white striped polo shirt and glasses in the photo.

loans.use: to buy wood and melamine

loans.name: Filomena

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 1 filho que frequenta a Escola, vive com a sua mãe e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É negociante e dona do negócio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, pedra, areia, e outros), para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa.
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e conseguir um emprego, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o pagamento devido do empréstimo e ampliar o seu negócio.
texts.en:
She's single and has a son who attends school. She lives with her mother and doesn't support anyone else.
She's a trader who runs her own business selling essential goods. With this loan she intends to purchase construction supplies (cement, iron, rocks, sand, etc.) in order to continue building her house.
In the future she hopes to finish building her home and to get a job. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is repaying the loan as scheduled and expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, iron, rocks, sand, etc.) in order to continue building her house.

loans.name: Henry Isaias

texts.es: El señor Henry Habitante de Masaya, Acompañado tiene un hijo, labora para una empresa privada en Managua y su compañera es comerciante entre los dos han hido luchando dia a dia para tener mejores condicones y cumplir su sueño Tener su casa propia , con este financiamiento ellos realizaran una ampliacion a su vivienda y compraran los siguientes Materiales: Hierro, Cemento, Zinc, Arena y Piedrin con esto  su casa tendra  mejor apariencia y poco a poco la hira mejorando. Agradecido por el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kivas le estan brindando y sobre todo por la confianza que le estan dando.
texts.en:
Henry is a resident of Masaya. He has a partner and one son. He works for a private business in Managua. His partner is a merchant and together they are striving day by day to improve their circumstances and achieve their dream: owning their own house. 

With this loan, they will complete an addition to their house and purchase the following materials: iron, cement, zinc, sand, and gravel. With these materials, the house will have a better appearance and little by little they will continue to improve upon it. 

Henry is grateful for the support that AFODENIC and Kiva is offering, and above all the trust they give him.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as iron, cement, zinc, and sand.

loans.name: San Luis  (Paute) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal San Luís está formado por 9 socias y 1 socio quienes viven por el cantón Paute, lugar que tiene un clima privilegiado en el cual se da todo tipo de frutas, por su clima templado sus tierras son propicias para la floricultura de donde se exportan las más hermosas flores, su gastronomía es muy variada,  su gente es amble, gentil y de un corazón cálido, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Isabel, es socia del banco comunal San Luís, encontrándose en el grupo hace un año y medio, vive por la comunidad de Uzhupud, tiene 68 años de edad, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha procreado 5 hijos quienes ahora son mayores de edad, casados y viven independientes, vive en compañía de una nieta a quien la crio como una hija más desde que tenía 2 meses de edad y ahora  está por cumplir los 5 años de edad, tenía su casa propia la cual la ha perdido ya que estaba muy deteriorada por el paso de los años y ahora vive en una casa prestada.
 
La Señora María Isabel para sacarle en adelante a su nieta se dedica a la cría y venta de  pollos y cuyes, actividad que le da el tiempo para pasar en casa al cuidado de su nieta. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos, alimento para sus animales y abono para mejorar sus potreros.
 
Su mayor sueño es tener salud y fuerzas para sacarle adelante a su nieta.

Las dos fotos pequeñas son de una socia y un socio que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The San Luís communal bank has 9 female members and 1 male member who live in the Paute canton, a place that has a privileged climate which yields all types of fruits.  The temperate climate of these lands is favorable for growing flowers, the most beautiful of which are exported.  The gastronomy is very diverse, the people are kind, gentle and of a good heart, and they still maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.

One of the members of this group is María Isabel.  She is a member of the San Luís communal bank, and became a part of this group a year and a half ago.  She lives in the community of Uzhupud, is 68 years old and is a widow.  Her marriage produced 5 children that are now older, married and living independently.  She lives in the company of a granddaughter whom she raised like a daughter from 2 months of age, and who now is almost 5 years old.  She had her own house which she lost, as it was very deteriorated from the passing of the years.  She now lives in a rented house.

In order to help her granddaughter get ahead, María Isabel works raising and selling chickens and guinea pigs. This business allows her to spend time in the house taking care of her granddaughter. She will use her new loan to purchase pigs, animal feed, and manure to improve her pastures. Her greatest dream is to be healthy and to do all she can to help her granddaughter succeed.
 
The two small photos are of a female and a male member who could not be present when the photo of the group was taken.

loans.use: to buy pigs, animal feed, and manure

loans.name: Genngai Lom Group

texts.en:
Kimboilhing (the lady who raised her hand in the photo) is 34 years of age and her husband is a daily wage labourer who does all kinds of odd jobs to meet the family’s expenses. They have three school-going children. 

She dreamed of having her own house. So, she borrowed a loan from WSDS, and with that amount she purchased a loin (loin loom, a kind of backstrap loom) and started weaving traditional attire, mostly women’s clothing. 

Kimboilhing plays an active role in sending her children to school. Now she wants to avail another loan to continue her business and ultimately build her own house.

loans.use: to buy loins for weaving. (A loin loom is a kind of backstrap loom.)

loans.name: Angel Encarnacion

texts.es: Don Angel de 52 años de edad, es casado, su esposa es ama de casa, el se encarga de proveer todo lo necesario para el hogar. Trabaja como gerente de un sucursal del banco desde hace 3 años, ha salido adelante con esfuerzos propios, se carateriza por ser una persona honrada, trabajadora y con un alto espiritu de superacion. Solicita el credito para la compra de una motocicleta que le ayudara para la movilizacion en su trabajo.  su prioridad en este momento es su medio de transporte ya que agilizará el movimiento en su trabajo, pues estas motos son economicas y practicas. Su mayor sueño es mantener su famili unida y con salud.
texts.en:
Don Angel is 52 years old and married.  His wife is a homemaker and he provides all of the necessities for the household.  For the past 3 years, he has worked as a branch manager at a bank and has also come out ahead in many of his own endeavors.  He characterizes himself as an honorable, hardworking person with a strong spirit of self-improvement.  

He is requesting this loan to purchase a motorcycle that will help him get to work.  At the moment, his mode of transportation is his priority since it will speed up his commute to work, and these motorcycle are also economical and practical.  

HIs dream is to keep his family together and healthy.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to get to work.

loans.name: Dias

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 5 filhos dos quais 4 frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
É negociante e dono do próprio negócio de venda de produtos diversos. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar mercadoria (óleo, feijão, arroz, vinhos, refrescos e outros) para aumentar e diversificar a sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e construir um aviário e melhorar as condições de vida da sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o elevado custo de vida e a insuficiência de fundos.
texts.en:
He's married and has five children, four of whom attend school. He lives with his family in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else.
He's a trader who runs his own business selling various products. With the current loan he intends to purchase goods (cooking oil, beans, rice, wine, refreshments, etc.) in order to stock up and diversify his merchandise.
In the future he wishes to finish his house, build an aviary and improve his family's living conditions. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge he faces is the high cost of living and the lack of funds.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (cooking oil, beans, rice, wine, refreshments, etc.).

loans.name: Judith Simona

texts.es: La Sra. Judith de 57 años de edad, es soltera, actualmente vive sola en su casa de habitacion. Trabaja como facilitadora Pedagogica para Aldeas SOS. Solicita el credito para la cosntruccion de un sumidero e instalacion de inodoro en el patio trasero de su casa, esto le servira para mejorar su calidad de vida ya que es una señora que vive sola y esta pensando en mejorar su casa para tener mayores facilidades para cuando este de mayor edad. Ella ha sido clienta de afodenic quien ha pagado excelente y ha aprovechado estos creditos para mejorar su vivienda, por lo que continua en la lucha hasta ver terminada la casa que es su mayor sueño.
texts.en:
Judith is 57 years old, single, and these days lives alone in her home. She works as a teaching facilitator for Aldeas SOS [an orphan and abandoned children’s charity]. 

She is requesting the loan to construct a drain and install a toilet in the back patio of her house. This will help to improve her quality of life since she is now a woman who lives alone, and is thinking of improving her home to have better facilities for when she is older. 

She has been a client of Afodenic who has been excellent in her payments. She has taken advantage of these loans to improve her house, so she will continue to fight until she sees her house finished, which is her greatest dream.

loans.use: to construct a drain and install a toilet

loans.name: Al-Dlal Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-dlal and consists of five ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen.

Muna, a member of the group, is a 30-year-old married woman (seated in the photograph). She is a housewife. 

Muna is applying for a youth loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase a fridge. She aspires to have a sewing store to gain profits so she has the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge for personal use

loans.name: Margarida

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 3 filhos todos frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
Trabalha como bombeira a bastante tempo. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (portas, cimento, ferro, areia, e outros), para dar continuidade a obra da sua residência.
No futuro deseja terminar a sua casa e construir um murro de vedação para dar conforto e segurança a sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a dificuldade financeira e o pagamento devido do empréstimo.
texts.en:
She's married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She lives with her family in a house she owns and doesn't support anyone else.
She has worked as a firefighter for a long time. With the current loan she intends to purchase construction supplies (doors, cement, iron, sand, etc.) in order to continue building her home.
In the future she wishes to finish building her house and to build a surrounding wall, so she can provide her family with comfort and safety. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is financial hardships and repaying the loan according to the schedule.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (doors, cement, iron, sand, etc.) in order to continue building her home.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras está formado por 14 mujeres quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la Ciudad de Cuenca, son amigas y conocidas quienes han conformado un ambiente de amistad y solidaridad ya que se apoyan mutuamente, cada una labora en distintas actividades las mismas que le permiten generar ingresos para su hogar, son muy carismáticas, gentiles y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven en Cuenca ciudad que esta bañada por 4 ríos los que le dan el nombre de la Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su clima es frió.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Narcisa, este es el quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca por el sector de Monay, tiene 41 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 23, 18, 15 y 7 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en la universidad, su tercer hijo está estudiando en el colegio y su ultimo hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es chofer profesional y labora prestando sus servicios profesionales con un taxi que es de su propiedad, la casa en la que viven es propia siendo el fruto de su esfuerzo y trabajo conyugal.

La Señora Narcisa además de dedicarse al cuidado de su hogar también se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 20 años, trabaja solo en días de ferias sin un horario fijo. También es una profesional en el estilismo ya que ha estudiado, ahora presta sus servicios en un gabinete los fines de semana y esta actividad la está desempeñando hace 5 años. 

Este nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para tener más variedad de mercadería y así tener más clientes. 

Su meta es  tener su propio gabinete de belleza.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando de tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Luchadoras [Fighting Women] is made up of 14 women who live in different parts of the city of Cuenca. They are friends and acquaintances that have formed an atmosphere of friendship, solidarity, and mutual support. Each works in different businesses that allow them to generate income for their homes. They are very charismatic, kind, and still maintain the culture and traditions of their people. They live in Cuenca, a city bathed by four rivers which has given it the name Santa Ana of the four rivers [the official name of the city]. Since December 1999 Cuenca has been a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The climate is cold. 

One member of this group is Narcisa. This is the fifth loan she has had with the communal bank. She lives in the area of Cuenca called Monay, she is 41 years old, married, and has four children aged 23, 18, 15, and 7. Her first two children are in university, her third child is in high school, and her last child is in primary school in the city. Her husband is a professional driver and works providing his professional services with his own taxi. The house they live in is their own and is the fruit of their hard work and joint effort.
